The tea sandwiches were very fresh, tasty and generous,(  which is not true everywhere). I was a bit disappointed that the curried chicken sandwiches raved about in other reviews, were not on the menu that day.The special flavor teas were a little too fru-fru for me. I'd have preferred a high quality Assam or Celyon tea, which didn't seem to be on offer. (For my taste, lavender does not belong in tea or food!) 
We didn't leave hungry with all the scones and stuff (no clotted cream though) . I really liked the spiced apple butter, an extra. But the $90 tab for 2 (including tax & tip) could have bought a really nice dinner for 2.
author: Joy L.

description:
I've been dying to try this place out, and I was not disappointed when I finally got the chance to on Sunday!

My friend and I made a reservation for 3pm, and they were very nice about it when I had to push it back last minute. I do have to say though, when I arrived at Dartealing, I had to wait quite a bit before getting my seat even though I could clearly see available seating for two.

The inside was super cute! Creating the perfect atmosphere for a gathering with girlfriend or a date.

We got the Covent Garden Tea and the Bloomsbury Full Tea, and I think we got a good mix of savory and salty (mostly because of the sandwiches we picked). For tea, I knew I wanted something rose-based, and got the Debutante Ball. Absolutely loved it!
author: Vivian W.

description: Cute place. I loved how relaxed the ambience was. There was no wait and we stayed for almost 2 hours because there was no pressure to get out of there. The bottomless tea is awesome. We got 2 teas but only really kept asking for the Caramel Carousel. With sugar and milk this blend is so intoxicating. The desserts were nice but I could have completely done without the sandwiches.
author: Jane H.

description:
Had a not so pleasant experience here. The tea, atmosphere, and food was good. The service however was another story. 

Came on Mother's Day. Waited at the front a good 10 minutes and no workers in sight. No greeting. No I'll be right with you. Was already kind of turned off. I almost wanted to walk into the kitchen to get some help. No one came out for a while to seat us and it wasn't busy. Even the people who were seated didn't get checked on. 

Got seated. No one came back for 15 more minutes to even get us started on tea or WATER for that matter. No one checked in on us to see if we had questions. We had to flag someone down. Even said excuse me to get someone's attention the first time around and she kept walking...

During the actual tea service wasn't checked on really. Just once. They even forgot one of our menu items off the queens tea. Had to ask for it, was annoyed at that. It's like we had to force people to help us out. Mind you at the time we came in it was not yet busy. The food and tea itself took forever to come out.... took my mom here for mothers day and was pretty embarrassed. It was supposed to be fun for us. Really disappointed...

Really wanted to love this adorable tea room. But my first impression was really horrid for Mother's Day. I won't be back.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Lovely place for afternoon tea in the heart of the city. This is one of my favorite tea rooms that I have checked out so far. I have visited here twice and both times were very enjoyable. This review is for the second visit. 

My friend and I stopped by while walking through the neighborhood. We were seated once we walked in. The place was quiet, servers are knowledgeable and don't rush you-but are there if you need anything. I went with the black rose tea and my friend had Georgia peach. Both were delicious and in a generous size pot. We just ordered a selection of 6 desserts (although I have had the mini sandwiches before which are delicious and cute).

Overall, this is a great environment to share catching up with someone, with a nice selection for tea, lunch, and bite sized sweets.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Feels like you stepped into a fairy tale really party - super cute decor including perfectly mismatched tea cups, saucers and teapots.
The service is a little inattentive (though, honestly you don't really go for afternoon tea if you're in a rush).
We had the High Tea option. Savory scones were great, tea sandwiches were tasty (ham & gruyere, and bacon & cheese, though they had several options). I could have lived without the crumpet.. It was fine but reminded me a little of a nice version of a frozen waffle.
One thing I found very disappointing though - the high tea does not come with the traditional scones with clotted cream and jam! I'm not totally sure if it's an option but I was a little let down that it wasn't a part of the high tea option.
author: Mallika M.

description:
It's a well decorated European style afternoon tea place that makes you feel awesome as a girl, and someone with a great taste.

Come here for Japanese-style mayo /
spicy chipotle / red curry sandwiches with turkey, tuna and more. A rare finding of the white bread "wedges" if you know what I am talking about. 

The red lantern (to be discontinued because the grower stopped supplying it), three types of earl grey ... This is a tea place where you can learn something about the traditional a as well as unique blends.

Conveniently located in downtown, mellow, good taste, affordable. A great place for a simple lunch and afternoon chat
author: Dilys S.

description: I came here for a bridal shower and absolutely loved it. Interior is very cute and the food is delicious. I love the mixed tea cups and painted dishes they use for the dishware. I highly recommend this location for any types of special events as the staff were wonderful.
author: Alice H.

description:
Cutest little place to enjoy afternoon tea with the girls. It's a bit hard to find this place, even though it's centrally located, but when you do, just know you've found a city gem. From the traditional tea cups to the unique teas and quaint space, this tea lounge is a great place to relax and unwind, or just chill with friends for a fun afternoon. But be forewarned: reservations are recommended for parties greater than two. I was lucky enough to wander (or rather, stumble) into this place while recovering from an impending food coma from brunch, and just had to make some room to try this place. But don't rely on luck alone: make s reservation to ensure a spot before you go so you don't miss out!

Likes:
-unique teas that are delicious
-variety of high tea options
-tea sandwiches are pretty good (and substitutes are allowed, for those with dietary restrictions)
-relatively close to public transportation
-clotted cream: need I say more?
-dessert options are pretty good
-ambiance is great for a relaxing day with friends, or just to enjoy for some solo "me" time

Dislikes:
-I just wish this place was open a bit longer during the day
-sorry folks, but don't expect any city views or vistas (but rest assured, the tea experience will
make up for it!)
author: Tracy T.

description:
The service is pretty slow but they are very nice. I thought the tea sandwiches were good, nice selection on menu, desserts were so so, and teas weren't that great. The green teas were not strong enough no matter how long we steeped it.

Not sure if I would come back her again.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
This place is now my favorite for afternoon tea service in the city! I came twice in two weekends because I enjoyed my first experience so much that I brought my mom the second time to relive the experience with her again :)

About a 10-15 minute walk from Downtown & MUNI/BART, area is not sketchy (as its in the SOMA - I mean, you might see a bum sleeping on your way here but eh), and if you park on a non-game day, it should be pretty easy to find.

Literally looks like a British grandma's living room (in a cute and quaint way!). Perfect environment for high tea. A mixture of larger and smaller tables. They don't get too crowded, but it's safer to make reservations. I was able to walk in on a Sunday around 12:30.

Service is great here! They're really attentive and helpful if you have any questions. Someone's always around to help.. sometimes at other places, I feel like the workers disappear or are just kind of idle.. when they refill your tea, they even add some tea leaves (not JUST hot water) so that your tea stays flavorful. Big plus!

I was here with my mom for about 2-3 hours and they refilled our tea 2-3 times. Didn't feel rushed at all.

FOOD & TEA:
I recommend getting the rare teas (just fork up the extra $3!!) because they are really quite special.. I had some of the standard teas and they just taste.. standard.
My favorite I think is the Breakfast Candy (almond & caramel undertones). The Jasmine Mist (muscat!) was really beautiful as well.

Overall the food is really good as well. In a nutshell: sandwiches are great, scones are just OK, and desserts are decent - (I actually like the shortbread cookies the most vs the macarons, cakes, and tarts)
Sandwiches are moist and super flavorful. I had a variety of 'flavors' and I honestly really loved them all!  My favorites were curry chicken and brie + green apple, though I think it is really about preference.

The timing for food is pretty good, tea comes in a timely manner a bit after you order, sandwiches maybe about 15 minutes after your tea -- and then they time dessert based on when you seem full from the sandwiches.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Already recommended to a coworker and will probably continue to sing their praise for a while. And their prices aren't bad either, about $20-25 per person which is on par or even cheaper than other places.

The only minor point is that it gets warm in here since the place is relatively small and the kitchen is near the back - but they do try to keep it cool by opening the doors and having fans. Maybe the caffeine from drinking all the tea too :P
author: Emily C.

description:
This place is awesome! It's a bit tucked away on 3rd street but it's an absolute gem! The 'Covent Garden Tea for 2' had the appropriate portions for 2 people; I wouldn't recommend sharing a serving for one between two people unless you're mixing and matching services. With the Covent Garden you get sandwiches! I picked the cucumber and the chicken curry sandwich which I would highly recommend! Both were extremely tasty. Also, note the last seating is at 4:30 so don't miss it!

Super cute atmosphere, charming decor, great sandwiches and plenty of tea! Definitely would come here again!
author: Alex P.

description:
Went on a Sunday around 2pm for tea with some friends. I was my first time having high tea, and I can say it was a great experience! My party of 4 didn't have a reservation, but we were seated in about 15 minutes. The decor is very whimsical/boho and very from the menus to the tea pots were cute cute cute. The servers are extremely nice and help create a laid back atmosphere where you can just sit back, sip tea, and relax with friends. 

I found the menu and pricing slightly confusing. $8 for a pot of tea but there is an extra per person fee for splitting food and tea, and a $14 min. per person. The preselected high tea options seemed pretty expensive at $27 and $32 per person, so my friends and I opted to share the Petit Sweets Melange and Heritage Scones. The scones were warm and delicious, we all agreed the lavender flavored scones were our favorite. The Petit Sweets allows you to choose from an assortment of cakes, macarons, and pastries- they are definitely very petit desserts but its a good option if you want to sample a bit of everything. Would recommend the Yo Holmes, it's Watson black tea and the Ginger, Lemongrass green tea.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
My friend and i made reservations here in advance for our girls days out.   I'm not sure was because of the Giants game but the places wasn't as packed as i imagined.   We ordered the tea service for two which include 8 sandwiches, 2 scones, 2 sausage rolls and desserts.  They had huge tea selection, but we ended up sharing a pot of the Pu'Erh 101 Tea 

Their selection for sandwiches were unique, they have fish and chips which i've never seen offered at any other High tea places   This was bad, it was crunchy with a hint of mustard.  The curry chicken was good was well and as a little spicy.  I wish we weren't limited to two options when selecting the sandwiches.  The best part was the sausage roll. It's best to eat this when it's warm.   The Pu'Erh tea was strong, just how i liked it.  The pistachio macaron was good, i just wish we didn't have to share it.  Overall i would come here again.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Celebrated my birthday here for the 2nd time! Everything turned out perfect, just like the first time! 

Something new I tried from the menu was the Fish & Chips and Bacon & Eggs. All were tasty and delightful, along with the Curry and Turkey Pesto! Next was the blended teas, Cabana, Royal Earl Grey, especially Georgia on my Mind and Jasmine Green Tea were divine! The sweet treats served were the fruit tarts and raspberry pistachio short cakes... AMAZING! 
 
It was mostly everyone's first experience at a tea party set up, everyone was very impressed with the assorted vintage china and ambiance. Especially, my boyfriend!

Angela and Pauline were great with helping me coordinate this little tea party for my friends and I. Voice messages and emails were answered promptly when I informed with any changes or concerns for that day.
author: Johanna M.

description:
I should have been suspicious when this was the only tearoom I was able to get a day-of reservation for on a Saturday. Plus, the place was three-quarters empty. Despite only having a few tables, the service was non-existent and our server completely disappeared. And there was a huge wait to get sandwiches and then another to get sweets.

Plus the food was not good.

As the sandwiches went, the chicken curry and the brie and apple were fine. The ham and horseradish sandwich was passable. We left behind an apple caramel sandwich (a combination that sounded good at the time!), and also wondered what the strange white stuff was that came with it. The most egregious sin of all was the tuna nicoise. My friend took one bite of hers and was repulsed. These were not finished by anyone. They were too fishy.

Then there were the sweets. The espresso cookie was bland, the jelly-filled bar cold. The scone smelled and tasted slightly of hummus (odd), and while warm at least, was very bland. The brownie went unfinished. I have never been to a tea place where so much food was left untouched and not because we weren't hungry.

Biggest plus: I like that the menu fronts appeared to be hand-decorated. And yeah, that's the highest compliment I can pay Darjealing Lounge.

The back of restaurant was strange with stairs leading to other businesses.

There is a dearth of good tea places in the South Bay, so it was doubly depressing to finally get to go to tea in San Francisco and have such a terrible experience.

I would consider two stars but $31 per person is downright robbery for our food. The experience was so horrible we actually joke amongst our friends ("the survivors") about how this was the worst tea room ever.

Kathleen's High Tea Rankings (I may seem hard to please but I gave the first four places 5 stars):
1) Lovejoy's, San Francisco
2) The Fairmont Empress, Victoria B.C.
3) Aubrey Rose, La Mesa
4) Tea Upon Chatsworth, San Diego
5) Tyme for Tea, Fremont
6) Tea Time, Palo Alto
7) Samovar, San Francisco (Page St.)
8) Lisa's Tea Treasures, San Jose
9) Lisa's Tea Treasures, Campbell
10) DARJEALING LOUNGE, SAN FRANCISCO
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Came here on a Thursday afternoon with some friends and got the "as you wish" cream tea yelp check in deal for three teas and your choice of crumpets or scones for $25. We came with three people and because the deal was for two, we asked if we could use the deal for three. The server was very nice and told us it was possible and that we would get 4 sample pots of tea and 5 crumpets for an additional person. We asked her for some tea recommendations and felt a little overwhelmed with the tea selections. There are just so many to choose from!

We ended up ordering all different types of tea to try everything out. We got the chai black tea, a caramel tea, memoirs of Provence, and a green tea. They all tasted really bland to me. Even at the end when it seeped and got really dark, the flavors weren't very strong for any of them. I've had high tea before, and the tea definitely had stronger flavors than these. I'd have to say my least favorite tea was the memoirs of Provence, which smelled like cough syrup to all of us. If I had to pick a favorite I'd choose the green tea. 

The crumpets weren't anything special, but the lemon curd was really delicious. It came with three jams as well: fig, jalapeño, and raspberry. The jalapeño jam really had the flavor of jalapeños but it wasn't spicy.

Love how the place is decorated, but that's about it! The hostess/server was very friendly and nice as well.
author: Angel K.

description:
Planned a small surprise bridal shower here and it was perfect! The place I thought was adorable and so cute with the decor.

Our small party of three did the Dartealing Afternoon Tea for Two and the Regally Yours Sweet Tray. If you check in on Yelp, you save $8 on the tea for two! For our three sandwich choices, we chose the Dartealing chicken curry, fish and chips, and the apple/brie/pepper jelly. All of them were excellent but I think my favorite one was the curry! Then, after the sandwiches & salad, they will serve you a tray that includes a pair of warm house-baked scones and an assortment of tea cakes and tea cookies served with devonshire cream, jam, and lemon curd. Again, everything was delicious but the scones were AMAZING!!! Oh, for our two choices of teas we got the Breakfast Candy and Caramel Carousel...both were perfect!

The Regally Yours sweet tray comes with: creme brulee * NY cheesecake * white 
chocolate espresso * white chocolate * passion fruit tart * chocolate fantasy cake  
- My friends and I thought this plate was very good but we had our favorites. I remember 1-2 of them being super sweet for my taste. I really liked the cheesecake, passion fruit tart, and white chocolate espresso.

Overall, a great place for a girl get together!
author: Kristina L.

description: The perfect place to catch up with friends for hours on end, without getting a stink eye! The sandwiches were all really good too! I recommend just getting the combo tea for 2 (and if you have more than 2 people, they'll just charge you per person). The food is actually surprisingly filling that I didn't eat dinner that day, haha. The desserts were just whatever in my opinion (store brought snacks), but the scones were yummy! As for the sandwiches, we really liked the cucumber and the turkey pesto!
author: Janet H.

description:
Not enough words for this cute tea lounge!!!! I had been eyeing Dartealing Lounge for a while now, always having it on my list of places to check out and finally was able to with a close friend recently. We visited on a Sunday that happened to be a Sunday where the Blue Angels were in town, which we think might have had something to do with the fact that we basically had the whole place to ourselves for a solid 3 hours! The service was exceptional, as you can imagine being the only customers on a Sunday for that long! We ordered the tea service for 2. Which came with a few pastries, scones, 4 flavored sandwiches of your chose as well as 2 pots of tea also as your flavor of choice. Everything was absolutely delicious, and very generous on the portion sizes. The interior is decorated so incredibly adorable and authentically! My friend and I just kept ooo-ing and ahhhh-ing at everything! 

It's a really cute place that makes you feel comfortable being there the whole way through. Perfect for a girls day or mother-daughter outing. We've definitely agreed on Dartealing Lounge as a once a month event!
author: Amanda J.

description:
This was my first experience at high tea, and it was definitely not disappointing.

There was hardly a wait when we got there, which I read was not normal, since we didn't have a reservation. Following the seating, we admired the beautiful mismatched teacups and cute menus, gawked at the large selection of teas with witty names, and peeked at what the other parties were having. The place is set up with a few small tables, a few large tables, and some comfy-looking couches. We were at a table near the front, and found everything clean and cozy.

Service was a bit slow, but man was it worth it. We ordered the Covent Garden Tea for two, and had the Butler's Secret Stash and Debutante Ball. The former is a creamy, toffee-flavored black tea that is amazing with milk, and the second is a lighter green tea with a delicate rose fragrance. For sandwiches, we had the curried apple and egg (AMAZING, I was hesitant about curry+apple+egg, but I was so glad we got it), dill cucumber (I don't like dill usually, but this was pretty great), lavender honey (probably my favorite), and berry cream (very good, but probably the most lackluster of the bunch).

The crumpets may have been my favorite part- crunchy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. They bring you butter and jam, which was great on top of them. There were also lemon poppy seed cakes, two macarons, and two shortbread lavender cookies. I'm not a fan of shortbread so I didn't eat it, but apparently they were amazing.

Overall, I would definitely go here again. It's not so pricy for high tea compared to some other places, and everyone is so friendly and happy to suggest teas to try. I ended up buying 2 oz of the Debutante Ball tea, for rainy days when I need a pick-me-up.
author: Cecille Y.

description:
Visited this afternoon tea lounge on a weekday afternoon. Pretty empty , only 3 groups of customers and one server.

My friend and I ordered Covert garden tea set,4 choices of sandwiches, scone, tea cake and petite 4. We had salmon filling , BLT, fish and chips and Tuna and egg sandwiches. I really like the fish and chips sandwiches. The scone and the small tea cake were not so good. I think their savory items are better than the sweet pastries. My tea is nothing special, some regular fruit tea you can find anywhere. 

Quite an average tea experience, location is good if I am around downtown or soma and want a place to spend time with friends. But I don't think I will come back anytime soon.
author: Lu W.

description: Went to a baby shower at this place. The food was just okay compared to all the other tea places I've been to. I didn't think the service was that great either. The place is very small so it felt a bit cramped. We had 11 people and when the desserts came, they only had enough for 8 people. We were a bit shocked since all tea places make enough for everyone to have one since we are paying by per person price.
author: Cindy C.

description: Honestly took an hour for us to even get a sandwich the service was absolutely horrible. People who were seated after us were served and when we asked why our waitress lied and said they preordered. Very unprofessional. I expected to have a relaxing tea party with my mother and sister and it ended up being us waiting hours trying to flag down waitresses.  Their sandwiches probably taste like cardboard anyways.
author: Renee R.

description:
Such a cute spot! I've walked to RayKo Photo Center a stone's throw from here and never noticed DarTEAling before, but was invited to a baby shower here last weekend. It's not the biggest space, but accommodated our party of ten no problem. Bonus points for really easy parking (on the weekend at least). We were able to pick three tea flavors for the group (the cabana-something green tea was my fav!) plus had a good amount of finger sandwiches, scones (surprisingly moist and delicious), cookies, and more -- surprisingly filling. 

I will say not all of the sandwiches were the greatest: I really liked the curry chicken, but the rest were just alright (granted, I'm not a huge sandwich fan in general). Most of the other items were tasty though. I also really liked some of the items from the kids menu, because my niece didn't want them... I'm not sure what that says about me. At least, I didn't try to steal her pot of strawberry milk. :)

Overall it was really fun: the interior decor is comfortable and well done (love the dishes in the windows and glassware on shelves!). In retrospect, would not want to be here during an earthquake... Also, the staff were really attentive despite it being pretty busy the day we were there. They even did a good job of shuffling the tea pots on our table so everyone was able to try all the flavors! Who would've thought tea parties could be so enjoyable.
author: Trish A.

description: This place was pretty awesome! Good selection of teas, yummy sandwiches, and very good service! Do call ahead since they often get overbooked and won't have immediate seating for drop-ins, but worth it!
author: Betty T.

description:
hosted bridal tea party for a friend. they had enough space to accommodate our party of 10 and the decorations they have are cute and made it so that we did not have to bring many decorations of our own. went just last week so we were bound by ordering the holiday menu. food is so-so. chamomille tea we chose was mediocre and could have easily been mistaken for bagged tea i buy at safeway. green, rooibos and chai teas were good.
chose the following sandwiches:
curried chicken- general consensus was that it was good.
egg and pesto (+/- bacon)-might as well call it "mayo, egg and pesto" because i felt that the sandwich was ruined and drowned by spread of mayo. was not expecting that as part of the sandwich and maybe they should include it in the name of the sandwich if it is such a predominant ingredient.
meatball sandwich- others also said it was "good"
eggplant and hummus-mediocre. 
i think you are definitely paying for the experience of being in a cute place with adorable decor and not so much for the quality of your food. as others have also mentioned about the bathroom- it is off to the back and feels very out of place. 

we arrived and were seated 15 minutes before our 11:30 reservation. by 11:40 they had not even come to serve us our tea and when i asked if they could start our service, they gave us attitude and said that we had arrived before we were supposed to.. well it was now after our reservation and it would have been nice of them to at least acknowledge us sometime in the 25 minutes we had already been seated. 

here is my last snark-- 
through my correspondence via email with them, they were well aware that we were hosting a bridal tea party for our friend... they plopped the bill at the other end of the table where the invited guests were seated and made them feel awkward and obligated to try to pay for their meal. would have appreciated if someone had talked to one of us who were hosting to deal with the bill instead of just plopped it on the table.

would not come back.
author: j c.

description:
I am very VERY torn about how to rate Dartealing lounge. On one hand, the food was really quite good and a great value but on the other hand, the service was extremely lacking (borderline rude) and the interior is very gimmicky. 

SERVICE: As I mentioned before, the service was extremely lacking. When my party arrived for our reservation, we were flat out ignored for around 15-20 minutes. What was puzzling was that the restaurant was pretty empty at the time so it seemed weird that we were ignored (we could see the servers just hanging out at the back;) Then when they finally came over to greet us (after noticing that I was looking at them for awhile) they said that they still had to get the table ready and went back to rearrange tables etc. If we have our reservation at a certain time, it would seem logical that they would have the table semi ready. Moreover, besides taking our order and bringing out our dishes we were pretty much ignored. We had to flag down our server every time we wanted our tea refilled etc. Looking at the other reviews, I see that service seems to be a continuous problem at this establishment and so hopefully management can improve in this area because it is really holding the restaurant back. 

FOOD, TEA, & VALUE: The food and tea here was actually really really good for the price. The Afternoon Tea included about 6 sandwiches per person, salad, a scone, two tea cakes, a short bread cookie, and a pot of tea for around $24. I had the Bourbon Vanilla tea and it was VERY good. It smelled and tasted like vanilla. I felt like there was more food than lovejoy for a cheaper price. Also, since we could choose 3 different type of sandwiches, there are more variety  than lovejoy. In general, the sandwiches were more saucy than at other tea places which help the sandwiches stay moist and not dry. 

Curry Chicken: I thought this was really great and saucy. The chicken was shredded so it had the texture of a chicken salad and the curry was perfect. 

Turkey Pesto: REALLY good. The pesto had a really strong pine nut flavor which I like (some people might not like it as much.) Also I think there was mayo and sun dried tomatoes which made it seem really unique compared to other turkey pesto sandwiches at high tea places. 

Fish and chips: Great fish flavor and perfect crunchiness. 

Scone: AMAZINGLY soft. I really really liked the scone from here but it didn't seem to come with all of the fixings (lemon curd, jam, etc.) It was extremely well done, however. 

ATMOSPHERE: I think this place is a bit too dim and gimmicky for my liking. There were clothe streamers hanging from the ceilings but part of them had fallen down. You sit on armchairs and drink tea from  VERY mismatched sets which I was not crazy about. It didn't feel as open, airy, and inviting as other places.

All in all, the food and value make this place a hot contender for best tea place in the city but its service is really holding it back. Also the decor could also use some improvement.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: How this place got a 4 star review is beyond me. Service was the worst ever- the waitress looked like she hated our guts. I get better service at $2/plate Chinatown restaurants. Over priced, disgusting service, never coming here again. Worst experience ever.
author: Lydia H.

description:
The place looks nice and classy.

Love their lemon curd and crumpets.

DO NOT GET THE "MEMORIES OF PROVENCE" (smells like cough medicine).
author: Tommy Q.

description:
My friend decided to have a girls Sunday brunch here and it was amazing! 

I was so amazed by the decor on the walls and tables. I was getting ideas for my apartment as it was so cute! My friend and I ordered the Bloomsbury Full Tea service which included the choice of 6 different sandwiches, 3 pots of tea, salad, and several desserts. 

We choose the tuna/egg/olives a la nicoise, fish and chips, smoked salmon mouse/dill, spicy hummus, brie/pepper jelly/green apple, and the turkey pesto/cream. All the sandwiches were really delicious! My favorite was the spicy hummus and the brie sandwiches. Each one had the crust cut off and was on a tiered serving platter. Between the 3 of us we managed to eat most of the sandwiches. 

We choose the Ginger Mary-Ann, and Mrs. Lemongrass, Chai Tea, and Hot Chocolate as our choices. The Chai Tea was exceptional and the green tea was also very good. I was unable to try the hot chocolate as I was too full. 

The service also included some scones, cream, macaroons, cookies, and gingerbread. The macaroons and gingerbread were amazing. 

I would recommend this as place to have a girlfriends brunch or to take your mom. We had a great time and felt very posh!
author: Ebonie M.

description: This place is picture perfect! Every child and and child at heart will find this tiny little treasure a fantasy fulfilled. I went with my mother, sister,   niece,  daughter and a few friends. We dressed really pretty, the photos look like a children's story. The little plates for the children were adorable. Then we adults had a two tier plater. We had pots of tea on beautiful mixed sets. It was lovely.  We will go again.
author: Malena R.

description:
Tea Time in Rainy day makes it worth coming to SF.  Bacon and eggs. Tea for two
Asst sandwiches of 8.  Pick your filling and go for it. Spicy garlic shrimp is spicy. 
Look forward to the macaroons and scones with fresh cream.  Don't forget your tea!
author: Brian W.

description:
Ummmmmm scones scones scones, mouthwatering Melt-in-your-mouth delicious scones. Apparently they switch up the flavor all the time but the one I had was some kind of cranberry perfection. Tried the curry chicken tea sandwich, wasn't impressed.

The tea selection is great, it was a treat to just read the menu. I ordered the strawberry tea, which was light and lovely, once I had finished the pot they refreshed it without even being asked! Big points for that. But, if you want to buy a bag for the road? Forget about it, super pricey. 

To sit in, the room is the epitome of crafty/cozy.  And as a party of two, we were easily accommodated last minute on a Saturday morning. Parking was a non issue!
author: Elly W.

description:
This place was adorable with truly wonderful and attentive service. My sister, my friends, and I came here for a girls day after seeing the Oscar De La Renta exhibit at the DeYoung and even though we were over 30 minutes late, they patiently saved our table and immediately provided us service upon arrival. The teacups and table layout are gorgeous!

We ordered 4 portions of the Covent Garden Tea set and we ate and basically had a tea sandwich tasting. I enjoyed everything and barely had room for the mini desserts on the top most tier after we polished off the sandwiches. 

We ended up chatting here for 2+ hours slowly sipping tea on a Saturday afternoon. I'm a tea fan and love fruity aromas so I tried the Violet Mist which I ended up loving. Be warned, you will be very thirsty after a few hours of talking and sipping caffeine. I wasn't a huge fan of the scones, but I am a huge fan of the service!
author: Jannice T.

description:
Gigi V. has it down with her "shabby chic" label, this is the kind of place where all the tea settings and furniture are carefully mismatched and everything reminds you vaguely of going to Nana's. They have a nice selection of teas. I was really happy with my selection, which was called "Song of the Dragonwell". It had a lovely jade green color and a mellow chesnut flavor, just as promised. In fact, many of the names and descriptions of the varous blends of tea were delightful to read and to contemplate. There were several I would want to try just based on the written word.

The tea sandwiches and most of the assorted sweets were just fine. I especially liked the tiny creampuffs filled with strawberries and the espresso petit fours. I was less enthralled with the scones. they were a tad bit too hard. I hate to be a mreanie, but they are missing an entire star because of this. When you go to afternoon tea, getting the scones right is a must. They did get the accompaniments (lemon curd, jam, and clotted cream) right. 

Service-wise, the girl who waited on us was really nice, and fairly attentive. Especially considering the place was fairly busy. She did seem harried though. Which meant part of our order was wrong and we had to track down our own silverware. Neither was a big deal, but they detracted a bit from the serene experience that afternoon teas is supposed to be. 

I also had an issue with parking. Due to road construction and rush hour, the best I could do was either a pricey pay lot or 1 hour parking. That problem can be easily be remedied by carpooling or taking public transportation.

Tea service, in general is pricey. I was being treated, so I was basically happy, even with the less than positive aspects of our visit. I don't think my friend, who was paying, will go back. Still, I think I would give DarTealing another shot. It's a girly, whimisical way to spend an afternoon.
author: Nicole M.

description:
The place is small but cute!! Came here w/very good friend n her husband. Sandwiches were delizzz, lemon scone very moist, and tea selection were great. 

Atmosphere is great and server very attentive.
author: Marlui A.

description:
You can call me snobby but I really like the place I'm having afternoon tea at be comfortable and airy, not stuffy and constantly readjusting myself. 

I had a huge selection of tea sandwiches and sweets- I thought their crumpets and scones were alright, their sweets to be just that, but their tea sandwiches were very tasty. My friends were right about that. 

But the day we went, we were the only party there the entire time and it took forevvvveerr for the tea to come out. No water was offered. We were all sweating and parched. My mom (55), my sister in law(32), and I(25) thought that the seats were not comfortable to sit in. I liked the idea of the mismatched plates, cups, and teapots, however the decor was really something like the Mad Hatter's tea party at the old lady with too many cat's home. *sighs* But it might just be me because my girlfriend that I went with is absolutely in love with the place (which is why we gave it go). But I think I'll go back to my regular afternoon tea place :)
author: Terinna R.

description:
Had a delightful afternoon tea with a dozen lady friends.  We had a blast, great conversation, pastries, and mini sandwiches.  The location is a bit odd underneath the freeway and near the ball park.  Everything was delicious, and they offer caffeine-free tea.  The decor is nice and cozy with attentive staff.  This tea house is not too busy or clustered, unlike other tea houses with overbearing trinkets & teddy bears.  I will definitely bring my daughter and mom here one afternoon.

Keep calm & drink tea!
author: Christine R.

description:
We hosted a friend's bridal shower at Dartealing Lounge, and came away disappointed and put off by the rude customer service.  First of all, we got there a little early to set up.  The server saw us standing with all of our things outside, but made us wait in the cold for another 15 minutes while she was "setting up."  We could see that all she was doing was turning on lamps.  We were told beforehand via email by Pauline that we would be provided areas for cake and photos.  When we were setting up, the server seemed surprised when we asked for a small table to set up the guest book and welcome sign.  I felt like we had to really push them to let us have a small table.  They were extremely rude when we were trying to set up decorations. A lady came up to us (I think she was the owner) and told me very crudely that we brought too many decorations and they aren't used to this amount of decor.  What's ironic, is that we actually sent Dartealing a photo of our centerpieces beforehand, and they said they'd be able to accommodate us.  We also got in trouble for standing on one of the benches to put up a banner (apparently the bench from from the 1700s and very fragile).  While I understand where they were coming from, they could have gone about it more politely.   The service was slow, and we overall felt very unwelcomed.  Mind you, we also spent more than $1000 that afternoon.  At that premium, I truly expected top of the line service.  Instead we were treated like crap. 

I found the tea sandwiches to be ok--a little dry, nothing too special. The scones were rather hard and dense.  The tea itself was flavorful and unique. But overall, given our experience with customer service, we will not be back.
author: Jen C.

description:
First of all, this place is right under the freeway - very interesting location. Secondly, they have creepily low ceilings, which added to the Alice in Wonderland effect with some of their tall waitresses. Aside from that, the decor is mostly cutesy inside. Mismatched lounge chairs, books, hats you can try on, but alas, shitty plastic tables. 

The food was mediocre at best. Having had clotted cream in London and high tea at the Rotunda, I came here with high expectations and was SO disappointed. Their smoked salmon was HORRIBLE - I was not expecting a pate. The brie sandwich was mostly bread with less than a centimeter thick of brie. Ham and cheese was my favorite and actually quite tasty. The desserts were sub par as well. Where were the petit fours? Why did we have so many weird tiramisus? The scones had large chunks of white cream in them? The cream was literally just fat in a dish. And seriously, presentation SUCKED! We got served in 2 courses which alone was weird. I was really hoping for everything to come out on those cute tiered platters, but nope! It all came out on a plate. 

Lastly, to top off my 2 star review, service was horrible. Super slow for anything. No attention to detail. Waited for 15 minutes for a refill of my tea.. were they fetching the water from the well before they boiled it? (oh wait no, she just forgot and had my tea pot sitting on a table until I reminded her). 

Only good thing was the Parisian Earl Grey. VERY yummy! Not coming back for it though.
author: Angela L.

description:
There comes a point in every woman's life where she cannot celebrate her birthday in a wine bar in the Mission and has to opt for high tea in SOMA. It's probably when she is 6 months pregnant, like I am today.

Celebrated my 28th birthday here with 10 of my closest friends. The staff was wonderful, attentive and very VERY accommodating to changes in menu, number of people etc. Its truly a charming tea room, which mismatched china and vintage furniture. Definitely more spacious than Lovejoy's and probably less crowded, but more or less the same vibe. 

I have been to Dartealing for afternoon tea once before with one other person for their regular menu. As prior reviews have mentioned, the fish & chips, spicy garlic and turkey pesto are some of the best tea sandwiches on their menu. However, during winter they serve a special menu in lieu of their regular menu. There are different sandwiches and the tea services prices are a few dollars higher. 

For my birthday I pre-ordered 5 Indulgence Tea services (good for 10) with Turkey Pumpkin, Chicken Cranberry, Brie Apple, and Honey Ham with Watercrest sandwiches. It also came with Warm Chocolate Peppermint Scones, Tea cakes, holiday cookies and Bread Pudding. Since I am pregnant, they also let me include a few Cucumber and herb sandwiches on the side. All the food was pretty good and definitely more than enough for 10 people! My favorites were the Brie Apple, the Chicken Cranberry and the Cucumber herb. The scones and tea cakes were really delicious as well. I liked the bread pudding but it was a bit too rich and sweet for my taste. 

Overall, I truly loved having my birthday at Dartealing Lounge. It just had a great atmosphere, AMAZING service, good food and good tea. I have no problem becoming a regular.
author: Joann A.

description:
This is one of my favorites places to catch up with girlfriends. I'd probably walked by this place over a dozen times before I finally made it a point to pop in. I'm so glad that I did. 

As soon as you walk in, you're just wowed by how super cute it is. Do you sit at a two top with a little table or a cushy couch with a low coffee table? After you've curled up in your seat, your eyes are then drawn to the cute mix and matched teacups and plates all around you. Then there is the menu - Oh the choices! They have a wide variety of teas, but my favorites are the peppermint and the mint lavender. They also have a nice selection of sea services. On this particular occasion we had the basket of warm tea breads. The only thing that we didn't particularly enjoy were the crumpets, but the scones and the breads were delicious. 

I'll be back to try more of the teas and services. 

Pro tip: it's not open on every weekday as you might think! It's closed on Mondays and Tuesdays.
author: Janet Z.

description: Erika was super sweet in getting us a very last minute table today. It was our first visit, and her hospitality made sure that it won't be our last. Our kids each got a duchess tea, complete with their own personal teapots, just like the grownups. I was pleased that they offered cheese/meat sandwiches for the kids, instead of only PBJ (which is sweet) and no savories. The kids ate ALL their sandwiches for the first time ever at a tea room. Our high tea had a nice mix of hot and cold savories, and we were sufficiently satisfied when all the food was finished. We took home the sticky toffee pudding dessert and it was divine. Nothing but love for this tea room.
author: Nina P.

description:
My sister and I booked an appointment for noon on a quiet vacant Sunday at this dainty tea lounge. We got the Bloomsbury Full Tea service which included 
8 tea sandwiches, organic green salad, warm tea bread (lemon poppyseed), heritage scone (cookies and cream), Parisian macaron (chocolate and raspberry), & shortbread cookie (lavender). The teas
of our choice were:
Yo Holmes, It's Watson -- Madagascar vanilla, hazelnut, creamy notes, nutty finish
First Date on the Nile -- ripe fig, honey aromatics, sweet finish, certified organic 
Our sandwich choices were: 
Turkey Pesto
Spicy Hummus Mediterranean 
Spicy Garlic Shrimp
Kahlua & Toasted Almonds 
The food did take a while to prepare since it's made to order, but the wait was well worth it!
Besides the bottomless tea, our favorites were the savory sandwiches (the kahlua sandwich just didn't fit our tastebuds) and the scones. Everything else tasted mediocre except for the macarons, which we felt lacked a lot.
The whole experience was lovely and all the employees are dartealings--very friendly and checked up on us at appropriate times. Considering their price, I would come back for special occasions or just a treat-yo-self day.
author: Vivian T.

description:
The service is a little bit slow but they are very nice. 
I love the tea called Cherry Moon.
Also, the tea sandwiches were good!
author: Yueshan Z.

description:
What a great find! 

Came here w/ my bridesmaids to discuss wedding biz + everyone had a good time. Called in earlier in the day for a reservation and when we arrived, were quick to be seated. They were a tad slow to take our order and tea came out after a while, too but it was no biggie. Tea sammiches were delish. Large tea selection to choose from - we had a pot each and they were all tasty.

It's located under the freeway but you can't hear the traffic anyways. Very close to downtown which was our next destination - lovely.
author: Julie L.

description:
This is probably the only High Tea place I'll go in San Francisco. Big selection of teas, cute decor and good service.

The curry chicken sandwich is the best. The tea selection changes all the time and I've brought all my friends here and they're all obsessed with this place as well.
author: Elena O.

description: A hidden gem in the neighborhood. The tea selection is great and the sandwiches are very tasty. One of the better ones in the city. I would recommend trying this place if you enjoy tea times. Sunday's are great because parking is free, just a tip.
author: Shannon J.

description:
OK OK OK, first off this is my favorite tea place in the city and have introduced numerous friends here (who are constant customers now) so this says a lot. 

I came here 11/16 for a birthday lunch with a different group of girl friends, total newbies to this place (and they loved it!) I'm still sad they took away the chocolate hazelnut sandwich off their menu ... that was my favorite item! 

HOWEVERRRR, I wanted to remove ALL the stars based on the fact that I just checked their webpage and they're having some winter solstice menu in December (my friend is having a birthday party here and we had to preorder sandwiches). I do not want any of those sandwiches on the winter solstice menu... i don't know why they're trying to experiment with sandwiches and enforce it on us for the holidays. That's not ok dartealing! Let us order off the regular menu! The winter solstice one is literally cut in half with majority of the sandwiches on their list being the "new" ones.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Of all the high tea places in SF, this one has scored near the top of the list. It's a cozy non pretentious tea house with an array of varying couches and chairs. 

The food was amazing!! Some of my faves were the salad with tuna, chicken curry sandwich and the ham and horseradish cheddar sandwich. So bomb. The mint lavender tea was really good as well.. Reminded me of my time in Asia. 

Will be back!
author: Lauren Y.

description: Took my Mom for a birthday gift. Definitely brings the traditional English Tea vibe. We had a great time. 4 stars only because service was slow with only one person attending to tables.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
"All you're supposed to do is once in a while give the boys a little tea..." -- Tea and Sympathy (1956)

A long-standing family tradition, the Friday after Thanksgiving the girls go to afternoon tea.  We look for an English Tea service somewhere in the Bay Area - you know, bottomless pots of tea, tea sandwiches, pastries with clotted cream, lemon curd, jams, etc.  We have been doing this since my niece was 2 or 3 years old (so probably 10 years?).

This year we came to DarTEAling.  A quaint little shop off 3rd, we were seated right away and handed menus.  Our places already had tea cups, extra small plates and paper napkins.  Silverware was in a cup on a table off to the side with a sugar pot (no cubes, pure sugar). There was a cake plate in the middle of the table awaiting our selection of food.

Our server was nice to make suggestions for what we should order - there were 4 of us (one was my 12 year old niece).  The limit the kid's tea to 10 and under, but what 12 year old wants tea and curried peanut butter and jelly sandwiches?  So they do need to rethink that.  Luckily, we ordered the Afternoon Tea for 2 (thanks to my Yelp check in, there was a discount) and a Taste Tea for 2 (which only came with 1 pot of tea).  This allowed me to add on a pot of Cocoa for my niece.  She picked a sandwich that seemed plain (turns out it wasn't really).  

We ordered our selection of sandwiches and I explained my treenut allergy (Again, need that neck tattoo I'm so tired of explaining) and just asked that she point out anything with treenuts so I could avoid it.  Instead, our entire platters came out with no treenuts.  Kudos.

We received our 3 pots of tea first, then the cocoa.  My niece also got a little cup of whipped cream with sprinkles on top (she wishes they had asked her since she hates sprinkles - I ate them off the cream for her).  On the 2nd serving of cream, I asked for no sprinkles and they obliged.

After much waiting, we received out raspberry jam and lemon curd...and then we waited some more.  Finally, our sandwiches, salad, scones, sausage rolls, cranberry bread slices and macarons.  My niece loves macarons and prefers chocolate, so I asked what they had and they only had fancier flavors - so she ended up with espresso chocolate.  Luckily, she liked them.

We also ordered 4 crumpets, but we waited for so long for those - had to remind her twice and they came so late we were too full to really eat them.  We were pretty much ready to go when the server came by to say "I'll let the kitchen know you are ready for the rest of your service."  The sweets.  So we got more scones (luckily a different flavor), cranberry bars, more shortbread and cream puffs.  We really didn't have room, but we ate a little and got a box for the rest.

There was only one server working - which was the issue.  What should have been a nicely paced tea, was 2 and a half hours and food took forever and the gaps were too long.  The food was delicious, mostly as described (bacon and eggs is really an egg salad with chunks of bacon and what I guess is paprika since it is electric orange).  Everything was quite flavorful and I would go back, but they really need to work on the pacing.  My pot of tea was cold by the time the last plate of food was delivered and never got the chance to have it refreshed.  Also, the tables are too small for so much stuff.  Plus, they might want to consider better kid-friendly options.

Overall, I did enjoy it quite a lot.  Service was the biggest issue and is why this is 3 stars instead of 4.
author: Lindy F.

description:
3.5 stars. (Will there ever be the option to give 1/2 stars on Yelp?)

Plenty of street parking on a Sunday around noon, and though we'd made reservations, I think we could've walked in and gotten a table with no problem. Not sure if this was out of the ordinary though, so I'd make reservations again just to be safe. It's decently sized place, and open, so you're not bumping elbows with the table next to you. Some of the tables have big, comfy armchairs as seats too, so it's easy to sit back and relax over a cup (or 2 or 3 or...) of tea with whoever you're with.

At just over $20, I'd say it's pretty comparable in price to other tea places since I felt that the quantity of food was a tiny bit less than others. I could be wrong though; it's been a while since I last had high tea. For the taste-tea service, you get 4 tea sandwiches (only 1 kind though), a scone, mini tea loaf, sausage roll, 2 tea cookies, and a petit four along with your bottomless pot of tea (I barely finished half the pot!). I tried both the brie & chutney and curried chicken and I liked the chicken a lot better. There was just something missing from the brie & chutney, and there were several bites of just bread.

I would definitely come back, but I wouldn't say this is the best or my absolute favorite place for high tea in the city.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Went here for a company offsite. Very cozy atmosphere with couches and cute little tables and whatnot. Overall, I think the decor was a step short of classy and I ended up finding it a bit tacky. Then again, I'm a twenty-something male; I'm sure my mom would love this place.

There was a nice selection of teas. I couldn't really appreciate them because I don't drink fruit/herbal flavored teas.

The tea was surprisingly filling and the scones were great!
author: Bryce A.

description:
My girlfriend's friends flaked on her morning tea time plans one Saturday morning and thus I was dragged here. It was not of my choosing to go to a tea place! All jokes aside, I was actually pretty down to have tea with the gf and be a true sir. 

We went on a Saturday around lunch time and waited shortly to be seated as the place was already full of people. The selection we chose included 8 tea sandwiches (4 types), 2 tartlets, 2 cucumber cups, 2 scones, and petit fours. The sandwiches we chose were smoked salmon, fish & chips, turkey pesto, and brie and pear. The salmon one sounded like it would be really good but there was only salmon the size of a dime on each one and it was overpowered by the cream. The other three sandwiches were fantastic: the fish & chips was tasty with a nice crunch and the brie always pears well with pear. The turkey pesto was my favorite one. The other items were great also, but the best part of the meal goes to the scones. They were so soft and warm on the inside and so delicious with the cream! I did not think a tea place would have such good food!

This far in the review on a tea house and I still have not mentioned the tea! My gf chose a mango type of tea and I got one that had coconut. It was interesting but even though I like everything coconut, I probably would choose something else. The mango one was good though, but the real star of the show was not the tea. I think that since this place has good food, it would be worth checking out. It is pricey for the amount of food but we were stuffed by the end. For a first time experience at a tea place, I don't have much of a comparison, but it was a fun experience and I enjoyed the food and company.
author: Peter H.

description:
Super cute place. Don't know why it's so empty! Anyway our server was super friendly and helpful. We had the yelp deal of tea time for two (40$), which was plenty of food. Favorite tea sandwiches were the brie and Apple and the egg. The cucumber and smoked salmon had a bit to much cream cheese to my liking. The desserts weren't anything spectacular but definitely have a scone to yourself. They're warm and fluffy in the middle. Also slather on some Devon cream and lemon curd, you'll Thank me. 

One bad thing that they coukd maybe fix is that the bathroom was a bit gross.
author: Christina C.

description: Such a random location but the service, ambiance and food are impeccable. Would highly recommend for bridal shower, birthday or just Sunday tea!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Christine P and I came here for a Sunday Afternoon Tea Service for Two ($48). The Yelp check-in offer only works on week days (they're also closed on Mon and Tues).

Two teas of choice
Twelve tea sandwiches (select 3 flavors)
Fresh green salad
Tea scones & Devon cream

For the sandwiches:
We tried the curried chicken / brie, apple & sweet pepper jelly / fish & chips - all yummy!

For the teas:
Caramel Carousel (Melange of toffee and caramel) smelled and tasted delicious, drank most of this one. 
Wings of the Dove (Creamy coconut is paired with rich, nutty almond and Sencha green tea) smelled very coconutty, would probably try a different one next time.

I thought this would be a light lunch, but we were pretty stuffed! (probably from drinking so much tea).
author: Christine C.

description: We got here in group of four and we reserved in advance. Environment is good here and we all loved it. We had to call waitress a few times. So service was ok ok. Everything we ordered was delicious the sandwiches - smoked Salomon mousse, Darting Curried chicken. Tea - Persian Earl Grey.  We were feeling like family around.
author: Paige C.

description:
I took my mom here for high tea for Mother's Day and we had a nice time.
The theme this year was Hawaiian so the menu consisted of tea sandwiches (chicken katsu/shrimp/kalhua pork), mac salad, coffee scone, fruit skewers, and mango cake. Overall the food was good and definitely not your traditional high tea feast which made it more memorable. The tea was also not bad. 
I liked the decor in here also, it was not as antique as some high tea places but more modern. I'd suggest making a reservation ahead of time since the room is not too large. 
Service here was fine and parking was easy. I wouldn't mind returning again to have high tea here.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Despite being literally one block away from my office, I never made it out to DarTealing until a few weeks ago. Why? Probably because the place is so damn expensive - sure, for afternoon/high tea, the prices are fairly typical, but for an afternoon snack, it's a bit more than I'd normally like to spend. 

Now, that said, while the spiced apple and almond cream tart I had was fairly average, their tea cakes, crumpets, scones, and the jams [ Photo: http://instagram.com/p/ZcI8YIQfs1/ ] they come with were all quite tasty, and worth trying. I didn't have any of their tea, so I can't comment on that, but be prepared to peruse a fairly extensive selection of loose leaf teas!

3.5 stars for the crumpets and scones alone.

Pro tip: if you're just looking for a snack, order something to go, as seatings impose a $12 per person minimum!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A quaint and cutesy high tea lounge (though far less pink and frilly than Crown & Crumpet), consisting mostly of two and four person tables. Table arrangements are reasonable, and given that they're not particularly crowded on the weekdays, accessibility shouldn't be a huge problem - bear in mind though that those of you in wheelchairs will probably not be able to pull in fully to their two person tables due to the central posts.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Tea in the States will never live up to the casual warmth of tea time in the UK/British-influence countries, but Dartealing conducts its own charm without being pink-and-frilly like Crown and Crumpet. Dartealing feels like a cozy house with mismatched porcelain and chinaware (and questionable bathroom postcard decor). Most people come on a reservation, and there is almost nothing else to do in the immediate vicinity, so reservations are advised.

We did the Afternoon Tea for Two ($48 total), which came with two pots of tea, 12 finger sandwiches (3 flavors), salad, two scones, and 6 small sweet pieces. The tea list is very expansive. I got the Cabana Boy, which is good if you're looking for a fruity flavor that retains a strong tea flavor. Sandwiches were whatever (lots of bread), but some interesting varieties (my favorite was the Brie/Pepper/Apple). The scones were the best takeaway - freshly baked, not-hard-triangles, and unique flavor profiles (we had a lemon cardamon? rosemary? some kind of herb) and a cream spread that resembles at least the texture of clotted cream.

I think the High Tea set actually looked more appealing, because they swap out some of the small dessert pieces for heartier savory items. Dartealing offers a laidback experience that your male friend/significant other would probably be a little more accepting of than the girlz-only zone of most kitschy tea lounges.
author: Jessica F.

description:
This is my second year in a row going here for my birthday! It was a lovely experience this afternoon. I called in advance to reserve a two hour tea with me and 7 of my friends. I put down a $60 deposit and the price was $28 per person. It ended up being $36 a person because of added service fees and taxes. I wish I knew that ahead of time because my guests were only expecting to pay $28 but I guess that's my own fault for not factoring it in.

I can't remember all of the teas that we tried but our group really liked the vanilla bourbon one in particular, though they all were good. The desserts were all super cute and tasty and I loved the scones!

The only miss sandwich wise for our whole group was the berries and cream. I think they need more savory vegetarian options. I loved the brie sandwich though and the salmon and cucumber ones were also very well received.

I've done my research and this really seems like the best price you'll get for high tea in the city, it's well worth the cost for all of the goodies that you get. The atmosphere of the restaurant is adorable too and the waiters were very attentive!
author: Jenny A.

description:
4-4.5 stars. We really like this place. The tea sandwiches are more interesting than average with a rather large selection. The sweets and baked goods (scones, etc) are quite tasty.
They also have a very good tea selection.
Parking is pretty easy on the street.
This really makes for a nice celebration with friends or family.
author: kristin m.

description:
DarTealing opened a block away from our place earlier this year and I wanted to love it. We went there our first time shortly after it opened and there were definitely kinks to work out in their service but I let it slide since I knew it was the owner's dream to open up this cute tea shop. However, it's been at least 5 months since that first experience and things still haven't gotten better.

I really hope the owner reads this review because this is the perfect example of where passion does not meet execution.

We came here for the annual Fall Buffet. I live at the Palms and received an email saying that we would receive a goodie bag and "cake and tea" after attending the buffet for $29 a person.

3 of us came in the afternoon. Let me up front, the food here is pretty good and the decor of DarTealing is adorable but the service here led to a disappointing experience here.

First, at the front of the room there are these delicious looking cupcakes in a cake stand. I heard a patron asking about whether she could have one and our waitress basically told her "oh, they should be out in the other buffet section" (they weren't) thereby telling her no, you can't have one.  Here's the thing, if guests can't eat them, please don't display them. And if guests can eat them, please let them, especially if they ask for it. The thought is that if it's a buffet, you should be able to eat anything.

Second, the buffet had specific seating times, i.e. 12:30-2:00pm was our time. The tea room was not even 1/2 full during our seating time and when we arrived it was even emptier. However, our waitress still came by with our check at 2:00pm. I understand that if the tea room was full, there is a need to clear out the patrons to prepare for your next seating but this was CLEARLY not the case and it's sort of off putting to get your check when you are trying to enjoy your scone.  Like my hubs was saying, isn't the whole point of afternoon tea relaxing and enjoying the afternoon unhurried?

Third, one of the couples came in between the seatings and there were clearly things lacking in the buffet. The man asked the waitress and she said, oh sorry you came in between the seatings and he responded, "so? does that mean I don't get to eat anything?" she went to the back and then brought out some sandwiches and scones. Again, I don't own a business but if I did I wouldn't want to alienate my patrons.

Fourth, we felt bad for staying beyond our given time so we asked for the check. It took her 10 minutes to come by to get the check and I kid you not, 30 minutes for her to bring it back. In fact, I had to ask her, um we gave you our credit card 30 minutes ago. She came back with and apologized saying that she forgot about it because the phone rang. By this point, there were about 5 people in the entire place, that's really not excusable.

Lastly, and one of the biggest disappointments was that we came here because they specifically said you will get a goodie bag of "tea and cake" to take home with you. We got a puny little truffle and one tea bag along with a coupon that expires in less than one month. I'm sorry but if you are going to say, "tea and cake" goodie bag, then give out tea and cake! One piece of truffle is not cake and one tea bag? Geez..that's not a goodie bag...

So I wanted to love this place since the beginning. I love afternoon tea, it's my very favorite dining activity and I hope that the owner will retrain her staff to really listen to the customers and treat them like guests who will want to come back.
author: Betty C.

description:
This restaurant is a very different establishment from its neighbors. The best description I can come up with is a coffee shop but with tea - and expensive. Yes, more expensive than Starbucks. :O 

Lots of flowery stuff everywhere too. It seems to be popular for bridal showers and things like that. I am not really into that kind of things - showers etc, so to be fair please read my review with that in mind.

The teas were good. There were like 6 different pots. The server told us what each one was in the beginning and she brought out the food and did the same. Afterwards, we never hear back from her. She made us feel like we are just bothering her, so we did not really bother asking anything again.

There are scones, small sandwiches cut into little triangles, french toasts and macaroons. They are ok, not super delicious and I think I am not alone in thinking that because we had lots of leftovers. The strawberry cake that someone bought from Schubert's beat all that stuff.

They also timed your reservations. We only got two hours. Very interesting.

The bill came to $35. 

While I have a great time hanging out with the girls, this is not my kind of scene.
author: July N.

description:
Every girl needs to enjoy tea time! DarTealing is so charming and cute! 

My cousin and I (and our boyfriends) were lucky enough to make it on Oct 3rd for their chocolate pairing and everyone including the boys enjoyed it! I didn't think chocolate tea can have such an interesting taste together.

We started off with the Violet Mist. I loved that it was decaf and I absolutely loved the taste of it! I actually liked it better sans cream! Then we had what felt like an unlimited supply of yummy sandwiches! We all agreed on the white fish mousse and the curry but I actually really enjoyed the cucumber as well!

I was iffy about the salad-- the purple parts were too bitter for my taste.

And then-- the magic of the chocolate pairing began! 
We started with lighter teas and white chocolate and eventually ended with darker. I won't list all the teas we tried becuase that's practically the entire menu but I will give some honorable mentions!

The Cabana Boy was a green tea with strawberries. From first scent, we were in love!  We also enjoyed the chamomile lavender but our ultimate favorite of the day was the Lapsang Souchong. It has a very smokey taste to it but it reminded us all of dim sum and left us with a very warm feeling.

I will definitely be back to DarTealing! The owner told us about having a buffet coming up some time in November-- I'm pretty sure my cousin and I will be back with the rest of the girls in the family!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Updated in response to the owner's comment:

First of all thank you for your response and I appreciate your opinion but I have a few things that I also want to address:

This is actually my second visit. My first visit, which I paid full price, was better but mediocre. I decided to come back and give you a second chance because of the travel zoo deal hoping that it would be better since I really do enjoy afternoon tea. The fact that you found it necessary to bring it up in your comment implies that I am not as valued as a customer paying full price and therefore not entitled to the same level of service and quality. If that is the case, you should list it in the fine print of the voucher so people are aware that since they are going to be getting a discount, they are going to be treated as second class citizens and not entitled to the same service as someone paying full price.

Also, as someone with an MBA who runs a multiple facilities, budgets, staff, etc. I do understand what it takes to run a business and your point of view but I also understand the importance of customer service which I feel your business lacks. I'm assuming that the reason you made the business decision to offer 25% off was to entice people to try your place in hopes of gaining a returning customer so I am baffled as to why you would take this stance and treat the customers that decided to take you up on this offer like this.

As for the coffee, it's clearly poor quality. I actually really enjoy dark coffee so that was not the problem. I also enjoy beverages with spices but this clearly didn't work for me. Also, the cream that I asked for twice, was regular milk which did not help. Your staff should learn the difference between whole milk and cream.

As for the lychee tea, we didn't notice the extra fee on the menu. In fact, before writing this review, I went to your site to double check and it is not on there. I do understand that you are in a sticky position since I can see your point in how some people might get offended but one thing that would have made the situation a bit better is if the waitress didn't have such an attitude when we asked what the $3 was for. All we wanted was a clear explanation. It's not something that we would have had an issue with if we knew ahead of time.

As for the cream, I completely understand that you are not going to take the time to weigh/measure it so they all come out of the kitchen identical. That would be ludicrous but I can tell you that our serving was significantly less than others. You can look at the photo, I only wish that I took a photo of the second serving so you could compare. In fact, when we ordered the additional scone it was twice as much as the first time when we had 2 scones instead of one which doesn't make any sense. All I needed was about a half of teaspoon to finish my first scone. I ordered the third scone because I had so much cream left from the second serving that I didn't want to waste it. When it arrived, it came with an additional side of cream that I didn't expect so instead of throwing it out because there was no way we were going to be able to eat all that cream, I sent the cream back which I'm sure you were able to serve someone else since it didn't even hit the table. Your waitress should have suggested ordering an additional scone for $3 as an alternative to ordering just cream for $2 with all the fixing as an option. If she would have taken initiative to do so, that would have solved the problem from the beginning although it doesn't change the fact we were given a significantly smaller serving the first time around but then again, why should I expect any customer service since I used a coupon. Oh and thank you for not charging me for the cream that I sent back that you were able to serve someone else and that you shouldn't have charged me for in the first place.

And lastly, having a nail salon is not a negative but I don't know why it required such a long winded response. It almost seems like you are using this as a forum to advertize. As someone who gets a gel mani and pedi every 2 weeks religiously, I don't have an issue with nail salons and I'm actually quite used to the smell. It was the person I was with that thought he was crazy when he told me he smelled nail polish because he didn't notice the salon next door. The odor wasn't very strong but something should be done to keep it out of your establishment.

Again, thank you for taking the time to comment and good luck to you and your business.
author: Diane M.

description:
Tea drinker? Take the time to spend a bit of time here, relaxing in the cozy confines of the charming folds of lovely comfort. Everything about Dartealing is adorable -- the menus, the servers, the cups. I wish I had one of these in my city, as I would make weekly visits and relish each and every one. 

The menu is great -- so many teas and lovely treats to eat along with them. The French music is piped in at exactly the right decibel, enhancing your adorable experience and making it all the cozier. I love the mismatched tea service, the plush furnishings and the air of sweet grandmotherly charm. The tea, of course, is the star and centerpiece, but everything about this place is just as relaxing and soothing. 

A personal pot of tea will cost you  $5 and give you 3-4 cups. I only tried two, but bother were absolutely delicious -- not a hint of bitterness or grit. This is the place for tea drinkers looking for a bit of downtime in an otherwise bustling part of SF. Love it.
author: Hilary H.

description:
Its been a while since i had afternoon tea and my girlfriend had never had it before. So i figured it would be a win for everyone but i was nervous. Moat tea pla es i go to in the bay area are pretty sub par. I found this place and thought we should try it out and i was NOT dissapointed (4.5 stars but im rounding up)

Pros:
-food is delicious
-lots of tea selections
-nice, quaint and cozy
-all the staff knows what they are talking about
-right next to the bay bridge so it can be your first or last stop
-great for couples

Cons
-not near other SF landmarks or trendy parts of sf
-im sure they would provide some of you ask but there was no jam at the table which i found odd
-staff can get busy if more than a few people are there
-can get pricey pretty quickly

This place is great and i plan on going back sometime. Definitely one of the better tea places in SF and one of the more reasonably priced ones considering the quality. Im already looking foreward to it and i know my girlfriend is too!
author: Josh L.

description:
**STARS: 3.5**

Came here for a bridal shower for my sis-in-law a couple of weeks back... it was a hot day in SF (rare I know) so walking inside, was even hotter... the place needed more fans or some sort of ventilation to keep some air moving.

The staff wasn't that friendly... considering we were a big party... but we had a lot of food so you'd think they'd be a little nicer to us... but nope... to no avail.

We had a bunch of tea... so much so that I forgot their names... plus I was dying from the heat so I tried to limit my "hot" tea intake. The staff did take forever to bring out the sandwiches... of course... I didn't have any since I don't eat sandwiches. The group enjoyed it... apparently they got full... I ate in advance knowing what I'm up for... so I was good with not eating.

Overall... the place is cute and will probably check it out again... but I still favor the place by Ghirardelli Square...
author: Cath M.

description:
I came here with two friends, and it was pretty meh. The waitress wasn't very knowledgable about the menu, and it took us a little while to get noticed and seated (even though we had a reservation). The waitress also had a cold demeanor towards us. I guess we came at the end of the day (4 PM), but if they didn't want to serve us, they should've rejected our reservations.

They have separate sharing fees for tea and for food, which they will not waive. For example, one of my friends wanted to order a salad and just try some of our teas, but she was told that if she did that, she'd be charged.

The vegetarian sandwiches were good. The bread tasted a little stale, but maybe that was just me. Most of the pastries weren't that great, but the scones were awesome! I wish I had just ordered scones and tea.

All in all, it was okay, but I wouldn't come back.
author: Natasha B.

description: Loved this place so much! Perfect spot for a date with your girlfriends. The place has a cozy victorian feel to it. Their scones, crumpets, and curried chicken sandwiches were unbelievable!
author: Sue J.

description:
Dartealing Lounge is located kind a kind of shady area, which almost underneath a freeway bridge. The decor in the price is really nice.

== Food ==

The sandwiches are great! The salmon mousse and fish & chips are really amazing! The salmon is very nice and smooth. The fish & chips are pieces of fish with potato chips. It's a very interesting texture and tastes great. The curry chicken was pretty good. The turkey and pesto is pretty amazing also. 

Jasmine and Jade tea is good, but I'm biased to Jasmine tea.

The various pastries that came with the service are okay. I found them to be average.

== Service ==

Service is slow, but this is an afternoon tea... no rushing. Be prepared to sit and enjoy the decor and the company you have.

== Overall ==

Great place to relax and have an afternoon tea.
author: Steven B.

description:
This place went all out with their decorations! I felt like I was back in the Victorian era, daintily sipping my tea. I should have dressed for that occasion too. 

The only issue was that they charge an extra fee for sharing the platter for two. I guess that's the price you pay for being at such a proper place!

All in all really puts you in a teatime mood.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Super cute place for tea and desserts with a girlfriend.  Everything in there is so feminine and beautiful!  

This place can be really pricy.  A pot of tea and a small plate of desserts shared between two girls is already $40, but I guess you are paying for the experience.  

I would come back, it's the perfect place to catch up with close girlfriends every once in a while.
