author: Jenny L.

description:
I've never been here during peak lunch hours, but whenever I go around 2pm on Saturday and Sunday afternoons, it always seems like the crowd is just beginning to thin. 

I've had the Afternoon Tea Service for Two as well as several teas and scones. My thoughts on these are as follows:

The sandwiches are fantastic. I have no complaints on the ones I've tried. For the smoked salmon mousse & dill, just note that it's a salmon mousse, so don't expect large pieces of salmon in your sandwich. I was iffy about trying the curried chicken sandwich at first, but it was surprisingly delicious, and I would definitely order again. Finally, I also highly recommend the brie, pepper jelly, & green apple sandwich, especially for huge cheese lovers like myself. The textures work well together, and the crunch of the green apple is perfect against the silkiness of the brie. I enjoyed all these sandwiches so much that sometimes I kind of just want to walk over to DarTealing and order their sandwiches much like I would in a deli. But they're not a deli...so I stop myself. *sigh*

For the teas, I greatly, greatly enjoyed the very cheesily named Somewhere My Love (regardless of the nostalgia that Doctor Zhivago brings me). I believe you need to pay a little extra for this tea, but I thought it was worth it. I was initially worried that the vanilla would come out too strong (I tend to shy away from strong vanilla flavors), but  the vanilla tones came out just right, and the tea itself was perfectly rich and creamy. (Also, as a note, 2 bottomless teas are ridiculously excessive for 2 people)

The crumpets were nothing special. I didn't really enjoy mine much. The scones, however, have the perfect texture. They change the scones every now again, it seems. I once had poppy scones and I've also had rosemary scones. They were both delicious. Scones tend to be too dry or too crumbly when not done well, but I must say, DarTealing's scones have always pulled through for me. The textures and flavors have been perfect every time.

A word of caution to fellow scone lovers though, DarTealing's cream is nowhere like the clotted cream they tend to use in London. The cream that they use here is much, much lighter, with a texture that is very similar to whipped cream. That's probably my biggest disappointment as a huge clotted cream fan.
author: Clarisse V.

description:
I have visited several tea houses in the SF Bay Area, as well as the Seattle area, and Dartealing is my favorite of all of them.

Most tea houses have really good tea OR really good food OR really good scones (which belong in a category of their own) OR really good ambience, but it's rare to find a tea house that combines all of these qualities. Dartealing is such a place.

I generally only ever get the afternoon tea services here, so my review is centered around those.

I recommend Dartealing for anyone looking to enjoy a solidly delicious afternoon tea service with friends for a couple of hours, particularly if being able to hear the conversation is important to you. :) It's very relaxing here.

SOUND/AMBIENCE
I like coming here for lunch with friends during weekdays, as it's rarely so occupied as to have a wait. More importantly, I can actually hear my friends as we converse whenever we eat here. What! 

The interior is tastefully Victorian (stab in the dark; I know not my time periods well) and replete with comfortable armchairs, as well as little tables with regular chairs.  Utensils are available in tabletop pots, by the way, in case you're wondering why your meal doesn't come accompanied by forks and knives.  

It's a very comfortable place to spend a couple of hours with your friends chatting and enjoying fragrant tea whilst nibbling on nummy sandwiches, or to work for a few hours on your laptop.  If I recall correctly, the music is quiet lounge jazz, which is just perfect.

SERVICE
The service can be a little slow, but they are exceptionally friendly and attentive.  I think they operate on a policy of letting you enjoy your meal and trying not to be underfoot, so you do need to flag them down if you'd like to refill your bottomless pot of tea or move to the next course of your afternoon tea service, but I generally am fond of the staff here.

That said, because of the nature of afternoon tea service, I would advise blocking out a good two hours for the afternoon tea, as it takes that long to really enjoy the experience.

FOOD
Rare is the tea house that serves scones that are fresh and not rock-hard or dry.  The accompaniments of lemon curd and delicious Devonshire cream complete the scone experience.

Furthermore, I love their sandwich options *so much*.  They have an abundance of interesting sandwich options, and I encourage you to try them all. My favorite savory sandwich is the curry chicken; my favorite sweet sandwich is the speculoocious ginger snap, which is just as delicious and mouth-watering as it sounds.

The salads served with afternoon tea are tastefully tossed in a light vinaigrette, and appealingly simple. I like me some salad without dreadful tomatoes adorning its crown, and Dartealing serves me well in this respect.

The dessert options are tasty and varied, never the same between two afternoon teas, and always freshly made.

Nevertheless, I always like saving one of my Speculoocious Ginger Snaps sandwiches for last, as I like it even more than any of their dessert options.

TEA
I love the blends available at Dartealing.  I also love that you get a bottomless pot with every afternoon tea service.  The china here is exquisitely fun and beautiful, and sipping tea from it is always a pleasant experience.  Just try to remember to use the strainer whenever you pour yourself a new cup: I'm dreadfully guilty of forgetting and having to pluck tea leaves from between my teeth.

My favorite flavored black tea blends are Her Majesty's Secret Service ("Hints of bourbon vanilla sprinkled with pieces of vanilla bean blended with black tea") and Citizen "Rosebud" ("Premium black tea sprinkled with rose petals with just a tiny hint of smokiness to balance out the floral notes").

Favorite rooibos: Caramel Carousel. That's a mouthful, both tasteful and difficult to say. "Melange of toffee and caramel."

Favorite Pu'er: The Emperor's Cup - Black Pu'er tea: "Earthly Pu'erh leaf balanced with rich chocolate & a minty finish...a robust cup worthy of royalty."  One of the best chocolate mint teas I've ever had: perfect with a touch of milk and sugar, and actually minty/chocolately without tasting medicinal.
author: Karena T.

description:
I really enjoyed my first visit to DarTealing, but my most recent visit here left much to be desired.

The first time, we had the tea service for two, which came with:

- 2 bottomless pots of tea
- 12 mini tea sandwiches (fish & chips, curried chicken, turkey & pesto cream)
- Green salad
- Scones (warm, buttery, flaky)
- Tea sweets (petits fours, madelines w/strawberries & cream)

The service was decent & we were one of two parties in the tea room.

However, the last time I came here, the service left much to be desired.  We had to ask for  more water and more hot water for our tea, even though we were the only people in the place. It looked like they were getting ready to close up, even though we came around 4:00PM (the kitchen closes at 5PM & the tea room closes at 6PM)

I also didn't care much for their holiday menu, so we just ordered a few things a la carte:

- Tea Sandwiches (Turkey & Pumpkin Butter Creme, Curried Egg Salad, Bacon & Eggs) - the bacon & eggs sandwich was my favorite.
- Dill scone bites w/smoked salmon - had I known that we would only get two mini scones, I would not have ordered this.  It was $6.
- Seasonal Tea Scones.  They were okay, not great.  But they only came with cream & there wasn't even an option to order lemon curd.

I will come back in the future, since I like their regular menu.
author: Grace C.

description:
Tasty Sandwiches - 

1)SMOKED HAM AND HORSERADISH CHEDDAR -Smoked Black Forest ham, sharp cheddar, and a creamy horseradish spread
2) TURKEY AND PESTO CREAM -Honey roasted & smoked turkey, lightly creamy basil pesto, and a sprinkling of sun-dried tomato bits
3) TOFU & CITRUS GINGER SOY GLAZE -Grilled tofu, lemon-ginger soy glaze
topped with toasted sesame seeds and spring onions

Tea selection - Mediocre. 

Sweet treats - Vanilla scone, sweet cream, biscotti, petite fours, cream puff.

DECOR - shabby chic in a clean and modern way.  

Service - Mediocre. Run by students as they are studying on their downtime.

Spacious bathroom.

Parking - Street metered for 2 hours (1.25/hr) or side street on Stillman is free for one hour. Beware of towing from 4p-6pm.

It's on a busy street but you don't hear much of the noise from the inside.  I walked into the Polish Lounge instead of the Tea Lounge (because there was no door knob) and I thought it was the back of the kitchen. 

Visited here because of a Bloomspot deal.  I paid for "Afternoon tea service for two" for $25. Tip is included into the CHECK. (~$7). The total was $24 (including the ~$7 tip).  You don't really save that much using a Bloomspot deal because you are technically paying the standard fare of the afternoon tea service ($43). 

(See my photos)
author: Jboogie L.

description:
HOW do I get suckered into these places!? Oh...right, I have some girly girl friends. Bleh. If I have to stick a pinkey up, I'm going to gag.

Came here on a Sunday with a group of 10 females. We got a set, because evidently they do that with a big group. Even though we called almost a month in advance, they told us they would only seat us in 2 separate tables. Sad...but then we arrived and they sat us at one table. Happy? Confused.

The sandwiches we got:
1) turkey and pesto cream - I could only tell it was the turkey pesto because it was greenish.
2) smoked salmon and capers - Couldn't taste much of a difference.
3) dartealing curried chicken - Probably my favorite. It had flavor.
4) smoked ham and horseradish cheddar - I could barely taste the horseradish...or ham....or cheddar. It has a slight taste of the horseradish which is how I knew what it was.
5) egg and bacon - can taste the bacon!

Overall, the sandwiches were pretty bland. If you come here without the set, focus on the curried chicken. And maybe the egg bacon. Everything else is kind of bleh.  It came with scones, sweets, and salad. Salad was well dressed. Scones everyone else thought was great, but I begged to differ. It was pretty dense, and I know scones ARE dense, but these were too much. Maybe everyone else has not had good scones (see John Campbell's Irish Bakery).

The teas were ok, but since we had so many people, they didn't have enough of the tea catchers for us all. How sad. They just put it in a bag and let it seep. Overall, the teas we got were pretty good. Her Majesty's Secret Service was likely my favorite, but I'm a coffee person.  Pear to Eternity was very....pear-y. I swear we got something more flowery, but I can't remember what it was called. Jasmine and Jade was my biggest disappointment. The waitress said it like the Jasmine tea you get at Chinese restaurants, but better. So, my friends ordered it. It was NOT. I mean, at the average Chinese restaurant, sure. But I just got back from Hong Kong and EVERY TEA was better than this one! If you order this, you might as well go to Koi palace and get dimsum with it. Fail.

Service was good. There was only one person there, but she was attentive enough when you needed her, and gone when you didn't. Only bummer was that as a big group, we got kicked out so they can set up for the next group of people.
author: Lily W.

description:
My favorite tea place. Period. 

Look, I love Lovejoys as much as any other tea junkie, but I'd much rather be at Dartealing than any other place. There are times when I don't want the extra frills and whimsy of Lovejoys. I have to face the facts when it comes to my tastes: when I go to Lovejoys, I automatically feel the pressure of looking prim, proper, and forcing myself to say, "I am treating myself here. I am treating myself here."

Yes. There IS a point where you really need to keep calm and carry on. Tea is supposed to be a time of relaxation. And Dartealing, precious place, is truly the one place where I felt totally, absolutely, 100% content. To those that know me, this is a huge feat.

Quick reasons why I will always choose Dartealing over Lovejoys:
1. Dartealing is nowhere near as crowded.
2. Dartealing has a pleasant atmosphere that has never been too loud or uncomfortably quiet.
3. The staff here are lovely, and they are pretty good at knowing their clientele. Being here makes me feel like I'm visiting a good friend's home rather than a yoga center or a fantasy land meant for young adult writers.
4. Parking is dirt cheap on weekends. Seriously. I came in on Saturday, and the meter only cost A FREAKIN' QUARTER PER HOUR.
5. It's only a block from work. Personal perks, yeah, I know.
6. The menu is superior, especially in terms of tea, which is the reason why I'm going in the first place. Different scones every day, a special sandwich of the month, and a massive tea menu that seems to rotate every once in a while.
7. I could actually get reservations. On a Saturday. Without having to wait two bloody hours. And the reservation process was painless. They request that you pre-order your food ~3 days in advance, and this is so they can get your food to you quickly.
8. I went in by myself on a Friday afternoon for lunch. They were excellent about explaining how the menu worked, and were happy to work with me to get some selections going.
9. I love how you can smell the scones baking from wherever you're sitting. The flavors always vary - so far, I've been happy to have an orange marmalade, an almond butterscotch, and a lavender honey scone. Oh yes.
10. Usually, I'm a huge stickler about service. But I've always come in at a time when it isn't busy, and I've never felt awkward about asking for a waitress. They always apologize if there's a wait, and I seriously don't mind. Stick a bottomless pot of delicious tea in front of me, keep it refreshed often enough, and I am good. Go ahead and serve other folks first. I'm here to relax, have tea, and stuff myself full of sandwiches and sweets.

Okay. Maybe it wasn't so quick. But there are numbers, so they're at least organized nicely. The clotted cream is a bit too close to butter for my tastes, and that's one thing I'd choose Lovejoys for, but that's not enough to sway my decision. When I came in for lunch on my own, they simply split the "tea for two" order in half, both in price and in food - honestly, that was more than enough. It is the perfect way to treat myself when I don't want to think about work and life in general. I get there, I sit down, I order tea and vittles, and I am absolutely, wonderfully, blissfully content for the 1-2 hours I'll be there. And it's because Dartealing is the sort of tea lounge that I look for: not overly stuffy, not trying too hard to be whimsical or zen. It's a place where I can sit, relax, read a book, and feel just fancy enough for those days when I'm feeling overwhelmed.

Their info section? Yes. "Dartealing is about personal rituals and 
celebrating life.  We are about finding time and a place for rest during a busy day, or to catch up with those important people in our lives." Yeah. I feel that. I came here again for my birthday and I was absolutely pleased, and my party was equally delighted. We could talk and hear each other; the tea was replenished often; we all found favorites for tea and sandwiches and scones. That's what tea should do - bring people together without feeling like you need to do a little "extra".

In the voice of Tom Haverford...treat yo self.
author: Robbin A.

description:
I just love the afternoon tea experience - I love tea, pastries, cucumber sandwiches, and dainty little cups. So unless you really muck it up, I can't give a tea room a low rating. 

With that said, the cucumber sandwiches were NOT GOOD, but the other sandwiches were ok. The scones were really delicious and kind of made up for it.
author: Jenny J.

description:
What an odd little place. First of all, this is an unexpected location for a tea room. The decor almost goes the distance, but felt a little inauthentic.

Food was good, tea was good, desert was just ok. Bathroom was gross.

We had a good time, so I guess this averages out to three stars.
author: A K.

description:
Way better than Lovejoy's.  More creative, a more relaxed atmosphere, more variety, and better food.  I love that they have all kinds of different scones, and they have off-beat sandwiches and flavored teas.  

It's definitely an alternative atmosphere, but it's so nice to go somewhere that doesn't have "Keep Calm and Carry On" signs everywhere.  Grab yourself a comfy chair, order something you haven't tried before, and relax.
author: The E.

description:
I can't believe this place has been around for 3 years and I just heard about it. Thanks to Bloomspot deals I got a lovely afternoon tea sampling this past week.

My partner and I each chose our teas -- very yummy -- and split 3 types of tea sandwiches and a sweet tray. She had salmon & capers and together we shared olive & havarti and ginger tofu. The tofu marinates in a special sauce that is quite delicious. The owner was our waitress so I was able to ask a lot of questions and get answers.

The food and tea are plentiful and the ambiance is so quaint. I look forward to a return visit.
author: Leslie K.

description:
Went here on Mother's Day. Was not impressed at all. The service was spotty and slow and at times even irritable. 

The sandwiches were strictly ok. But worse, the bread was stale, and had hardened somewhat, probably from sitting out all day. 

The tea was the most disappointing part. We ordered their strongest teas and they probably didn't put enough leaves in. So even after steeping for a long time the tea liquor was very light. 

As we were leaving our server took our card back twice because she wasn't getting the bill right. 

Not worth it at all. There are better tea services out there.
author: Mily G.

description:
***delivery/catering order***

I ordered catering for an office baby shower and worked with Pauline. She was so lovely and made this super easy for me, delivery was on time and everyone was just so helpful. It really made our experience so much better!

We ordered a plate of tea sandwiches (salmon, cucumber/dill and chicken curry) along with an assortment of desserts. We went with their regular popular tea and love it. We loved everything, so yummy and cute! Packaging and plates were tied nicely with twine, just adorable.

Loved them and will order again, can't wait to visit!
author: Meredith M.

description:
A beautiful - somewhat hidden- gem in an unexpected place.
Nice place for a quiet conversation in a romantic place.
Very friendly service.

Many business meetings take place here, as well.
author: Ralph M.

description:
I've been here twice now and have tried almost all of the sandwiches as well as several of the teas. I highly recommend! The same waitress helped us both times and service was excellent. I really wish I could remember her name because she was incredibly sweet. We had pretty large groups and she was very accommodating. Even put up with us staying past closing for us to chat and help us take pictures. 

The food overall (sandwiches and pastries) was a solid 4. There were a few items that really didn't suit my taste, but the set menus provided such a wide assortment that you're bound to have a few items that you find tasty. The sandwiches under "Veggies & Sweet" were probably my favorite because of all the unique fillings (honey lavender!). Some of my friends didn't like them as much but the "Land & Sea" sandwiches had more traditional centers, which were preferred. At the end, they give you a tower of pastries that I thought was adorable. I'm usually not a big fan of scones, but I thought they were decent here. I think that says a lot because I actually normally hate scones. I thought the chocolate mint (?) one was okay, maybe even a bit tasty, paired with the cream they provided. Some of the other pastries were either a hit or miss for me, but I liked that they were generally not overly sweet. 

As far as teas go, my favorite is definitely the Breakfast Candy. There were a few other flavors worth mentioning but I unfortunately don't recall what they were. 

The total is a bit pricey compared to your average meal, but I thought the food to money ratio was better here than the other high tea places in the city. At the end of the meal, we were actually quite full (though part of it was likely due to all of the tea we drank). And for those of you wondering, PARKING is incredibly easy in this area. I've gone twice on the weekend during lunch rush and there were plenty of metered spots within a 1-2 block radius.
author: Kari G.

description:
Afternoon tea with 2 girlfriends.  Total after tax & tip = $27 per person.

We got the AFternooon tea service for two ($43) + one add on ($22 for the 3rd person).  This comes with:

-20 mini sandwiches (choose 5 flavors)
-3 pots of bottomless tea
-Organic green salad with house-made viaigrette (so delicious)
-3 house-baked scones with all the fixing (cream, lemon curd and jam) - we got the lavendar flavored scones which were to die for delicious!
-Assorment of tea cakes/sweets, petits fours & tea biscuits (we got opera cakes, cake bites, red-velvet short bread cookies) 

The sandwiches were absolutely divine and very "gourmet" for a tea place.  Most other tea rooms offer much simpler sandwiches. 

We got to pick 5 flavors:
1. Smoked Ham and Horseradish cheddar (i'm not a fan of horseradish so this was my least favorite)
2. Turkey and Pesto Cream (So good! My fave!  The pesto cream is yogurt based and the flavor was absolutely amazing)
3.  Smoked-salmon and capers (very fresh, zesty and tasty)
4. Brie & Kicky Chutney (fruity and well paired flavors of the cheese and chutney)
5. Bacon and egg salad (the bacon adds extra flavor to the classic egg salad sandwich)

The tea i chose was the FROLIC in PHUKET, which is a green tea with lumps of guava.  It was very fruity and flavorful. I enjoyed every sip.

Overall:  This is one of the best tea rooms i've been to.  $27 per person for a full meal practically.  Great place to go to catch up with some girlfriends. Cheers!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This place is fantastic! Long overdue review...

I had forgotten I purchased two bloomspot deals for Dartealing Lounge until receiving a message from Bloomspot notifying me to use my vouchers before 1)They expire and 2) Before Bloomspot gets acquired from JP Morgan.

My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed everything here. We had their afternoon tea for two which included two pots of tea (your choice) and an array of sandwiches and baked goods. Everything was scrumptious but one sandwich really stood out and left us wanting more--I forget the name but it was like fish and chips in sandwich form. DELICIOUS & so brilliant! 

The service here was on par. They were so attentive and sweet and never made us feel like we were coupon bargain shoppers. 

Thanks for a great experience! We shall be back!
author: Jennie N.

description:
BREWING THE BAY: British afternoon tea

Oh my golly, could this place be any cuter? Girly, dolly, antique-y....Let's just say that if you're looking to severely emasculate a guy, you'd bring him here. :P

DarTealing Lounge has a pretty nice list of tea varietals to choose from. It's not the most expansive, but it covers a lot of flavors so most people will find something they like. My friend and I shared a bottomless pot of the "Champagne of the Himalayas" (because let's face it, how totally baller do you sound saying you drank "Champagne of the Himalayas"?). It was excellent--piping hot and perfectly brewed.

We also got a platter of sandwiches: roasted red peppers and hummus, chocolate peanut butter indulgence and turkey pesto. They were absolutely delicious. I love the non-traditional offerings like pesto and chocolate peanut butter. Mmm! The meal also included a garden salad, which was pretty forgettable.

A word about the teapots: Some of them are rather poorly made and can spill a lot of scalding hot liquid on you if not held properly. Don't be afraid to ask for a different teapot if that happens. 

Service was okay. It's largely staffed by Asian women whose grasp of English ranges from good to no-speak-English. They were fairly inattentive for the most part, but I think that's intentional, as the idea is to just relax and lounge for hours on end with your companions.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I really do not understand why in a city like San Francisco there is not a proper tea place. Anyway, we decided to try this place.  The location is awful, surrounded by drunk and drugged-out homeless all around.
The place is very small but nicely decorated.  They kept the main door open with its iron bars and I had my eyes on the main door as anyone very sketchy could have walked in any moment.
The tea cups are all mismatched but I think that adds to the charm.  They are thin porcelain with wide rims so you can taste the flavor of the tea better.
The décor is nice and there is a lot of it.  The texture on the walls is kind of nice, it looks like wallpaper but it is not.  It all looks a bit kitsch though.

The server was wearing a t-shirt and jeans. I think a more grown-up and polished uniform or clothes would have been more appropriate.

There are hats and gloves, like at LoveJoy, for people to wear.  I do not understand why having tea has to turn into a clown show, but, oh well.

The prices were high, especially for such a shitty location but I guess it is SF and you gotta live with it.

The tea selection was nice and there was a nice description next to each tea so I appreciated that.

The sandwich selection is pretty vast so that was good. Unfortunately, all the sandwiches tasted the same, mayo, mayo, mayo everywhere or something very similar to it.

There is the option of a salad with the sandwiches and you get a few leaves drenched in vinegar so that the vinegar touches also all the sandwiches. Gross.

We did not get an offer to refill our tea pots until we were ready to leave.

All in all, it is OK.  Better than the Fairmont, LoveJoy, and the Tea Shoppe that is located in a smelly polo equipment store.  I would not try the Crumpets place as it is very cramped in a café on top of a movie theatre in Japantown.   Maybe tea at the Ritz next?  Or just give up and have proper tea in another town.
author: Sailing A.

description:
I've had tea sandwiches at many tea lounges and Dartealing's tea sandwiches are the best! I went two weeks ago and got the Taste-tea Service for Two.

For sandwiches, I got the fish & chips, which had the perfect amount of crispiness and flavor, and the spicy hummus mediterranean, which was also delicious!

For tea, I got the Cabana Boy, a green tea with papaya and strawberry. So yummy!

Everything was filling. I couldn't even finish the macaron and shortbread desserts. Pretty good for just $40. Other (mediocre) places I've been to are $50+.

Parking is street parking, but you'll find a spot, no problem.
author: Ashley M.

description:
This please is overpriced, the location is awful, the sandwich are so small and they charged extra of $3 to me and my friends for sharing 2 tea pots for 4. I couldn't believe it!! I can't drink more that half tea pot is just too much for me. Also the menus were so small. It tasted good but not great. The service was so slow and we ordered two extra sweet and the waitress only brought one. 
I've just been many times in Love joys and It's just perfect!! Don't come here to pay a lot for a bite!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Love this place tried it with a few girlfriends today for a friends bday! We had a blast the tea was awesome we tried a couple differ things. The food was perfect light and delicious the tea was also perfect. I recommend Casablanca after midnight and the spiced coffee for drink option! I will be back!
author: Paula P.

description:
First high tea experience. It was very delightful. 

My fiancé surprised me with a day-date to Dartealing. I've been wanting to have high tea for a while now, so I was super stoked. 

Upon arrival we were greeted with very friendly service. Although my fiancé felt out if place since he was the only guy there, the waitresses made him feel very comfortable. 

We had the Afternoon-Tea for 2 ($48). It included 3 types of sandwiches, scones, other sweet treats, and 2 bottomless tea. For tea we chose Cabana Boy green tea which had fruit bits in it and also a Vanilla flavored- earl grey. They were both so good! All the sandwiches and sweet treats were very good. We didn't think it would fill us up, but it actually did. It is ample food and tea for 2 people. 

The best part of our first high tea experience is the service. We are huge on customer service, and they did not fall short of our expectations one bit! All the ladies were super sweet and helpful. 

We are both so glad we had the experience! Men, this is super romantic and sweet! Get over the fear of being the only guy in there, and take your lady here!
author: Jennifer T.

description: I had my daughter's first birthday here.  It is a diamond in the rough.  The place is adorable.  The tea, sandwiches, and desserts were very tasty and lovely.  The only thing that prevented me from giving them 5 stars was the service.  It was inattentive and a bit lack luster.  I think they can improve on that.  Other then that, yes I would visit this place again.
author: Helen K.

description: Cute space with great food. We got the panini service for two and two kids' teas. The paninis were delicious as well as the teas and sweets. There was plenty of food. The kids' plates were plentiful too. The kids enjoyed having their own pot of strawberry milk. It's a great spot.
author: Payal V.

description:
I love having afternoon tea. I've tried the majority of the ones offered here in SF and I've taken friends, hubs, family etc, Drinking hot tea - what an ideal, relaxing, therapeutic thing to do on a dreary SF day. It's probably why afternoon tea is major part of the British culture where it's gloomy majority of the year. 

I came by with two others and we immediately decided we liked the homey decor. Very cute. I liked the deliberately mismatched upholstered arm chairs at the tables. 

So between the three of us, we decide on the tea for two and had an add-on for our 3rd person. For about $70 you get:
-scones with lemon curd
-one pot of tea per person (I had the Parisian Earl Grey)
-5 different sandwiches (20 mini finger sandwiches altogether)
-petit fours
-a couple cream puffs and a tart
-a salad
(Later I realized I forgot to add a crumpet to the order b/c for me crumpets and tea go hand in hand.)

My favorite place for high tea in SF is one that shall remain nameless however the horrible parking situation there deterred us from heading out that way. But this was a nice alternative. Especially since I live about a two minute drive from here and it is very convenient from those coming from the East Bay as it is right off of 80.
author: Esther A.

description: Such a cute place with a comforting ambiance. My mom recommended this place to me and what a great brunch I ended up having with my girlfriends. There were four of us and we ordered an Afternoon Tea for Two and a Taste Tea Service for two. We did have some leftovers, but not too many and the sandwiches, all of them, were scrumptious. There are many, many teas to choose from and the names of the teas are cute, too!  Casablanca After Midnight, Pinky Minky, and Jasmine and Jade were the 3 teas we ordered and all were perfect to the taste (and bottomless). The pesto turkey sandwich is especially tasty. And it ended up being only $25 per person. Will definitely be going back.
author: Isabelle H.

description: Came here with a group of 7 girls for my girlfriend's birthday. We had 4 tea choices, platter of sandwiches, platter of scones, and some cookies. I really liked the black tea with the milk they offered on the side with some sugar. The other teas were sweet and also good. The platter of sandwiches were quite filling, but I enjoyed the brie version best. The scones was my favorite part! They had some sort of lavender cream that we placed onto the scones which were buttery goodness! Other than the scones, everything was decent, nothing too outstanding. Service was a little slow and it took forever for us to get seated when we had reservations - supposedly the group ahead of us just sat around instead of leaving after their tea session. Don't think I would be back. A teaparty isn't really my thing after trying this one - overpriced pastries and sandwiches.
author: Amanda C.

description:
afternoon serendipi-tea for two:
parisian earl grey: wonderful notes of vanilla.
pinky minky: very berry and tasty.
ham and horseradish cheddar finger sandwiches: my favorite.
turkey and creamy pesto finger sandwiches: lots of flavor but i suspect they use costco kirkland pesto.
strawberries and cream finger sandwiches: sweet and cream-cheesy.
salad: well dressed and delicious croutons.
red velvet cupcakes: moist and buttery.
chocolate lavender scone: fragrant and crumbly.
cranberry scone: a usual suspect.
devonshire cream: not dense but a whipped texture.
service: mediocre and nonsmiley.
parking: easy access metered right out the door.
value: reasonable with lots of food.

but still not as good as lovejoy's!
author: Charmaine L.

description: Very limited menu, and quite rude service. The waitress didn't know that chamomile tea is not the same as green tea, and left the rest of us confused as to what we were drinking. She also was unfriendly and not very helpful
author: Gina K.

description:
I hate to give a bad review but I feel misled by the large number of high ratings this place has. Many of the bad reviews, on the other hand, specifically call out the exact issues I experienced.

First, the good. The tea was alright. The spiced raisin chutney and the brie was pretty good.

Everything else was bad. Out of a long list of things not to like, the stuffiness and heat was the worst. Within 5 minutes of entering the place, I was uncomfortable; by the time we were ready to leave, I was miserable. There is no moving air in this place, and the temperature was way high. If you stuff a large number of people into a "cozy" space, you have to have some ventilation. (This wasn't just me, I shared a word with another customer while waiting for the bathroom who remarked on how hostile it was.)

The food was not great. The sausage in puff pastry was a lot like eating a microwaved frozen thing. The Welsh rabbit tasted a bit scorched with little black bits on the cheese and burned edges on the bread (not deep brown, char black). No, I wasn't going to send it back and give the kitchen a chance to correct it because it was obvious at a glance, and if it was an aberration the waitstaff would have caught it at the pass.

The bathrooms were kind of dirty. Someone was waiting to get in the men's room, so I decided to use the sink outside the bathrooms to move things along...no way to dry my hands? Not even a place to put paper towels, like an empty dispenser that needed refilling? No wastebasket for used paper towels? Come to our fancy tea lounge where we expect you to wash up like like you're a Boy Scout on a camping trip.

The wait to get the bill was far too long, especially since the waitress could see I was uncomfortable.

Besides the oppressive heat and stuffiness, the biggest problem with this place is it presents itself as a somewhat high-end experience (and certainly charges high-end prices) but it delivers nothing close to that. If the total bill came in half what it was, that would be somewhat more in line with the experience...but to be honest I still wouldn't return.
author: Steven R.

description:
This is by far my favorite tea place! 

The place is quaint and cozy. My boyfriend who is English feels very at home here. 

They are always accommodating. The staff is always friendly. The food is amazing. My god, their scones are soooo good. 

This place is a little hidden gem in my neighborhood! Love love love
author: Kris P.

description: Everything about my experience was excellent.  Our table was ready when we arrived, early.  Our food and tea was delicious.  The ambiance was relaxed and the decor, darling.  We were definitely not rushed, which was especially nice since our tea was a baby shower with lots of gifts to be opened.
author: Mike C.

description: We tried this place for the first and last time today.  The food was good and so was the tea (most of their selections are flavored, so better choices if you like flavored tea).  However, the service was abysmal.  We literally waited more than 30 minutes before anything was brought to our table.  And I think that was the strainers for our tea.  We were starving by the time the food arrived so didn't taste much of the first savory items.  Wow.  For such a cute place and good idea for a special holiday outing in the city, what a huge disappointment.  Don't waste your time (literally).  I tried to post this review with 0 (zero, zip, zilch, nada) stars, but yelp requires at least one.  Can't recommend it.
author: Jules S.

description:
I am smitten with the shabby chic, vintage-y decor! I've been to two other tea houses in the Bay Area and both were too old lady for my taste. The food (tea sandwiches) here is pretty good, not fantastic, but good. The scones were the stars of the meal, served warm and with sides of fresh lemon curd and berry preserves *DROOL* 

We sampled the Maryann, Ginger and Lemongrass tea (too much ginger for my taste) and the Breakfast  Candy tea (almond + vanilla = awesome). The tea menu is so fun and reads like hip OPI nail polish names.

Word to the wise: the coffee Vera Cruz, which is coffee, coke and vanilla was no bueno for my stomach! I am a regular strong coffee drinker but this drink was just wrong. 

I will definitely be coming back to DarTealing - pinkies up!
author: Gigi V.

description:
Charming ambiance.  Sandwiches are fabulous.  Great selection. Outstanding service.  Awesome tea selection.  One of the best teas in San Francisco.

I would have given 5 stars except there is always an issue with the bathroom.  It is either lacking supplies or needs to be cleaned.  When you are considering a restaurant, the cleanliness of their restrooms are an indication of the cleanliness of the restaurant.  The staff at Dartealing need to be more aware of what is happening in the restroom and take steps to make sure that the bathroom is always immaculate.

The restaurant itself is always sparkling clean.  The restroom is outside in the hallway.  It is almost like it is a forgotten component.
author: Janis O.

description:
I've been looking for a place like this for years!

The atmosphere is perfect -- in many places, high tea has become too stuffy, but Dartealing gets it just right, with artfully mismatched tableware and a comfortably faux-Victorian setting. It's cute, but not aggressively cute. You could bring a kid here for a tea party, sure, but an adult could also come, settle in, and have high tea without feeling silly.

Generous pots of tea accompany stacks of ideal little sandwiches and cakes. Again, lots of places try too hard to make tea "gourmet." Dartealing makes it interesting and delicious without being intimidating. The coronation chicken is to die for. I wish I could go back every week and pick out something else from their selection of made-to-order sandwiches. The cakes are delicious. A whole set, with two pots, was perfect for two people.

We went in on a Friday afternoon and had absolutely no trouble being seated or served. Our server, who also seemed to be the manager or owner, made sure we were satisfied with everything.

Also: for high tea, this place is inexpensive!
author: Eric S.

description: I went to Dartealing for the first time yesterday and I loved it! Although the service was a bit slow, the food and tea was great! I got the smoked salmon sandwich which was really good and the chefs selection which was an apple, chicken, and cranberry sandwich which was also delicious. The chocolate scones were absolutely delightful and the whole experience was enjoyable.
author: Kai L.

description:
Best scones in town! 

Their homemade bechamel sauce in the croque monsieur as well as the homemade lemon curd for the scones are to die for. I could tell that a lot of care went into each sandwich because the spreads were so delicious!

Service was impressive considering how many people were flagging down the waitresses. Our table had great service though and we were in and out of there easily within an hour and a half (the recommended amount of time for a tea set). 

I honestly don't know why there are some reviews about bad service. We actually had two servers helping our table. They were both very knowledgeable in recommending teas and we had all of our food explained to us when it came out on really cute tiers! They happily helped us take pictures while we wore the fancy hats that they have there. 

I did see the table next to us try to use a coupon and the waitress very politely told her that it was not valid for use on the weekend (we went on a Saturday). The lady was a bit flustered but the server was very accommodating (by the way, if you have a coupon, I suggest that you READ THE FINE PRINT before you come in. It's your responsibility to know what you bought and when you can use it.) In the end, the lady next to us left with a smile. 

Overall, great service and I will definitely be coming back here...especially for the scones!
author: Jen A.

description: If you are hungry and come in mid-afternoon when the place isn't packed.... You'll still be starving. Not sure why, but the service is so slow. You won't get your tea until 15 min after you order and your food? Add another 30 at least. The tea sandwiches are nothing spectacular, but I'll admit their tea selection is pretty yummy.
author: Jewdee J.

description:
Disclaimer -- I would go back, but couldn't justify saying "Yay! I am a fan" to this tea lounge. 

We ordered tea (I got the mint lavender tea -- yuummm, I love the kick in the tea), chocolate chip scones, cucumber/herb sandwiches, and salmon/cream sandwiches.  My friend loved the scone and the lemon curd.  I, on the other hand, loved the raspberry jam.  

Fun Note:  You can pick up a sun hat to wear while you drink tea (by the coat rack/hanger).  Not sure who's been wearing them but I thought it was a clever and fun idea.  

We went for an afternoon tea during a weekday, and we weren't pressured to leave.  Not sure what it would be like on a weekend (per some of the reviews).
author: Jister Y.

description:
We wanted to find a tea lounge in San Francisco to host a baby shower for a family member. Found this place through yelp and decided to give it a try based on the rave review...boy, it did not let us down! 

Our party consisted of 8 adults and 7 young kids. All the way through the staff was uber accommodating and friendly, which was impressive to say the least. They would come ask if we are ready for the food so when we eat, and keep the scones warm in the oven until then. This alone earns so many points from me!

During the planning process before the party, the staff was also helpful and promptly responds to any questions.

We had four flavors of sandwiches and teas. Sandwiches: lavender, fish fillet, curried chicken, and another I forgot. Teas: Jasmine, Earl Grey and Watermelon Rooibos (my personal favorite out of them). I even purchased two bags of the Booibos tea when we were leaving the restaurant. 

In summary, this tea lounge has great service, excellent food, and a very chill ambience to go with it. Highly recommended!
author: Ed L.

description:
DarTealing was everything I wanted my first high tea experience to be! Just the right amounts of cute, kitschy, and delicious. 

Went here with roommates for my birthday, we got the Afternoon Tea service for three. What ended up on our table: 

--Three bottomless pots of tea. 
'Breakfast Candy': So, so good! Well worth the extra $3. Black tea with almond and caramel flavors. I ended up buying two (sort of expensive) ounces of this to take home with me. 
'Lapsang Souchong': Tasted like a campfire in a tea cup, very smoky and strong. I personally loved it, though my boyfriend wasn't as enthused. 
'Jasmine & Jade': A very good jasmine green tea. 

--A whole lotta sandwiches (we got to pick out five flavors). Curried chicken, brie/jelly/apple, hungarian egg, tuna, and cucumber herbs. Really liked all of them. 

--Three scones with devonshire, lemon curd, and raspberry preserves. Why can't I make scones this good? Why can't I eat devonshire cream by the bowlful? Why can't I live here forever? 

--3 bite-sized butter cookies. Yum.

--6 bite-sized fruit tarts. Yum.

We were all full by the end of our tea, which was really unexpected. My two tea companions were both manly men so that says something about the deceptively dainty-looking food. 

Don't come here if you're looking for fancypants tea service with matching tableware and linen napkins. DarTealing is sweetly casual and relaxed, like having tea in your favorite grandmother's living room rather than the queen's tea room (though my grandma is a queen in her own right so there goes my analogy, oops). 

Do come here if you want to drink lots of fantastic tea and nibble on tasty sweets and sandwiches, all served by really nice and accommodating people.
author: Angela N.

description:
I've tried a few high tea places, and this one is certainly my favorite. Its surroundings are not the best, but once you enter you feel like you are in a different world - a safer one that you and your female friends would be forced to conclude is "cute". One thing that sets it apart from other high tea places is that the atmosphere is cozy rather than prim.

I love the Blooms and the Covent platters - they are priced comparably to the other (low-end) high tea places I've been to, but you get more for your money. It's enough to serve as a full brunch, especially when the people you go with are city-dwelling women. And it all tastes fantastic. I haven't tried a sandwich flavor I didn't like, but curried egg and apple is my favorite. The scones are scrumptuous, go perfectly with tea and creamy butter, and come in different flavors on different days. My favorite so far was tiramisu, and I don't even like tiramisu by itself. With the Blooms, the salad also provides a great refreshing touch.
author: Martin L.

description:
I just had the worst tea experience.

Working under the assumption that every place has five yelp stars to lose you start out with five stars. The decor is super cute. There is a set of vintage glassware on a pass through shelf between the tea room and salon next door   Even the enameled clothespin that they use to present the bill to you is cute.  Everything is super shabby chic and tasteful. Five stars.

I came a bit early because I didn't know exactly how long it would take to get there. It was also abnormally hot for San Francisco.  It was in the higher seventies and the tea room had no AC. (Not unusual I think for San Francisco). I waited in the waiting room awkwardly for about five minutes. I flagged a server down to check in and I told her that I had a cancellation and we would only be one person less than
originally anticipated.  Sure it was my fault for coming early but a glass of ice water would have been really nice.  Perhaps this is where things went south.  This is just dicta. Zero star reduction.

Then my friends started coming. A lot of people also thought it was hot and asked for ice with our tea. We had ordered some fruity teasanes which happen to be really refreshing while iced.  We got the dirtiest look when we asked for the ice. Then the ice didn't come and we asked again. Someone commented "Did we offend her?  I'm sure it's nontraditional."  They also set the table for six. And we asked for an additional set up. Minus one star for the ice incident.

I then got a call that one additional friend was coming  "we'll work something out" says the server.  Who doesn't. About an hour later we had to ask two additional times about the cups meanwhile not everyone had cups. We used the cup the ice came in for one person and one guest just sat at the tea place with no beverage. Not to mention at the third request I got an "I know!" from the server. Then three cups and set ups came. Minus one star for cup incidents.

Lemon curd and jam. Hello scones. Where's the curd and jam?  We sat with our food for a while and ate the itty bitty sandwiches. And waited for the lemon curd and jam.  After a longer while we asked for some lemon curd and jam. And then the server gave us a glass container with lemon curd and a tiny bit of jam. "This is all the jam we have!" Really?  At this point in the service, we were all a little annoyed.  One of my friends said "they probably had hella jam back there". Someone else said "you better use all that jam because (the server) looks like she's going to kill you". We used all of it and it was good. One star reduction on jam incident.

BTW anyone who's interested in an easy lemon curd recipe Ina Garten has a delicious one online.  My fridge is full of it right now.  No joke.

When you place your order you are told there are refillable pots of tea. Nobody offered us more hot water for teas. Or cold water in lieu of tea. But at this point I wasn't so thirsty that I needed more interactions with their serving staff. This may have been avoided by someone saying "Hi, how are you doing so far?" during our visit.  Minus one star for not performing as promised.  

Lastly the bill came. It had an unexplained charge for "split" and tip precalculated and added into the total. And suddenly everything became clear. Why pay attention to that table who wants ice, jam, cups, and water when you're just going to add in gratuity anyway?  They also failed to account for the deposit I paid ahead of time, but fixed that. Minus one star for generalized bill snafu.

As to the food it was pretty unremarkable except for the quinoa salad which was delicious and the cutest little fruit tarts ever.  There was some white cake which was suffering in the heat. It was quite sad. It had cute pink and white frosting and it was melting off the cake.  I'm sure it was quite beautiful originally.  And I wasn't sure which sandwiches were which visually.  It would've been nice for them to explain them to us.  Craftsman and Wolves explains all the food to you, provides jam/curd, and isn't directly under the freeway.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I walked by this place one day.  It doesn't look like anything from the outside, but I saw what looked like a really cute tea place when I looked inside.  I came back a week later with my husband.  The decor is really cute, as you can see from the other photos that have been posted.  One ding is that the chairs at our table were really uncomfortable.  I saw some nicer chairs and a cute sofa at the other tables that fit the theme better and are probably more comfortable.  The tea selection/variety was also really good.  However, the food wasn't good.  The sandwiches had way too much mayo - or whatever cream they use.  They were almost inedible.  The cakes weren't that good either - they didn't taste fresh and the cake was dry.    So all in all, the decor is cute and the tea is good, but the food is bad.  I'd go back for tea only...but I'd like to find another place to go to for high tea.
author: Negar A.

description:
I am in love!! I took my best friend here for her birthday with my sisters.

We ordered two sets of tea for twos, so really it was tea for four. We each got a pot of bottomless tea, which was super scrummy. I had Earl gray, my favorite!!! :)

We got to choose six different flavors for sandwiches. OMG. these were so goooood!!! I could really eat them everyday.
Smoked ham and horseradish cheddar- this one was one of my favorites. We even went and bought groceries to make these babies for lunch the next day!
Turkey and pesto cream- kinda disappointed by this one. Probably my least favorite. It was still good, but not compared to the other ones. 
Curries chicken- yum! Caught us off guard. We thought it'd be gross but wow! The deliciousness sneaked up on us. I picked out the raisins though.
Classic cucumber and fresh herbs- this is the ONLY place that makes cucumber sandwiches that I like!!!! Bravo. That is all I have to say. 
Brie and lucky chutney- yummm, brie.
Strawberries and cream- one of our favorites. So good. You must. 

The salad wasn't too good, it was actually pretty not good. I liked the croutons though!

I usually love petit fours but these were just medicore. Or maybe I was just really full. Vanilla scone was SUPER noms! I normally dont like scones but WOW! I died. Crumpets were also really good. Especially when smothered in cream and lime curd :)

We're coming back for my birthday and my mom's birthday!!!!
author: Bianca W.

description: It's really great food and tea. But a little pricy so just for special occasions and remember to save up
author: G-Dragon Girl K.

description:
What a cute little tea lounge! I near randomly stumbled upon Dartealing as I was looking for a venue to host a bridal shower. Of all the places I found online, this option ended up being the best since it met our budget and could accommodate a large group (~25).

Pauline was great to work with as I planned the event. After our initial phone call, the rest of our communication was over the phone. She was very attentive and helpful!

The food and teas were tasty, and there was a variety for the group, but I definitely had my favorite!  We went with the My Dear Felici-tea tea set, which came with 4 sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies and 4 teas. I read reviews about what everyone else thought was great, but hands down, the egg salad w/ bacon sandwich was THE BEST! Of course everything is better with bacon, but this was just amazing!  I also really liked the petit fours.

Here was our actual menu:

Sandwiches:
Turkey & Pesto Cream
Bacon & Egg
Classic Cucumber & Fresh Herbs
Strawberries & Cream

Tea:
Cherry Moon
Frolic in Phuket
Rice-too-Crispy
Memories of Provence

Dessert:
Chocolate dipped biscotti bites
Plain scones
Tiramisu scones
Petit fours (that were special ordered and added to the menu)

I tried 2 of the teas and both were yummy and fragrant.

The decor was really cute!  Everything was mis-matched, even down to the glasses that they used to serve our chamapgne!

Whether it's just a get together with friends or another special event, I'll definitely keep Dartealing high on my list!
author: Audrey C.

description: A wonderful place to take your girl friends to catch up!  The food is excellent!
author: Joahnna H.

description: Really cute small venue in the SOMA.  I enjoyed the green and peach tea, the sandwhiches are OK, salmon was my favorite flavor, the hummus and pesto didn't go with my taste buds, the lavendar is a very interesting flavor that you will have to try out for yourself.  I think I prefer the decor of LoveJoys.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I don't like to write bad reviews but this was an EPIC FAIL!

What a terrible experience and disappointment!  

- 20 mins wait to order even though the place was empty
- scones were minuscule and they didn't even provide jam with it
- the waitress disappeared after she dropped off the food
- no refill on 'bottomless' pot of tea
- waited a long time to get the bill and waitress got it wrong twice -- (charged for pot of tea even though it was included with tea service; waitress made correction and came back again with wrong total)
- adding insult to injury...they imposed a 20% gratuity...even though service was non-existent.
author: Lis A.

description:
Nestled under the 80, midst the blah buildings of SoMa, DarTealing is a "blink and you'll miss it" sort of establishment...that you DON'T want to miss. 

I found DarTealing on yelp, trying to find a good place for afternoon tea with a relative visiting from out of town. The Palace was way out of budget, Lovejoys in Noe seemed to be targeted at a demographic that still feeds tea to their teddy bear, and DarTealing had just the right amount of kitsch to make it special, but a legit menu and selection of teas that make for proper tea time.

Since then, I've dragged nearly all my friends there. I schlepp across the Bay Bridge for a) the ambiance b) the extensive tea menu and c) the honey lavender cream tea sandwich. I'm never disappointed, always find parking, and always leave with a surprisingly full tummy! 

I'd tell you what I recommend, but frankly - it's all good. My usual is the Afternoon Tea Service for 2 - the perfect amount of tea sandwiches (good luck choosing your 3 options, btw), salad, scones, and petite sweets. Honey lavender cream is my ultimate favorite. Cucumber is phenomenal - and sort of a staple, the Curried Darjealing Chicken is delish, etc.etc. (I think you get the point). 

I find the $42 (or $48 - can't remember) to be fairly reasonable when split among two people. Could it be cheaper? Sure. But between the fantastic service, fantastic eats, and charming ambiance, I can't say that I mind too much.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
I got a few of the ladies together for afternoon tea on a sunny saturday.  
After researching the other venues in the city, it was clear that DarTealing stood head and shoulders above the rest.
-Lovejoys: too busy and too many children
-Crown & Crumpet: too touristy
-Secret Garden: too far away from downtown
DarTealing is the  modern girl's tea lounge.
While not much too look at from the outside DarTealing Lounge has all the cute shabby-chic
 trappings without being frilly and silly.
Due to the large size of our party(13)Pauline, the owner suggested I preselect the menu. 
She emailed over the reservation agreement along with a list of tasty tea sandwiches and tea varieties.
I was also able to bring in prosecco for a very reasonable corkage fee.

We had a very enjoyable evening and adored the presentation of all the tea sandwiches, scones, teas and of course the petit fours. I highly recommend ordering the curried chicken sandwiches as well as the pear and caramel teas-true standouts. Service flowed seamlessly and the staff was able to handle our large party without any trouble.
Many thanks to Pauline and the DarTealing Lounge staff for all their hard work. Visit DarTealing Lounge and 'Sip Elegantly'. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
This place is the GREATEST!!! Keith and Pauline are quite possibly the nicest owners on the planet! 

I came here a few weeks ago with my best gal pals for a nice, leisurely tea party. We had sandwiches, scones, 4 types of tea, green salad and petit fours. ALL WERE DELICIOUS!!! 

We ordered the following teas: Creamy Dreamy Earl Grey (Which yours truly recommended it to Pauline waaaay back in the day), Coconut Custard Rooibus, Long Island Strawberry and Lemon Ginger. 

Sandwiches we devoured: chicken salad, roasted red pepper & pesto, shrimp w/ green onions and spring peas, and chutney and brie. They. Were. Awesome!

I will definitely be back - this place is beautifully decorated (shabby chic meets tea. Mismatched china, dainty silverware, you name it). The candy table at the front and the ridiculously awesome selection of teas are a MUST see.
author: Shachi B.

description:
Group of about 8-10 girls, came for friend's 29th bday. I was super against a tea house since I had a horrible experience at crown and crumpet (bad food and rude owner/manager) and both lovejoy's and C&C have a similar policy that you had to pay the difference for no-shows in your party, ie: if only 6 show out of 10, you pay the $20+/person difference.

For a casual, girly time eating nibbles and drinking tea, I really did not want to deal with a strict cancellation policy, but we found Dartealing last minute and they were very accommodating, no cancellation charge or penalty for having a smaller party. The ladies there were really nice and best of all the food was really good! I am usually a fan of hot, flavorful asian food not tiny crustless sandwiches and scones, but everything was very delicious, there was enough fat to apease me while still being delicate, and the clotted cream was AMAZING, alot like cream cheese icing, whipped and less sweet, the birthday girl felt it should be incorporated into a more mainstream part of the American diet...(just what we need :P) 

Anyhoo, the service was a bit slow, but we had the place to ourselves. The bathroom was clean and I am guessing all of the relaxed atmosphere and casual reservation policy is due to the somewhat random location....(it is in SOMA, not a pretty stroll in noe valley or ghirardelli square like lovejoys and C&C respectively)

We all went shopping afterwards, just drove a couple blocks closer and it was really a great way to start the day. Oh yes, the nicoisse salad was SUPER delicious, there were 2 fried sunny side up eggs on top, everthing dressed and tossed with fresh green beans and tomatoes, soooo good to round out all the starch in the sandwiches, I reccomend the turky pesto, brie chutney and curry.
author: Lily G.

description:
Wow, this place has so much potential, yet manages to fail SO badly.  The ambience is super cute - it's an adorably eclectic mashup of cutesy mis-matched chairs, tables, lamps and other furniture.  You literally feel like you walked into the home of an 80 year old grandma or a super kitschy bed and breakfast (I mean this in the best possible way!).

Where it all goes wrong though is the service.  I came here with a group of 7 girls.  Since we had an odd number, we thought we'd split 3 of the tea services for 2 amongst the 7 of us.  The server must have informed us about 1000 times that we would have to pay extra for sharing the tea service.  This even though we also ordered a bunch of stuff a la carte.

The food and tea were mediocre but honestly I'd most likely have given 3 or even 4 stars but for the atrocious service.  It totally ruined the experience for me.
author: Gowri R.

description: Cozy tea room, with mix & match tea set (urban style, even thought it is not exactly traditional English style, more like Hippie Yippie San Francisco style ).
author: Tai V.

description:
This is just adorable. Imagine Lovejoys, but turn it down just a notch. I came over here and had tea with a friend afterwork on a Friday. The place was pretty dead quiet with the exception of us so it was nice to be able to see the entire place.

It's quite small, and not as big as Lovejoys. I did appreciate that they went with the mismatch teacups and saucers. J and I went with the savory tea for 2, which was a selection of savory snacks and 1 pot of tea (I'm surprised it was only 1 pot, I'm used to 1 pot per person ...)

The savory snacks were delish. The molten lava cake was super good, and the brie + chutney on bread was yum. Not to mention I really liked the curry pastry and the sausage puffs. So so good.

I enjoyed it. It helped that it was quite and it was just us. There was 1 other table of 5 guys that came in, but they weren't there nearly as long as we were. I expected the tea we got to be a bit stronger (we got the Majesty's Secret Service which was a vanilla black tea). Either way, I'd come back.
author: Jessica H.

description:
An unexpectedly charming find, DarTealing Lounge looks like a Victorian era English cottage inside, with pale blue walls, plates and tea pots on display, mini cupcakes, and tea and candy in glass jars.  Martha Stewart would approve of the candy display. Place settings feature non-matching, assorted china plates and cups.  Flower designs are everywhere but it doesn't feel too grandmotherly.

Choose from tea services, sandwiches, tartines and salads. The tea list is a lengthy one.

* Serendipi-Tea ($25 for one person, $8 split plate charge): Comes with your choice of two sandwich types, a big pot of tea for each person (with unlimited refills), a heap of mixed greens in a slightly sweet, tangy vinaigrette, warm scone, Devon cream, sweets (a tiny slice of bread pudding, a cookie, Petit four).

The salad was nice but plain. The scone was okay - on the dry side, lacking in flavor. The tiny checkerboard cookie was store bought. I wasn't too keen on the Devon cream. 

The crustless sandwiches (larger than the usual finger sandwiches, about  of a slice of bread) were quite good - moist, lots of flavors and spreads. We had the ham and cheese with cream cheese on wheat bread, and the turkey and pesto with sundried tomato bits and cream cheese on white bread.

The setting is nice and the sandwiches are lovely (thank you Genevieve Y.), but you get very little food for over $30.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Cute place to grab tea with your girls.  I went here with my cousins and ordered a tea set that included 12 sandwiches, 2 bottomless pots of tea, figgy pudding, petit fours, cookies, and scones.  Main food highlights: The roast beef sandwich was really tasty and the bleu cheese wasn't as strong as we anticipated.  The petit fours were delicious!  It reminded us of a cake pop, but not as sweet.  The peppermint cookies were buttery and had just the right amount of peppermint flavor.  The scones were nice a crunchy and the cream was a great addition to give the scones a moist texture.  Our favorite tea was their holiday special called, "snickerdoodle black tea," especially when you add the milk and sugar..mMMmm

This place is a little pricey, but definitely worth the experience.  Also parking was super easy!  We snagged a spot right in front of DarTealing :)
author: Kristen T.

description:
I really like this place. Granted, I only have one other tea lounge to compare it to but this one beats it by far... the sandwiches are just SO good.

Of course, one comes to a tea lounge to enjoy some good tea. I have to say, the tea is pretty disappointing though. No matter what flavor you choose, it's always bland and watered down. It makes you want to add tons of sugar or cream just so you can taste SOMETHING other than water. They really should put more tea leaves and less water or just mess around with the tea:water ratio a little more. 

The best sandwiches to choose are:
-Turkey and Pesto
-Strawberries and Cream
-Fish N' Chips (mmmmm! my fave!)
-smoked salmon and capers

I also love their scones and muffins at the end. The pastries are neither dry or soggy.The lemon creme and strawberry jam adds the perfect combination between tartness and sweetness to them.

Service is never a problem when I come. Location could be a little more convenient though - parking can be a problem.
author: Liana L.

description:
I've come here twice using Bloomspots, and both times I had a really pleasant experience. Parking there during the day wasn't as tough as I thought it would be (all the meters take credit cards), although I don't recommend going when the Giants have a home game. It's an adorable and comfortable space, and the staff there has always been sweet and welcoming.

Having checked out other major tea lounges in SF (namely Lovejoy's/Lovey's which have very similar vibes and menus), there are some key differences to note:

1) DarTealing has the best scones, by far. They're huge with a nice crunchy crust, and have been baked with fresh lavender. I could not get enough.

2) Afternoon Tea for 2 is $48 (compared to $39 at the Lovejoy's places), but I think it includes more. There are definitely more desserts and you don't have to pay extra for lemon curd. They are also very generous with the devon cream.I also think the tea sandwiches at DT are a bit larger. DT also has a Yelp check in offer of $40 for Afternoon Tea for two, which is a wonderful deal.

3) As far as tea sandwich selection goes, I think all the places have a lot of variety. I do have to say that I really disliked DT's smoked salmon and dill sandwich. They add chives instead of capers and it was so creamy (but not exactly cream cheese) and chive-y that I couldn't really taste the salmon. It was also sweet, somehow, which I didn't like because I prefer a more savory salmon sandwich that emphasizes that wonderful salmon flavor. It's also the only sandwich I am guaranteed to choose every time at any place that serves tea sandwiches, so it's the only one I can compare across tea places. 

4) I do really like the DT sandwiches with olives, because they use the green olives with pimento that I love, so I especially recommend the havarti and green olive sandwich.

Overall, I think this is a great tea lounge. They also sell loose leaf tea, pastries, tea service china, and tea accessories. I highly recommend it if you're in the area and check in here on Yelp, but skip the salmon sandies until they balance out the flavors.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I really enjoyed my afternoon at Dartealing. The room is filled with mix match furniture which I found to be charming and cozy. I could have sat in the room chatting for hours (and I sort of did). So atmosphere 5 stars! Next, the tea. Tea has become my fuel for life and while I enjoy favorful teas the menu did lack some of the classic black teas that avid tea drinkers might be in search of, such as Assam. I was delighted by a never ending pot of peach black tea that was served in a adorable floral pot. The ladies I lunched with and myself ordered a tea that came with a few sweets and scones, and each set came with a choice of two sandwich flavors. My favorite was the fish and chips, what a cute way to capture a British classic. The scones were delicious, and came in inventive flavors. While perhaps not the most traditional, still very much enjoyable. I was so pleased to also get to meet Pauline the owner and Chef, she is wildly interesting and even inspiring. 
Side Note: to everyone complaining about service being slow, you should know that tea is not to be rushed. It should be spent leisurely and with warm conversation. Put your phone down and enjoy your company, spend some time sipping on tea and take a moment to relax.
author: Amanda E.

description:
A girl friend and I where looking for a place to have high tea. I came across a deal on travelzoo that we wanted to use today. The voucher said to call and make a reservation. When I called the number it was a voicemail. I left a message to see about a reservation later that afternoon. Since I didn't hear back. We decided to take our chances and see if we could do a walk-in. When we arrived there were a decent amount of empty seats. The hostess was able to accommodate us. We decided to go with the Dartealing Afternoon Tea Service for 2, which included Twelve tea sandwiches made to order
(3 flavors), Organic green salad with house 
vinaigrette, A pair of warm heritage scones
& Royal cream, Assortment of tea cakes and
shortbread cookies, Two bottom-less pots of tea. With regards to the assortment of tea cakes and shortbread cookies. Our order consisted of two of the same (2 choco cakes & 2 blueberry shortbread cookies) - see photos.

I had the "Island Kiss (organic) tea" - a uplifting organic blend of green tea, tropical 
fruit essence, bananas, and coconut. My girlfriend had the "Last Mango in Paris" - special blend of red rooibos with ripe, juicy 
mango. Both teas were exceptionally refreshing and complimented the sandwiches and pastries nicely.

I look forward to more social gatherings here in the future.
author: Kristina S.

description:
I absolutely ADORE this place. Located in the most unsuspecting of places; the corner of a small back-alley type street underneath a freeway overpass completely secluded from the hustle and bustle of the SOMA; this tea house is on my list of favorite places to nibble and gossip over tea with a couple of your closest girlfriends 

What to order: 
-The coconut tea is amazing--just the right amount of coconut flavor in the background (I'm not the biggest coconut fan, so this is saying a lot!)
-Tea for two (or three, just add one more person for an extra $8) was just the right amount of tea and goodies 
-Black tea with lavender (I can't remember the exact name of this, so please ask the server and she'll know what you're talking about) is probably my fav! So perfect with scones and tea sandwiches. I'm still dreaming on this tea
-Turkey pesto tea sandwich. Umm..Yum?!
-Strawberries and cream tea sandwich. Reminds me of a strawberry Philadelphia cream cheese sandwich...only..fancier and yummier ;)

Parking isn't a pain and prices were reasonable. This place is a complete hit! Love, love, love.
author: Jasmin W.

description: This place was charming! I came here with a friend on a Saturday afternoon with a reservation in place. It wasn't too busy, but it definitely picked up after we arrived. We had the standard Covent Garden tea for two. We picked 4 sandwiches, which were all stellar, and 2 teas, which were pleasantly flavorful. The scones were delightful as well. I wish there was a larger option for pastry flavors, I'm not a fan of coconut and didn't have the choice for another flavor. Service was great, I appreciated the staff periodically checking in and seeing if we needed anything. I also appreciated that the staff knew all about the teas, which flavor profiles were best matched for your preferences, and weren't at all pushy with their suggestions! It's an east 15 minutes walk from BART, which is also a plus!
author: Karen J.

description:
Came here a bit past noon on a Thursday and no was there we waited for a bit and finally someone came out. 

We got to pick our seats. It was cute how none of the seating was the same, some had chairs and 2 people couches or a table for two with individual couches and different combos.

We got the serendipi-tea for 2, which came with 12 sandwiches with the choice of three types of sandwich, 2 pots of tea, with a salad and pairs of mini eclairs, petit fours, mini cookies, scones w/ strawberry and key-lime spread and a little container of whipped cream.

The scones were fluffy and moist but I didn't really like the bits of pine nuts? inside. Everything else was okay. I really love the eclairs! I think I would rather just have a whole plate of those instead. 

I loved all the sandwiches we got, which were the strawberries and creme, turkey and pesto and the smoked ham with horseradish. 

As for the tea, the Earl goes to Hollywood was pretty good but the other one we got I didn't really like, which was some sort of minty chocolate tea.

The service was okay a bit slow but I think there was only one person serving and seating people. 

The environment was definitely quieter than crown n crumpet and definitely more space between the tables, which I liked. It wasn't as cute and colorful as I thought it would be but it definitely had its charm.
author: Katie M.

description:
Just to specify that I have edited my review to respond more aptly to the owner's comment.

I'd also like to add some clearly spelled out constructive criticism- 

Regarding the service: There are many steps to improvement Dartealing can take, but here are a few specifics: generally a hostess should be present in the front of the restaurant so customers know where to go. Secondly, the largest error: please revise your Yelp discount's fine print so large parties are not confused on how many they can use. Lastly and most importantly, I hope the staff and management are clear that customers generally expect to receive their full orders; hence we were very disappointed in getting less tea pots than we'd ordered.  

In ALL my years of dining around San Francisco- and throughout all of California- I've never ordered something and received less food/drink than the menu specified. I sincerely hope this problem is remedied, whether by stocking up on restaurant ware or giving customers notice of this lack before they order.

Regarding food: The smoked salmon sandwich was a rather tasteless, I'd recommend more smoked salmon or capers in it. The ham sandwich was savory but also lacked spices and herbs. The lemon curd was far too sweet and the recipe needs to be tweaked.
author: Jackie T.

description: Was there 2 weeks ago for a friend's birthday and was looking forward to the "tea experience" but walked out with a very bad experience. I don't think we'll ever go back there again. Management and staff made the experience bad. One star for the lychee tea and cute decoration inside.
author: Yien S.

description: Adorable, excellent service. We got the works. Loved it all.
author: Denise M.

description:
Like Jackie T, I also feel compelled to respond to the owner's comments, hence this updated review:

While I'm glad that you're going to review decrusting technique with your employees, you seem to have missed the really rather enormous purple elephant in the middle of your tea room - namely that the *actual service* was terrible.

I'm honestly very flexible with what my idea of afternoon tea "should be" - I've been places that are very formal and others that are more of the "grandmother's parlor" feeling and most things in-between and enjoyed nearly every variation - the one thing that I'm pretty darn set on is that service trumps everything.   

Tea is about the experience; if you just want good food, there's hundreds of excellent restaurants in San Francisco.   If, when we'd left, my grandmother had been smiling and had felt like a Queen (or at least a Lady of Quality!) this would have been a four-star review and the rest of the issues would have been footnotes.   (For the record, my observations on your restroom would have been the same had this been a five star review.  Decor in a shared bathroom is hardly your deal, and doesn't count against you, but I almost always note accessibility issues in my reviews, such as having to maneuver through a crowded tea-room to get there.) 

I work in the food service industry.  I've worked in it for almost two decades, at a variety of restaurants ranging from nice sit-down affairs to fast-casual joints.  I know how hard it is to smile and put on your game-face for every table -- but that's the job.  If you can't do it, you shouldn't be working in a restaurant.  Bottom line is that your employees were craptacular at that particular and very important aspect of their job while we were there.  Maybe it was just a bad day, but from several recent reviews I'm seeing here I doubt it.   

I certainly would be willing to visit DarTealing again - the actual tea was incredibly delicious and I'd love to try it again - but I wouldn't do so for any sort of special occasion until I'd reassured myself that your staff had improved dramatically.
author: Jess C.

description:
My husband and I spent a lovely Sunday afternoon here.  I have been wanting to try this place out after finding it on Yelp and happy that my husband finally agreed to go with me.  Next time I go here, I'm definitely bringing the girls!  

Luckily we found parking right in front of the tea lounge and since it was a Sunday didn't have to worry about the meter. 

We were greeted by one of their workers and immediately seated in one of their cute tables for 2.  The place wasn't very packed but since it was nice Sunny day most of the folks must have been out enjoying the nice sunny day at the beach.
