The place is nicely decorated.  They have the cutest tea cups and various types of candies in the store.  My husband didn't feel too out of place since their were a couple of men there with their girlfriends. 

I had the caffeine free black tea recommended by the owner which was awesome!  I ordered the tea for one which included 8 sandwiches with a choice of 2 flavors - I chose the fish & chips and chicken and they were delish.  The salad was OK.   My husband had the chicken salad which was so good!   

Next time, I'm in the area I will bring my friends here for some tea.
author: Christine P.

description:
Pretty cute place and not overwhelmingly pink & frilly...thank goodness.  service was good.  i was a bit worried from the reviews but making the reservations and service on site wasnt bad at all.  maybe its hit and miss.  two servings of the trifecta tea tapas and personal pots for 3 came to about $65.  the trifecta was great for sharing and sampling.  not bad at all since we left happy and very full. 

We had the Bottomless pot of tea $9 vs the personal $5
Caramel Carousel --- caramelicious
Melange of toffee and caramel will keep you pouring

Mint Lavender --- verrry minty
Dartealing's tisane...the longer it steeps, the better its aroma.

Casablanca after midnight --- this was pretty good...not too minty at all
DarTealing's blend ...creamy and refreshing mocha mint rooibos.

Since we opted for our own teas we decided to do the Trifecta Tea Tapas (Small Plates) $16.  We select one from each section from the savories and sweets.

SAVORIES
Sausage Roll --- it came with 2pcs and was pretty good
Pasty Pie (daily flavor) --- got the chicken pot pie 1pc...sooo good

Brie & Chutney Plate --- mmm cant go wrong with brie and chutney 4pcs
Smoked fish mousse --- it was aaaright...

Croque Madame --- pretty good 4pcs
Chicken Pesto Brie Tartine --- yummy 4pcs

SWEETS
Petit Tea Bread Loaf --- this was alright 2pcs
Coconut Macaroons (3 pcs.) --- macaroons were good
Tea Sweets (1 Petit four, 1 tea cake, 2 biscotti cookies) --- this was alright

Bread pudding & rum caramel --- wanted to try it but they ran out so we got the tea bread loaf as a sub
Flight of chocolate truffles of the Far East --- really yummy truffles 3pcs

Silk Road plate (assortment of Asian sweets) --- basically two small sesame balls and an almond cookie.  the sesame balls werent filled and really chewy but the almond cookie was good

Pair of scones & sweet cream --- it was a cookies and cream scone and we opted for all three...with sweet cream, preserves, and zesty lemon curd
author: she q.

description: Sooooo cute in here!! My iPhone gave me the weirdest directions to get here but once you get inside, it's adorable! Love the music choices. We even got to smell the teas before ordering and they all smell fantastic, which makes it even harder to order. It's a lovely place to spend some lady time with friends or family. The place is just so sweet and feminine, which I love!! Def will be back. Thank you for a lovely experience!
author: Brigi T.

description: Adorable and tasty. I was suprised to find myself enjoying a quaint old fashioned tea room, but it was a treat :)
author: B D.

description: I was here on 4/25/15 for a bridal tea party.  This small, intimate spot is just adorable. Although it doesn't look like much from the outside, it's really cute in the inside. The staff was very friendly and attentive.  We tried three different types of tea - black tea with peach, a caramel tea and some fruit blend that was really tart.  I would recommend the first two.  We also had an assortment of sandwiches, macaroons and scones.  The sandwiches were just ok, some tasted overdressed with mayo and a bit spicy but I enjoyed the scones.
author: Yien S.

description:
I had never heard of DarTealing before till I got a Scoutmob notice in my email.  One Saturday morning while my husband & I were running errands, we were debating what to do for lunch and thought of DarTealing.  I called trying to find out if we could squeeze a fast table for two.  We were informed that there was a bridal shower scheduled and that if we didn't mind the noise level being a bit louder than normal that they could seat us in 30 minutes.  We were there in 15.  Great service, extensive array of tea selections and plenty of parking nearby.  

AFTERNOON SERENDIPI-TEA FOR TWO

-Twelve tea sandwiches made to order in three flavors of choice: 
-Organic green salad with  house-made vinaigrette for two  
-Two warm home-baked scones with all accompaniments  Assortment of tea cakes/sweets, petits fours, & tea biscuits  

$43 + tax and tip

I had hoped that they would brought out all the items at one time (possibly in a three tiered serving tray) rather than in courses.  Otherwise I'd have given 5 stars.
author: Stacey L.

description: this place really is darling. Old fashion decor is delicate and inviting. The tea service itself is expensive, but tasty. Having lots of different teas to choose from is always fun. Service was friendly, albiet slow. A mellow/quiet place to catch up with a friend or for small group outings.
author: Tuwie N.

description:
I love afternoon tea :) DarTealing Lounge is on the edge of the Financial District area and is kind of tucked away -- the outside is quite simple without much fanfare. However, once you step inside, it is quite cute! There are several seating areas, some with couches, others with benches, etc. There are lots of cute decorations all around the restaurant as well.

I came here last weekend for my bridal shower. Once we all arrived, the tea & food was quickly served to us. For 8-9 people, they served 4 teas, a huge assortment of delicious tea sandwiches (both savory & sweet), and desserts (macrons, scones, petit fours, and cupcakes). Then, there is also champagne! 

All in all, I enjoyed my experience here very much! I loved the teas, especially the Lavender Mint. The sandwiches and desserts are all super tasty, as well. Best of all, it's just a very relaxing atmosphere and you don't feel rushed. It's a wonderful place to hang out with your friends and chat.
author: Tiffie L.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! their sandwiches are awesome, and you guys should try the crumpets!
author: Diamond H.

description:
Most pretentious, overpriced place that's not worth trying. Service was horrible, and what I mean by that is rude and condescending. Not only were the servers' attitudes unwelcoming, they apparently don't have enough teapots? If you have more than 4 people in a group, your packages that you reserve beforehand pretty much don't matter. You'll get less teapots than you paid for apparently because they don't have enough....except...isn't this an afternoon tea lounge? Oh, and don't even try using any discounts found on yelp or anything because they "don't work." 

Let's get to the food: the tea sandwiches taste like something your mom could make (cucumber sandwiches, pb&j, ham) except the crusts were cut off. The desserts were horribly sweet. In conclusion, nothing special.

Overall, it was a stressful, laughable experience. Never coming back here. We were just looking for an enjoyable afternoon tea with friends who came to the city to visit. It was embarrassing for us to have brought them here. I'd rather go to starbucks than here. 

P.S. Just read the owner's replies (Pauline) to for example Ms. Jackie T's post. Already rude. LOL!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I've actually been here twice although the first time I went I had a pleasant experience, the servers are polite and helpful and the place itself is gorgeous not to mention the tea is excellent specially breakfast carousel (I think it was called). That first time I only had tea and shared dessert. 
However  the second time I went, on my birthday no less, we ordered the tea service for two which included sausage rolls priced at 48 dollars. The food quality was nice but the price to food ratio is ludicrous. the sausage rolls were only two and the size of my thumb. priced for two and it wasnt even the portion for one very dainty lady. I was so embarassed  that I payed for all of it myself I couldn't dare to ask for splitting the bill with my company since the price  was so unfair. totally not worth it. what? do they fly to england everyday themselves and get it from the Queen herself and fly back on a rented winged unicorn?? only that way the price would make sense.
author: Alex D.

description:
This place is adorable. 

I came here with a friend after purchasing a bloomspot deal of $25 for an afternoon tea for two, which is normally $43.  The place is very cute, complete with antique-looking furniture, pastel colors, throw pillows, and cute decorations on the walls.  This was what I expected a tea room to look like. 

So, our afternoon tea comes with two bottomless pots of tea, three different tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours, salad and mini cream puffs.

We chose the caramel carousel and mango teas, and they were yummy.  The sandwiches were delicious! We got smoked salmon, cucumber and cream cheese, and ham and horseradish cheddar.  All very good!  The salad was also very light and refreshing. Then we got the dessert plate. Petit fours, mini cream puffs...both good! But the best part....the SCONES!  These were piping hot and straight out of the oven!  Add some clotted cream, lemon curd, and/or strawberry preserves, and it is absolute heaven!

I am definitely coming back here!
author: Tanya P.

description: What a GREAT discovery! Discovered Datealing by chance today and will definitively be back. The food was exquisite, the tea was delicious, and the wait staff was very friendly and informative.
author: Annie H.

description:
My friends and I went for afternoon tea recently, and while the food and tea are lovely, the service is really lacking. 
We waited for 5 minutes at the front of the store before anyone even talked to us. Then it took another 15 minutes to seat us because there wasn't a table available even though we had booked a reservation. Our food took close to 45 minutes to arrive, so we sat around drinking our tea, which had gotten cold by then. A large party who arrived after us got their food a good 15 minutes before us. 
Once we started eating, everything was just fine. I wish they provided jam and lemon curd to go along with their scones, but their tea selection is really fun and unique, as is their sandwich selection. You also get a really substantial amount of food, so we were stuffed by the end of our meal. 
Overall, if their service was improved they would be comparable to Lovejoys. Afternoon tea should be relaxing and fun, and it was a bummer to have to wait so long. They also need to get their waitstaff to wear uniforms and present themselves a little nicer. Again, we're paying a good amount for Afternoon Tea, which is a pretty classy affair, they should look as nice, if not nicer than their customers do. I think I'll make the trek out to Lovejoys next time.
author: T F.

description:
I love this place...it is a really nice tea lounge.  The decor is sweet and stays traditional without being too old/stuffy.  

The tea selection is expansive and it's fun to try something different each time I visit.  The food -- sweet and savory -- is delcious!  
My faves:
-- fish & chips sandwich
-- chicken curry sandwich
-- cucumber sandwich (not a real tea house without these sandies)
-- white chocolate & lavender scones with cream  

The service is great and one of the owners, Pauline, is very friendly and sweet.  
This is a wonderful place to visit solo with a book, to share a pot of tea with a friend or to enjoy in a big group. If you haven't been yet, check it out soon.
author: T M.

description:
It was my first high tea experience in San Francisco -- and for the novelty of it, I would've given Dartealing something higher than a three.  BUT -- if i truly assessed the business for its service, food, and decor -- a three is about fair. 

The venue is good girly fun.  Perfect for some time with the besties right before a spa day.  Whimsical colors, mismatched tea ware, tiny arm chairs, and upholstery galore.  Cute? -- definitely, yes.  Classy? --not really. It's more like adults taking a day off from the real world to play make-believe...in the SOMA ghetto.

I did the afternoon tea service with my friend ($43) which includes 2 pots of tea, a dozen mini sandwich triangles (3 flavors of your choice) with a side of salad, and a plate of tea cakes/sweets.  Nothing is to-die-for, but the amount of variety makes it fun to nibble on as you sip tea and gossip.  Sandwiches are actually decent (especially the curry chicken and brie & chutney).  Teas were good -- but I'm no expert.  I think we did right by ordering one green and on black.

Service was good.  Young waitresses that were very sweet and just knowledgeable enough about tea to make some recommendations.

I have no regrets doing the bloomspot deal and would be back if i could pay that price again, but at $50+ with tax normally -- if I come back, it'd be only on special girly occasions.
author: Kendra W.

description:
Love Love Love this place!!!  The mismatched but coordinating cups, the different sized and shaped teapots, little sandwiches, petit fours, chocolate coconut scones, what's not to love?

It's a girly girl's heaven.
author: Vicky L.

description:
Loved it!
My daughter and I like to go to tea and connect.  
Our lives are so busy and we find "tea" is the way to slow down and talk.

Interior:
Clean and pretty.  Not too filled with kitchy stuff.
Bright!

Service/server:
Very friendly, calm and helpful.  We ordered afternoon tea for two. Our server answered all our questions and was very nice.  We went on a Friday afternoon, so it was not crowded, but there were a few other customers there.

Food:
Very good.  Everything was freshly made, which means we did have to wait a bit.
That is fine with me!
We were pleased with our food selections and tea selections.
We asked our server to bring one pot of tea at a time, which she gladly did.

We rode into San Francisco on BART, getting off at the Powell Station.
We then walked to 5th street so we could catch MUNI 30 or 45.
We caught the 30 which dropped us withing 1.5 blocks of Dartealing.

We will definitely return.
author: Carol H.

description: I felt it was a little pricy for the location in that area, but the inside is very nice and cozy. I love the sandwich, but scone is not as what I expected to be.
author: Minfei L.

description:
Gluten free sandwiches get this place 5 stars.

The decor is cute, the food outstanding, and the tea delish.  

My friend had her birthday party here and it was perfect.  There were 10 of us, we had jasmine tea, caramel carousel, and English breakfast.  I had about 5 cups of the caramel, so good!  Sandwiches were salmon dill, bacon and egg, green apple and brie, and ham and cheese.  They sound so mundane, but they were oh so very good.  In addition, there was a green salad and a quinoa salad.  The gluten eaters also had sandwiches. :)

For dessert, there were gluten free lavender scones with clotted cream and gluten free macarons.  There were also fancy petit fours for the people who could eat gluten.

We were there for about 2.5 hours, they never rushed us, in fact, as we sat there idly chit chatting before leaving, they actually offered us another pot of tea.  

I will definitely be back!!
author: Ann-Marie H.

description:
Cute ambience, good food

I like what they did to the tearoom; it's not the most convenient location, but the tea room is cute. 
Tea-wise, maybe we didn't pick well, but my tea was decent, not amazing. 
Tea service: i really like the finger sandwiches, but the biscuits and other baked good were not as tasty. 
We had the croque mushrooms, which i really like; it's a little rich, but i shared it and it was delicious
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE (4 Star):  I've been here at least 3 times now and it never lets me down.  I love this place!  It is a cute and darling little gem!  The server was very friendly, attentive, accommodating and so helpful especially since we didn't know much teas.  Their guidance as to preference made the experience much more relaxing and fun.


AMBIANCE (3-4 Star): The ambiance is great!  It's a lounge that has cute vintage teapots and collectible teacups with bright pastel colors.  It's a perfect place to have a any kind of get together and/or little celebration like a baby or a  bridal shower.

FOOD (4 Star):  Their menu is simple and the quality of food is great.  They also have a great selection of black, white, greens and roobois teas that go perfectly well with any food item on the menu.   One of the popular items are the fish and chips which I dared to try.  I was a little skeptical at first, but what a pleasant surprise.  Such a treat!  And my fave was the little home baked scones with Devon cream and Passion Fruit tea (forgot the name)!

EXECUTION (4 Star):  Our food came out in a timely manner. 

PARKING:  Bring quarters.  There's ample parking on the street and a little parking lot around the corner from the Lounge.  It also doesn't matter the time of day since it's not in a commercialized in an area.

TIP:  If you are hosting a baby shower, you're able to bring your own desserts for your party like cupcakes, etc.


Hope this helps!  Enjoy!!!
author: Nbrey A.

description: I made the reservation few days ago but when we got there on time still needs to wait over 15 min to be seated. They seem like really busy and don't have enough people to work there. Waited for a long time for our food and it's really hot in the restaurant. I saw some fans there but No AC. The only good thing is their scones are not bad and the sandwiches are delicious. Otherwise everything's just ok. We will try different place next time.
author: Vickie M.

description:
This is an absolutely adorable tea lounge with great food, but not good for special occasions or big groups. 

I had a baby shower here that ended up to be very short, which I was not happy about. We had 11 am reservations and got kicked out (literally) at 1 pm. I wasn't informed of 2 hour limit when I was making a reservation. It's needless to say that 2 hours is very insufficient for a baby shower. My gift opening was rudely abrupted, the day was spoiled. We had to take group pictures and say goodbyes on the street. 

I would recommend this place for an afternoon tea with your girlfriend, but don't spend your special occasion there as it will be ruined.
author: Polina Y.

description: I eat afternoon tea here every 1-2 weeks.  It has cute floral decor and a big selection of tea.  Bacon-and-eggs sandwich is great, as is honey lavender cream sandwich!
author: Niniane W.

description:
Exquisite teas.  Excellent service.  Good food.  Wonderful setting. 

Minus one star for being way too damn loud.  Please please please hang some fabric from the ceiling (or SOMETHING) so we don't have to have our eardrums blasted -- too many women come here in large groups to be overcaffeinated and excited!

But worth doing.  And I will do so again.  Yes please!
author: Plot T.

description: Today was my 5th visit to DarTealing!  I love this place!  Our service was beyond outstanding!  I was with a group of 12 and trust me these guys will let you have it if anything is less than perfect.  Everyone loved the experience, even the non tea drinkers.  We ordered tea to go!!  I love this place!  Keep up the good work, I scored major points for such a great outing!!!   See you soon!!!
author: June F.

description:
If I could, I'd give this place a negative star.  It's strange, because I generally agree with yelp ratings, so I'm surprised that DarTealing has this high of a rating.

I went armed with Bloomspot offer.  In the fine print of the offer, it said "Valid Sunday-Friday", and I had tried to use it on a Saturday.  Of course, I presented the offer as soon as I sat down, but they didn't tell me it wasn't valid for that day until the very end...  

While this was very annoying, I was disappointed with everything all throughout.  They say "6 tea sandwiches" when they actually mean ONE tiny, dry, sandwich, cut up into 6 pieces.  That's just wrong.
And this being a tea house, you'd think they'd have good tea, but the tea my husband got (I forgot the one) had a very fake, chemically vanilla taste.  It was vile.  I had a green tea that was a very light, green color, and tasted like hot water + some boiled spinach.  But at least it didn't taste like cancer-y chemicals, so that was a plus.

This place is basically a huge rip-off in every way.  The portions are shockingly tiny, the food is dry (not enough dressing in the salad, the scones are dry, the cookies are dry, etc...).   I have a hard time understanding why this place is still in business.

Oh yeah, the waitresses are all basically rude 19 year old girls.  They were anticipating a large birthday party, and ignored us the entire time, while they moved chairs around.  At one point, I (very politely) asked for some custard to spread on my (dry) scone, and the waitress rolled her eyes.  

Tea for two + a very light, unsatisfying, snack = $50
Voucher or not, I don't recommend it.
author: Pooja D.

description:
heeehee dragged the boyfriend here for some girly fun (he wasn't as amused) on a rainy day. 

The only other people in there at the time was a group of women holding a baby shower, which kinda gives you a sense of what kind of clientele goes here... lol (to spell it out: females) 

We got the Taste-tea service for 2 for $40 and chose the honey lavender and smoked salmon sandwiches. Absolutely adored the scones and the lemon curd and whipped creamy butter thing that they provide for the scone action. The scones were nice and toasty and delicious. The sandwiches were good too! Don't underestimate the small platter -- we were definitely full by the end, especially bc of endless tea refills. 

Lots of the extra things were kind of hit or miss for me (macarons were dry, tea bread was dry and flavorless ... you get the point), so I think if I were to come again I would just order individually and cut out the random add-ons from the tea service. 

Cute atmosphere -- will probably be back soon with some girlfriends this time :3
author: Debra L.

description:
Continuing my exploration to find the perfect tea room in the Bay Area I ended up at the DarTealing Lounge. When you get in front of the building that nests DarTealing you will think something is wrong since you are almost under the freeway and the building doesn't look like a "cute tea place" you would go with your girlfriends. But once you get inside you will love it. The place is really beautiful and stylish, filled with little girly decor and pretty details, it looks like a place from a British movie or something, everything you expect from a tea room. 

Service was good but not great since sometimes they take a while to cake care of you. Sandwiches were ok but they could improve flavor combinations. The tea selection is good and the pots are bottomless, which is great. Scones and sweets were also good, so if you like tea services, this place is worth a visit.
author: Gisele M.

description:
Daughter and I dragged my husband here for lunch.  Made reservations for 12:30, but found that the place was pretty empty at that time on a weekday.

We decided on Children's "Tea" for my daughter-- this included a small pot of strawberry milk, a sandwich (she chose bacon and egg), tea cakes, and cookies.

My husband and I split the Tea for Two.  Our three sandwich choices were: Smoked Ham and Cheddar, Brie and Chutney, and Cucumber.  They were all delicious but I am in love with the Cucumber. I may have to try to recreate it at home!  It also came with a small Salad, and Scones, Tea Cakes and Cookies.

The Scones were so good!  Slight almond flavor reminded me of Chinese Almond Cookies--and spread with cream, and strawberry preserves made them perfect!

Cute atmosphere with mismatched tea cups, utensils served in mason jars...I also thought the service was great.  and our food was perfectly timed.  A bit pricey at 60+ dollars for the 3 of us, but it's the experience that makes it worthwhile.  Also seeing my daughter's face light up when they brought her a tiny teapot and teacup, "is this for me???" she said.

And even though my husband made his little comments like, "I can honestly say this is a first," and "I may have to eat again after this..."  he ended up enjoying it, and found that it was more than enough food.  Will definitely be back here.
author: Joanne N.

description:
Came here over the weekend for a friend's birthday, a group of 18. Walked in, and was like, "Goodness, how cute! Maybe I could have a bridal shower or birthday here!" 

I had checked the menu online before coming and thought the tea for two for $43 would be our choice. But upon seating, we realize that everything had to be ordered ahead of time - ok, that's reasonable. So everything was already ordered. The teas were nice, but then the food started coming out. Very awkwardly. The sandwiches came out at different times, making for very awkward passing of tiered plates around the table. And because the sandwiches came out at different times around the table, I didn't get to try most of them, and at times I had to split (an already tiny) sandwich with my partner.  Also, I didn't like that they didn't offer to change our plates, so I felt messy with jam on my plate, and cupcake paper mixed in with it, along with salad dressing remnants. 

I also hated how they took the cupcakes and petite fours away to "pack up" even though we had just got another round of tea. So halfway through my next cup, I felt like a petit four, but opps, it was no longer there. 

TIP: Don't  pack up the left overs until we're ready to leave! Jeez!

At the end, I had about 5 tiny sandwiches (pretty much the equivalent of 1 whole sandwich) , a tiny cupcake, half a petit four, a scone, and about 5 cups of tea. My partner the same. The bill? $40 a person!! You got to be kidding me. What a complete RIP OFF. I would never subject my friends to shell out $40 for crumbs. 

So final verdict: BAD for large groups. Maybe the experience is better with just a pal or two.
author: Jessica W.

description: I have been here once for a party of 5. Everything tastes good, but the service was not that great. Food was like a 4, but service was like a 2. They were not even busy when we were there, but didn't bother checking on us. I'd return for the food, but don't look forward for the crappy service.
author: Kosmo Z.

description:
We had an appointment and we got there, we didn't see a hostess for 10-15min after our appt. time, so I had to look for her and let her know we were there.

After we got seated, the waitresses again took 15-20 min to check in with us. Again, I had to ask a waitress to attend to us. I got the attention of one waitress and she nodded at me, sat down and started eating her meal, without even getting the other waitress to attend to us. I felt that was very rude. There wasn't even a lot of customers- the restaurant was less that half full.

The quality of the tea, the decor, the service, and the price doesn't even come close to Crown & Crumpet. The tea and food were just okay, but the scones were yummy. However, it was not worth the price ($80 for 5 people) nor the 18% mandatory gratuity. 

If you are looking for a wonderful tea place, it's best to go to Crown & Crumpet and not DarTeaLing.
author: Jean P.

description:
We bought 2 bloomspot deals for an afternoon tea service for 2 (so 4 people total). They allow you to use 2 vouchers per party which was the only reason I decided to buy them. The place itself is small and charming. The waitstaff was courteous and decent. We didn't experience any bad service like previous yelpers reviewed about.

We all ordered our own pots of tea. My favorite was the "In Dew Time". It was a white tea with honeydew, I believe. The sandwiches were absolutely delicious. We ordered the salmon, tofu, bacon & eggs, turkey & pesto, strawberries & cream, and pb&j & chocolate. Everything else was mediocre: salad, scones, petite fours, pot de creme. The salad came on one plate and definitely looked like it was portioned for 2 and not 4 which we double checked with the waitress. But she did say it was for 4.

All in all, I wouldn't come back without another deal because paying full price for everything would not have been worth it.
author: Lily Z.

description:
This is a great place to have afternoon tea and gab with your friends.  It is less congested than Lovejoy's; I immediately felt more comfortable and at ease.  I shared a "tea for two" which included: choice of three types of finger sandwich, two choices of tea, scones and petits fours. The pot of "Creme de Coconut" tea was very good--I don't even like coconut! The cucumber, turkey, and smoked fish sandwiches, pumpkin scones with Devon cream, lemon curd, and jam was also excellent. Parking was easy to find on a lazy Sunday afternoon, and the decor was wonderful. 

If you have a large group tea event I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Courtney S.

description:
It pains me not to give this place a solid four stars because it truly is adorable. Once you move past the randomness (and borderline sketchiness) of the location, the tea lounge itself is darling. My friend and I were on the hunt for a spot to host another friend's shower. We'd visited all of the popular tea spots in the city and were moments away from making a final decision. This place was a favorite. The set up is nice and it's just the right balance of shabby chic. They also have a private room available for parties (although the private room is a bit odd in that it seems to be connected to the next door spa/nail salon and has a visible massage or waxing room right next to it). Nevertheless, it seemed perfect for our purposes. We spent $70 ordering a spread of tea so we could check it out for ourselves. Everything was tasty and well presented but this is where the fun ended. 

For starters, there only appeared to be one server in the entire place. While we had no real complaints about our service, I wondered how it would be once the place became more crowded. Would we be able to have our own server if we rented the private room? The server took us through the private room, we decided it would be perfect and the server told us the owner (who is apparently also the lone party planner) would be in momentarily and could answer any other questions we had about it. "Great," we told her, "please send her over when she arrives and it's convenient--this is definitely where we want to have our friend's shower." After repeated requests throughout our tea, however, we were told that the owner was indeed there, but refused to meet with us and would only correspond about it online (Wednesday through Friday, as it says on their website). "But we'd like to put a deposit down right now and lock in the date while we can, would she just be able to stop by our table for a minute to confirm?" We were repeatedly told no by our server--even after the woman who appeared to be the owner arrived and glanced at us several times while fielding phone calls from mere feet away. 

I understand being busy, but the place was by no means packed at that point and we were there inquiring about booking their private from for up to 25 people and paying whatever it took to do so (for several hours). It was a bizarre approach to customer service and one we decided not to endorse and in turn, wouldn't be giving our business to. If it's this difficult to merely inquire about booking, how tough will it be to actually plan a special party at this place? For the record, the people at both Crown and Crumpet and Lovejoy's were immediately responsive, during far busier tea services. Both places took the time to enthusiastically send someone over to answer questions and provide helpful information, making the prospect of a throwing a shower with them far more appealing. Interestingly enough, the friend I was with is in the advertising business and responsible for massive amounts of party planning (and referrals) in the bay area, so there's no telling how much business was actually lost with this experience...
author: J G.

description: An adorable tea place in the middle of an industrial area in SOMA.  You would never guess that this was here.  Service is wonderful and you immediately feel so relaxed.  The teas are so fragrant, and they patiently help you to find the one you want.  This is a treat that everyone should have several times a year.
author: Arlene C.

description:
I discovered my love for tea in college and it was in college when I first started going to tea rooms.  I was visiting a friend in the city when we decided to go for tea, since we haven't gone in some time.  We wanted something a little more traditional and DarTealing fit the description.  We arrived a tad early and they hadn't opened yet, but it was so close to Yerba Buena and Union Square that we ended up walking around first.

When we came back, we didn't have a reservation, but luckily, they seated us promptly.

Atmosphere:
This tea room is very fun and whimsical.  I felt like I was in Alice in Wonderland.  The furniture was mismatched, I was in this wooden chair and my friend was in this cute armchair.  The settings were also mismatched which I loved, because it didn't seem strange at all that nothing was the same.  It was also a great conversation starter.

Menu:
We ended up choosing the indulgence tea service menu which was $55, decently priced.  Now let me get into the actual food.
-Sandwiches
  Turkey & pumpkin butter creme 
        This seasonal delight reminded me of Thanksgiving, both the turkey and pumpkin.  Very tasty.
  Honeyed ham and Gruyere
        I love Gruyere so I had to get this.  The honeyed ham was a perfect balance to the cheese.  I liked the 
        sweetness with the naturally creaminess and saltiness of the cheese.
  English Stilton cheese and fig
        I think this was by far my favorite.  I have never had Stilton cheese before, as far as I know.  But the 
        sharp taste with the lightness and sweetness of the figs were amazing.  I want to make this for lunch 
        every day.  I honestly could not stop eating these.  I made sure to eat the other sandwiches first so I could 
        save my last bite for this one.
-Freshly-baked English sausage rolls
        These little rolls were a great start.  They were very savory surprisingly with less sausage and more rolls.
-Tea scones with Devon cream
        I love tea scones and Devon cream.  There are never complaints here.
-Holiday petits fours and Christmas shortbread cookies
        I wasn't a huge fan of these compared to everything else I had eaten, but they were still a delight.

Tea:
-Earl de Versailles
        My friend actually ordered this and I tried it.  It was very fragrant and I normally don't add a lot of milk or 
        sugar to my tea so that I can taste it.  This tea doesn't need much sugar and I think no milk.  The 
        French lavender seems to tone out Earl Grey a bit, which is nice.
-Her Majesty's Secret Service
        Honestly, I got this tea because I loved the name.  It is a Ceylon Orange Pekoe with bourbon vanilla.  
        This tea smells wonderful from the bourbon vanilla and is very light in taste.  I added milk sugar, but 
        it is honestly not necessary.  But tea smelled so sweet that I felt compelled to add sugar so that it 
        tasted just as sweet as it smelled.

I love this place and am already planning to return.  I highly recommend DarTealings for almost all occasions, but I would recommend making a reservation for groups larger than 2.
author: Liliana P.

description:
Cute tea lounge.  I've had the taste tea service as well as the regular tea service.  I think overall if you're looking for a fusion of high tea with modern twist then this is your place.  

The flavors of tea sandwiches are a little more modern (such as the fish and chip sandwich or bacon and egg) but they are delicious and their classics are amazingly good.  

The lemon curd is tart and sweet.  I don't normally like lemon flavored things but I really enjoyed that.  The strawberry jam wasn't a wow factor, but that's alright.

The sausage roll isn't a traditional brit roll but it was pretty good.  

I think the one thing that I really missed from a regular high tea/cream tea is the clotted cream.  The lounge gives you a whipped cream substitute, which doesn't do the scone justice, hence the 4 star instead of 5.  I would definitely come back though.
author: Ji-Ea Y.

description:
I really wanted to enjoy my return visit but it was not meant to be.   The owner was great about confirming reservations and we were seated right away, but the food (tea sandwiches and salad) took a surprisingly long time to arrive.  And when it did, most of the sandwiches tasted just meh... 

Besides the food, the service was horrible.  The only wait staff for the tea-room (which was filled with 1 other table besides ours) spent most of her time on her iphone/ipod.  Try flagging down someone for a glass of water, a refill, a question, the check? Good luck.

Beware that the tea service can be pricey too.  We added an additional service to the tea for two.  At Lovejoy's, it's 4 sandwich options for 2; at DarTealing's, it's 4 sandwiches for 3 and 3 sandwiches for 2.  Most of us left hungry.
author: M G.

description:
Hands down my favorite high tea place around.  

The price is decent, the tea selection abundant, the sandwiches substantial and tasty (think actual sandwiches and not just one-bite-and-they're-gone deal), and the other food options are unabashedly authentic English (meat pie, sausage rolls and crumpets).  

Plus, if you have to drive, parking's plentiful and easy ($0.25 per hour on Saturday FTW).
author: Ange L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and I pass this tea lounge all the time so I was very happy when I saw a groupon for tea service for two. 

My friend and I enjoyed every minute we were here. The food was delicious, the place is very cozy and cute. It was perfect for a slow and leisurely Friday afternoon. 

The tea selection is great. My only wish is that there was a way to take out the tea leaves from the pot after it finished brewing. The way we had it, the tea kept getting stronger as we were slowly sipping through the pot of tea.
author: Cassie C.

description:
Absolute heaven!!  My mom and I went here on a girls day out, and couldn't have been more pleased.

I made reservations in advance (they didn't get busy enough on a Saturday for it to be a NEED, but I highly suggest it), and was told on the phone that while they had space for us there would be a large party coming in at the same time, and would we like to wait until 11:15am when they are settled, or did we want to be sat as far from them as possible and still have the 11am spot?  How wonderful to be asked!!  We opted for the table as far from the group as possible (it really didn't help, it is a little place).  

Got there at about 10:40am and were warming welcomed in early by the staff.  It was absolutely adorable inside, similar to Lovejoy's with the mismatched china, but decor similar to Crown and Crumpet, though not nearly so pink.  Comfy chairs, plenty of space for each table to have a bit of elbow room, and two tiny kitchens, one that the food comes out of, the other tea.

The menu is quite expansive.  We spent a good 20 minutes trying to figure out what tea to have, in the end asking the staff for their recommendations.  They brought out the jars of tea for us to smell and make up our own mind.  We had the Parisian Earl Grey (which was a good earl grey with more vanilla) and Her Majesty's Secret Service (which was divine with the desserts).

The food was excellent, with the fresh baked, still warm white chocolate lavender scones being our favorite (not to heavy on the lavender, just a good balance to the sweet white chocolate).  My mother ordered the Afternoon Tea Service and I the Taste-tea Service, so that we could try the most things on our first visit.  Sandwiches that were chosen were the Darjeeling Curried Chicken (I thought it could have used a bit more of the chutney, bit overpowering on the curry), Smoked Salmon and Capers (Yum!!  No changes needed and will be ordering that again) and the Brie and Kicky Chutney (Also very good).  The sausage roll was wonderful, with a very flavorful meat in the center of a light, flaky roll.  The plates also came with the most wonderful red velvet shortbread cookies.  Do try the lemon curd as it is home made and very tasty.

The staff!  I have not had such service in a long time.  Not pesky, sneaking by to make sure we had hot water in our tea pots every now and again, were kind enough to bring us one tea pot at a time, were phenomenal at answering all of our questions, and (unlike a few other tea rooms in San Francisco) let us lounge there all day.  I do mean all day.  We ended up leaving at about 4:30pm!
author: Jennifer W.

description: I've been to several tea salons around the city however I didn't care for the one too much, the decor is a little to stuffy foe my taste and the deserts aren't very impressive
author: Aki M.

description: OMG I LOVE this place! My friend took me here for the first time a couple of weeks ago and I can't wait to go back! Super yummy tea and food and the ambiance is amazing! I still can't get the "fish and chips" sandwich out of my mine. Holy yum! People that say that having tea and sandwiches for lunch doesn't "fill you up," have obviously not been to this place. I walked away stuffed and stayed stuffed for hours after. Can't wait to go back with my girlfriends!
author: Bernadette H.

description:
One of the cutest tea lounges I've been to!!! The sandwiches are of course adorable, but so tasty as well!!! I love the spicy garlic shrimp, smoked salmon and dill, and the turkey pesto. The Georgia on my Mind tea was delicious. The perfect peach black tea blend. 

The ambiance of the place is very playful and cute. I love tea lounges that aren't so uniform with their place settings. Get ready for a fun mixture of furniture, plates, and cups! I'll definitely be coming back ;)
author: Sherilynn R.

description:
I felt like I entered a retirement home with a deep love for upholstery, flowery design, quaint crockery, croshay which harked me back to my nun times... Not that I was a nun but as school child they used to teach the class how to make webs with wool.. I was useless. 

There also was a table of older ladies in broad hats and their Sunday best having a gay old time. They looked like fun, I waited to hang out with them but alas I have no broad hat in my catalogue of clothes.

I think it's the fact that the ceiling is low and in order for it to really evoke the atmosphere for me, it needs to be a high ceiling. This is something they obviously have no control over unless they give you magic Alice In Wonderland potion.

I got one of the coconut teas which was not strong enough for my taste but the girl serving us was very sweet and knew her teas. They ran out of scones which again was OK as I was at a point in my visit that eating all day seemed the norm and I was turning into a ten tonne Tessy.

Not my cup of tea (I know I'm so witty) but I'm not into that style so it's a personal thing.
author: Annie L.

description: I don't think I'll be coming back here. Atmosphere was nice, food was mediocre, tea was good but didn't stay warm, they need tea pot cozys. Best sandwich was the bacon and egg, most boring for me was the curry chicken salad, you would think that would be exciting. Scone was the best pastry the rest was blah. What bothered me the most was the crust on the bread, seems like they got lazy and forgot to cut the crust off only some of the bread.
author: Karen T.

description:
Odd location but don't let it fool you. Serious tea room within!
Lots of different sandwiches and teas to choose from.  Their most popular sandwich is the curry chicken which was very good.  Personally, I'm still dreaming of their honey lavender sandwich.  I could order that alone along with my new favorite tea, Candy Breakfast and be in total heaven. 
The reason for the only 4 stars is the noise.  While its great that large parties can be accommodated, like the few bridal showers being held, it felt like voices were raised in order for each other to be heard.  I like my tea rooms a little quieter, not library quiet, but nice chatter. 
My bestie and I do plan to redeem our Yelp check in special very soon!
author: trixy b.

description: First time in tea room, didn't really know what to expect but is fun girly thing to do. I enjoyed my tea, the pastries were really good. finger sandwiches were ok. I like the eclectic antique decor. They own the manicure place next door, good manicure, friendly staff. You sit in comfy chairs while they do your nails.
author: Margaret Y.

description:
Great little SoMa spot!

Extensive menu with a variety of sandwiches and goodies. Cute decor - very traditional feel. 

I think the food was good (variety of sweets, scones, curry chicken and fishnchips sandwiches), but just standard. I guess I wasn't expecting to be blown out if the water over tea sandwiches, anyway. 

I have visited other tea houses - Secret Garden, Ritz, Lisa's Tea, etc and Dartealing falls short with some details. I am nit picking:

- made reservation but waited 30+ mins
- slow service 
- loose sugar - not cubes 
- used tea bags for loose tea as opposed to providing a strainer. 
- the cream for the scones were off - not that rich Devonshire stuff

Great experience, a little overpriced, but I might come back for an event. There was a bridal shower going on in the background and Dartealing seems like it would be a great spot.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
This place is super cute!! It's right next door to Polished Lounge and would be great for a day out with the girls. Start off with your Mani/Pedi then walk next door for a cup of tea, yummy tea bites (small cookies, mini sammies, etc...) and more time to gab with your girlfriends.

I  highly recommend the coconut rooibos tea.
author: Rana A.

description:
I hope the owner reads the comments about sharing charges and changes the policy. 

$8 extra because two people want to share a plate is just outrageous. The only thing it does it to prevent smaller or less-hungry people from being customers. Bottle fees make a bit of sense since the restaurant opens the bottle, pours the wine, etc. But in this case it's a surcharge for something only the customer is doing.

If you want to have a $12 per person average charge for the table, that's fine, but it should be able to be made up by one person having $20 and another having $4 worth of items. 

I was about to go here for lunch with two friends, but one is tiny and won't eat much, and that eliminates DarTealing as a possibility for us.
author: Jacob L.

description:
I must admit I was a little skeptical of DarTealing because someone on Yelp mentioned it's like visiting grandmother's house, and since frumpy decor from places like Lovejoy makes me want to throw up, I was in great fear to end up in a place that will completely suppress my giant appetite for afternoon tea. 

Phew! DarTealing does not resemble your grandma's house!  But it's not like a zen garden either.  It actually looks like something from a Anthropoligie catalog, with tastefully mismatched cups and saucers. A roomy and yet cozy space.  

The place is perfect for a get together with your favorite lady friends!  6 of us ordered the tea for two sets (plus two extra person, so $21 each).  We were given the choice of 9 different sandwiches, plus salad, scones, and little sweets.  What a feast!

We got all 9 flavors of the savory sandwiches and I didn't taste one that I didn't like.  From the more classic flavors of turkey and pesto to the more adventurous fish and chips or tofu, everything was delicious.  Of all the tea places in SF I've visited, DarTealing has the best sandwiches. 

The scones were good and fragrant, but the clotted cream was a bit strange.  Maybe they were variations of the traditional clotted cream but they were a little too sweet. 

The teas were decent.  We had English breakfast, Jasmine Jade and Chai.  If you were a pure tea lover, go to Samovar.  Tea here is good enough to wash down your food, but not something to savor on its own. 

The service was sweet and pleasant.  They did forget our chai but then again, I admit a large party can be a bit of headache to keep track of sometimes. 

Reservation is recommended: it's a full house on a weekend afternoon, and 3rd street isn't exactly a fun part of town to walk around while waiting for your table, unless your idea of fun is to sit under the freeway and count the cars going by.
author: Candice B.

description:
Definitely a fan when I have been transformed to another city, London. The perfect little tea house nestled up on the most random street on 3rd/Harrison. My friend and I made a reservation for a 2 for 1 $25 deal on a Friday afternoon (last seating 4:30pm).

We got our choice of seating and chose two sofa chairs. There was a huge menu selection and I picked the Chai (bottomless, what what!). Also included were three sandwich options (both of us got three full sandwiches, or 6 total). We chose eggs & bacon (sooooooooo good!), fish & chips (sooooooo good!) and apple (sweet, but still good).

To top it off, it came with a plate of freshly baked warm scones and biscuits/cookies. Needless to say, we ate everything. We had an amazing 1.5 hours catching up in the intimate, cutely decorated setting. Felt like Alice in Wonderland. Great date spot!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I can't complain.  I love Pauline and Keith, and I have been such a fan of their nail salon Polished Lounge for many years thanks to my sister-in-law...so when I heard they were opening a new tea salon next door I knew it was going to be something special.

We went to a preview...Several weeks later we came with her sister and our niece.  And I was just so thrilled with the place that I dragged my very manly, 6 foot, burly husband to join me one Sunday afternoon for some crumpets and croque monsieur (I have the pictures to prove it).  El Hub isn't even a tea drinker...they DO have beverages for people who don't necessarily drink tea...

Awesome ambiance, great selection of teas (my personal fave is the Creamy Dreamy Earl Grey and the Coconut Rooibos).  I love the decor, the details of all the china pieces.  It's not trying too hard like Crown & Crumpet.  Other tea places in the city are okay, but I am already smitten with this place.  I like how Pauline tweaked her menu, very very different than some of the other tea houses I have been to.  Lots of different sandwiches to choose from!

One setback is on the last visit, there was a large group of girls (around 10) and they were awfully noisy and then our little private space was invaded...LUCKILY it was at the end of our meal and I can't even deduct a star because I know when I go next time with my group of girls, it may not be the quietest either!
author: Meesh K.

description: Love, love, love!  Lovejoys was booked solid this Christmas season so I took a chance on this little place for tea.  I walked from Union Square (about 15 minutes).  It looked like *nothing* from the outside and it was in an unlikely place but when we walked in I was thrilled.  Delicious tea, good sandwiches, comfy couches and wing-back chairs.  They accommodated our requests happily, and let us linger.  Like others, I was too full when I left and still took home leftovers.   I'll be back.  I love finding hidden treasures like this.
author: Kirsten C.

description: This tea lounge is pleasant and versatile.  It's consistent with the English style of tea socials.  The tea sandwiches are tasty and the pastry sweets are a treat.  With so much space and tables it serves as a great setting to any sized gatherings ranging from a  dozen to 3-4 dozen.  It has a back room connection to some sort of spa business as well.
author: Joy R.

description:
This is a sweet, quaint, pretty, frilly tea lounge.  If you enjoy indulging in girly things, feeling like you're in a doll house, and eating with small bites with your pinky finger extended, you will like this place very much.

Classical music, cozy chairs, mix-matched delicate china, tiered platters with yummy tea sandwiches, scones, sweet cream and jams, "bottomless" pots of teas (a great selection of flavors)... aesthetically pleasing to all of the senses.
author: Aria Anaïs Electra S.

description: Came back in March 2013 for Cindy N.'s birthday. Service and quality have seriously diminished. We called, made a reservation, and agreed on pricing. The agreed upon pricing was not communicated to our servers who we felt were nickle and diming us for every little thing. Our servers also didn't take time to explain everything that was brought out to us so everything felt very impersonal. This used to be my favorite place for tea, but I can't say that anymore.
author: Juliana C.

description: I took my mom here during Mother's day weekend. We had a reservation at 3:30 but we were ahead of schedule on our plan. Luckily, they were able to seat us early at 2:30. The ladies were very nice, although a couple times a little hard to flag down, but they were busy! We had two pots of tea, the cabana boy and the wings of the dove. Both very nice. We tried the savory plate and a sandwich plate (Hungarian egg, curried chicken, and turkey pesto). We all thought that the savory plate was quite good. I thought the sandwiches were ok. I thought the best was the turkey pesto, my mom preferred the Hungarian egg (which I liked too), the bf preferred the curried chicken. I will have to try the bacon and egg next time. I loved the decor. I enjoyed the mismatched sets, and the funky bohemian-esque furnishings. We also thought it was a good price for what we got. $54 for the three of us. Will come back again!
author: Koko K.

description:
Was brought here on a lovely warm afternoon by Joshua L. so that I could experience Afternoon Serendipi-Tea for Two. What a lovely an calm experience, being served on what appeared to be fine china, and thankful I was to be whisked away to a place I've never been to before. Not only that, Joshua brought a coupon, oh he is so value. 

For tea we ordered the Pinky Minky and I think the Breakfast Candy. The Pinky Minky had too much of a strong citrus flavor and the Breakfast Candy was the clear winner. 

For sandwiches we chose the curried chicken, turkey and pesto cream, brie and kicky chutney and the classic cucumber. The pesto and brie were super noms. I mean what about a simple sandwich minus the crust makes it taste so phenomenal? I'm really not sure. 

The scones and house made devonshire like cream was to die for. I could eat a whole pot of the cream alone... although that would not be lady like...

It was a really nice afternoon break pretending to be english folks in for a spot of tea before we went back to our normal lives.
author: Jessica C.

description:
A great experience! They're very forgiving if you're new to this, since all of their special blends are very customer-friendly. The descriptions are all provided, and even if you don't know much about tea, you can just pick one that sounds good to you. The teas are all very good, too. We came as a group of 4 and were able to select our own pots of tea: Coconut Creme Rooibos, Her Majesty's Secret Service, Apple-a-day, and Something-something dragonwell. There is a wide selection of sandwiches, easily catering to vegetarian tastes, and the flavors are unexpectedly complex and interesting. I would highly recommend the strawberries and creme, which is creme cheese with strawberry jam, a touch of balsamic, and a hint of lavender. Even the salad was surprisingly delicious. The desserts were ok. The scones were good, though, with little British touches like clotted cream and lemon curd. The decor inside is so adorable; my friend now wants a tea parlor in her dream home! 

Also, it's fairly easy to park; there's a small lot near South Park with metered parking. 

A couple of points: this place is rather small, can be easy to miss since the exterior is pretty nondescript. Also, can be expensive (25$ per person), but that can be typical of this kind of service. I had read a couple of reviews about the poor service here, but what we experienced was just ok.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Cute place, good food! 

I love the bree and chutney sandwich!
author: Sabrina W.

description: I came here for my gf's birthday and the place is AWESOME!!! It's an english style tea house. You will totally loved the interior.  Some tea places also have the same decorations that they do but the fooooooood.... nothing can beat it. It's yummy! The curry sandwich, pb&j, scones and all that was served to us was delicious. If you come here with a party of 4 or more I suggest you call for a reservation and place your order before hand. This is my favorite tea place so far. I have to say better than crown and crumpet since they don't have a time limit, parking is easy, food is way better than crown and crumpet. I will definitely come back here again.
author: Sherry C.

description:
After my first experience here, I might have been inclined to write a three-star review, like my friend Jena did... The service and food were adequate, the teas delightful, and the service pleasant but seemingly at a loss to accommodate our large group...

HOWEVER, after my most recent visit to DarTealing Lounge, the only thing keeping me from giving this lovely little spot a 5-star review is the memory of the fact that they didn't know how to handle all the tea pots on the table when I hosted a party here. The food on my second visit was much better than on my first (I suspect because they were hard-pressed to put together all the sandwiches needed for our large party the first time around), the service phenomenal, and I love that the scone and petit fours flavors are always changing. I also love that DarTealing offers lime curd, rather than the standard lemon, and the owner is very sweet, extremely knowledgeable, and very accommodating. I highly recommend the Pinky Minky, Creme de Coconut, and Her Majesty's Secret Service teas, as well as the From Pear to Eternity.

The verdict:
Come for an intimate tea for two, and don't forget to buy a tin of your favorite tea to take home, but if you're in a group of more than four, stick to Lovejoy's.
author: Elle Q.

description: Went there today to celebrate my sister's birthday. So disappointing!!  Our reservation was for 1:30pm. No one greeted us upon arrival and then we waited for 1/2 hour to be seated. No one spoke to us for 15 minutes after being seated. We finally called someone over and asked if we could get some service. When the server got to our table she said "I hear you ladies are ready to order". There was no greeting, no Thanks for waiting - she was quite rude. Then she informed us that we were ordering from the wrong menu even though the menu was on the table. I have to say that this was probably the worst service I have ever had. The actual teas and food were rather tasty. If not for that I would be giving this place one star. Skip it and go somewhere else. Absolutely awful. I felt so bad for my sister on her special day.
author: Brenda D.

description:
Having studied in England and having traveled to most of her Majesties colonies. I have enjoyed many a high tea. Dartealing was bit of a disappointment. 
While the food was good, it seemed overpriced for the quality and quantity (I don't mind dropping a wad of cash when you feel you get your moneys worth).  The room was cute and cozy, albeit too warm inside. 
There was one server who seemed overwhelmed and hadn't  the time to provide the personalized touch that a good high tea warrants. Given that, It doesn't seem likely that I would return.
San Francisco offers so many better high tea choices. I prefer Garden Court, Crown and Crumpet or Samovar.
author: Denis B.

description: This place is awesome for tea and their scones are freaking aaaamazing.  Get their bottomless team pots and a few tasty treats, you will not regret. Plus its really affordable!
author: Robert R.

description:
Oh my oh my, this place is adorable!  My girlfriends and I all enjoyed their atmosphere, food and tea!
Atmosphere...yes although the place may have low ceilings, it adds to the coziness of the place.  The antique glass collection on the pass through - lovely, and being seated at the little couch area - very comfortable and we sat there for over 3 hours without being pestered to leave. 
If by chance you get there and they have right out of the over white chocolate lavender scones....by all means grab a few...they are out of this world.  And I love the variety of sandwiches offered.  They have the traditional cucumbers and salmon with capers...yet they also have fish and chips ...right up my alley!  Check it out...it is a really cute place.
author: Marie S.

description:
This is where I have tea with my ladies. It is quaint, the food is excellent and the tea pots are ample.

The ambiance is what I'd expect from a traditional English tea house! I really like the vibe here and the service is patient, well paced and pleasant.

I had a delicious hummus sandwich on whole wheat bread (vegan!) and a lot of yummy scones and petit fours (not vegan but yummy!). I absolutely love petit fours and they excel at theirs.

My tea pot lasted for two hours during a relaxing afternoon tea with my friends. 

I highly recommend this place - it is simply charming.
author: Katherine B.

description: It was one of the best tea services I have ever been to.  A cute and happy little jewel, that serves super yummy scones and delightful tea.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
This place is definitely calm in the midst of a storm! The neighborhood is hectic, there are businesses all around, and a broken down corner store across the street. But the inside of this place is all Zen. 

The decorations are perfectly mismatched. Each table setting was cute, and cozy enough for carry a conversation. 

The four of us ordered two sets of Afternoon Serendipi-tea For Two. We started off HUNGRY, and this filled us all up to the brim, with food to spare! 

Started off with a Mixed Greens salad. 

Teas: A definite plus is loose leaf tea, not bags! Her Majesty's Secret Service (Vanilla black tea, definitely sweet), Cabana Boy (strawberry, papaya green tea - my favorite! It was light, fruity and went well with the foods), Rice-too-Crispy (rice green tea, just like the ones at the Japanese restaurants), Caramel Carousel (reminded me of A&W root beer!). 

Sandwiches: Ham & Cheddar, Turkey & Pesto, Curried Chicken, Fish & Chips (surprising favorite), Strawberries & Cream, Brie & Chutney

Desserts: Lavender & White Chocolate Scones (favorite), Almond Petite Fours, Strawberry & Kiwi cream puffs

PS. The host dresses the part and adds to the experience. Also, she'll show you how to use a strainer. 

All for around $20 a person! 

PS. You can use your credit card to pay for parking meters in the area, PLUS PLUS PLUS!
author: Jane N.

description:
My friend Becca set up a nice afternoon of tea and tea snacks at Dar Tealing and this place is not only really cute, but great tea and awesome tea sandwiches.

*Big thing for me was they had one tea sandwiche that mimicked fish and chips and it was super tasty.

If you are ever looking for a place to have tea and tea snacks, hit this place up.
author: Terrine B.

description:
This place is super adorable! I came here with a girlfriend to celebrate her birthday, and there's no better way to celebrate than over a cup of tea!! 

It was a bit awkward when we first entered the place. One of waitresses asked us if we had a reservation, and we replied that we were walk-in. She said she needed to check, but there were at least 3 tables open! Luckily they were able to seat us immediately.  

I ordered a Frolic in Phuket tea as well as the Fish and Chips tea sandwich. So good!! That was definitely my favorite! I forget the exact cost, but I remember it being a bit pricey or else I would've ordered another one! 

This is such a cute girly-girl kind of place! I now want to buy a cute hat so I can wear it the next time I come here.
author: Lina W.

description:
This place is SO cute! The teas were just OK but I loved their tea sandwiches! Who would have thought curry chicken would make such yummy afternoon tea sandwiches?! Their scones were really yummy especially with the cream. We were too full to enjoy their desserts but it looked really good. 

I've had high tea in the San Jose area a few times before. Although it is closer to home it was also more expensive. DarTealing lounge was further but it was cheaper at $20/person. The teas at DarTealing was OK (not a lot of choices). Overall I enjoyed my tea time with my girlfriends! We felt proper and sophisticated until later on that night...hahah BUT this shows we can be a lady, even if it was only for a few hours. =P
author: Natalia H.

description: Very slow service, but the waitresses are nice and friendly.  They need to be more attentive.  Other than that, this place is perfect for a girls tea catchup date, bridal shower, baby shower, anything involving a small group of girls, really.  I saw a dude sitting by himself and enjoying tea, cakes, and free wifi, which I thought was cute.  The little sandwiches are dainty and delicious, all of the different pastries are well made, and they gave us macarons with ours, yum! I would say that the afternoon tea for two is an overwhelming amount of food for two girls unless you went on a 15 mile bike ride beforehand, and the Taste or the Ploughman's service is enough and quite satisfying.
author: Terry K.

description:
My first experience ever at a tea lounge and this place was the best for my first time. I came here with my girls and we all had a blast. The service was really great and the place was simply darling. Super ups because they have Jasmine Tea (my favorite) and although the place looked super fancy, the pricing was really not that bad. We honestly thought we were going to spend way more than we paid, so it was a great experience.
The sandwiches were really cute and delicious; don't get me started on the desserts and fruit - so cute, so yummy. I will definitely be back with my girls every december to start a new tradition.
author: Michelley D.

description: Went for high tea here a couple months ago and was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful the food and teas were. I have to say I am partial to the tea house close by my place and went off reviews and would definitely say this place is a must see if you are into tea houses!! I look forward to coming back when I'm in the city again. Everything was so quaint and delicious
author: Candice G.

description:
DarTealing is truly an adorable tearoom. Came here last Saturday to celebrate a girlfriend's birthday.  From the prix fixe menu ($25 per person), we were able to get 4 pots of tea, 6 finger sandwiches, scones, sweets and a mixed green salad. 

For the tea, we had the Cabana Boy, Georgia on My Mind, Chamomile Lavender, and Parisian Earl Grey. My favorites were Cabana Boy (Sweet summer strawberry and papaya bits got together  
with high quality green.) and Georgia on my mind (Taste of summer year-round with sweet peach & Orange Pekoe). 

For the sandwiches, there were Turkey & pesto cream,
Darjeeling curried chicken, Smoked salmon & herbed-capers mousse, Pear & Blue and cucumber w/ market-fresh herbs. All the sandwiches were tasty, only the bread was a bit stale. 

Sweets and treats came out last and I was too full to enjoy them. The scones, however, were soft, buttery and moist. It is one of the best scones I've ever had!

Company was great and the service we received was wonderful! Would go back for more girl-time.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Came here randomly during the work week for a girl's lunch and was instantly reminded of my time in London.  Super cute hole in the wall place that I never even knew was here until someone mentioned it.

The mushroom tartine was beautiful and heavenly with perfect flakiness and cheesy goodness.  

I loved all of my tea sandwiches, can't really go wrong with those things.

Best of all was the scones with cream - fresh from the oven and buttery sweet.  I would go back here in a heartbeat!
author: grace m.

description: I've always wanted to have high tea and this is a great place to experience it!!! The service is a little bit slow but okay. The tea was pretty good; I highly recommend the Cabana Boy (a strawberry papaya green tea). The sandwiches were awesome, too. I ordered Fish n' Chips, Berries n' Cream, and Spicy Shrimp. The desserts are really good too. I especially liked the fruit puffs and the lemon shortbread cookies. The place is really welcoming also; the cups and teapots are antiques. I really felt like I was an English person at tea time. Overall this place is really good.
author: PO H.

description: I can't believe I took so long to try this place out.  Finally went here for my annual girly Christmas tea with friends (and an adorable new baby girl addition to our traditional group).  Tea was fantastic!  They have a $20 per person deal that includes a pot of tea each, sandwiches, salad, and a bunch of tea type desserts.  That's pretty competitive compared to other tea places, and it was more than enough food even though we got there at 1pm and none of us had had breakfast yet.  Service was prompt and pleasant, but we were in no way rushed and could relax and enjoy a leisurely girl chat and coo over the baby.  Definitely recommend reservations on the weekends though -- this place was busy!!
author: Tasha D.

description:
If you know me, you also know that I think tea houses are a big fat rip off. Why pay dinner prices at lunch for egg sandwiches I can make at home? Why is everything in the room pink?

Dartealing is completely different. The moment I walked in, I was amazed at how beautiful and soothing the tea house was - it's not obnoxiously frilly or girly, but classy. And, the food is delicious. I tried an open faced sandwich with mozzarella, tomato and basil, and it was probably one of the freshest sandwiches I'd ever had. The petit fours are also amazing.

Probably the best part of Dartealing is that is right next door to a mani-pedi shop, with equally impressive service and decor. I will be back!
author: Genevieve W.

description: Really delicious place!!!! The service is super friendly. The only thing is that the food takes a long time just to get. But other then that I would reccemond the pillow pot pie.
author: Kaitlynne L.

description:
Oh, all right, I'll admit it. I caught royal wedding fever. Now, before you roll your eyes, you should know that the remedy for said affliction is high tea, and high tea is a yummy experience, particularly if you have it at DarTealing Lounge.

I've been here three times now, and each time the results have been consistent: the food is delicious, the room delightfully quaint, the service uneven, and the prices too high (though on par with other tea rooms).  I always walk in, think how sweet the room is, wish I'd worn a pastel colored dress, and then sit down to a thoroughly confusing menu. For whatever reason, I never know how it works. Not wanting to have to decipher the thing, I order the Serendipi-Tea for Two ($40), select my favorite pot of tea - Parisian Earl Grey (hints of vanilla happily join the traditional bergamot) - and have a spectacular experience.

Serendipi-tea Tea for Two comes with enough tea sandwiches (12) for three people, and you get to pick three varieties. My favorites are the turkey and pesto cream, mushroom and herbs de Provence, and classic cucumber and fresh herbs. They are tasty, light, and comforting - an almost impossible fete! It also comes with 2 small éclairs that are super yummy, 2 scones, crème, lemon curd, and raspberry preserves and a selection of petit fours. Oh, and let's not forget the salad. Gotta eat your veggies, even the queen eats hers.  

On this particular day, we were given complimentary mimosas to celebrate Willy and Cat (my personal pet names for the pair), and tea for two split by three was absolutely perfect. My only regret? I wasn't wearing one of those fabulous fascinators! Next time, friends. Next time for sure.
author: Indigo W.

description:
My sister and I threw a baby shower pedicure party last Sunday for 16 guests at Polished Lounge and our tea service was catered by Dartealing.   The party was amazing , the food was delicious and the staff at both places were on top of things and so helpful.  Pauline, the owner of both establishments, was very accommodating with all our requests. Not only did our guests have a great time, but my sister and I found it so easy to host and also enjoy ourselves.   Usually whenever we throw a party, we are running around like chickens with our heads cut off.   This time, we had fun!!!

We chose for our party a tea service that included: tea sandwiches - Turkey and Pesto Cream, Brie and Kicky Chutney,Tofu and Ginger Soy Glaze, Chocolate Peanut Indulgence;  Croque Monsieur; Crumpets/ White Chocolate Lavender Scones; Asian Chicken Salad; Kiwi & Strawberry Fruit Puffs; Almond Petit Fours; and Red Velvet Cookies,   Our teas were a a blueberry black tea, a watermelon rooibos, and a peach iced tea.   The sandwiches were so filling.  Loved loved loved the turkey, the croque monsieurs, and the chocolate peanut.  I lost count on the number of sandwiches I ate that afternoon.   The scones were yummy and the fruit puffs were like crack.  I couldn't get enough of them.   What was nice also, was that Pauline allowed to bring our own food and beverages to supplement what was being served by her.  So we were definitely able to personalize the menu and have the favorite foods of our mom-to-be served at the party. We brought our own cupcakes, prosecco and OJ,  ice-cream cake, mac n cheese, fruit and cheese plate, and bacon-wrapped pistachio stuffed dates.   Our guests had serious food-coma!

We had Polished Lounge to ourselves and we paid a little extra to extend our time.  We were there from 11am-3pm but started setting up around 10:30am. We were able to bring our own decorations and make the place really festive looking.  Pauline and staff helped with the set-up and also made suggestions and added their own special touches.   My sister and I definitely  plan to hold more parties at Polished Lounge/ Dartealing in the near future.  I think it's a great place to have baby showers, bridal showers, and birthday parties.    I posted several pics of our party...

Thanks, Pauline, Keith, Brittany, and rest of the staff of both Polished Lounge and Dartealing Lounge  for making our baby shower a success!
author: Christine C.

description:
Came here with a bloomspot deal this afternoon. I have been to several high tea places around SF, so I know exactly what to expect. From seeing pictures and the advertisement for the deal on Bloomspot, I had expectations that were not met once we were seated and given "what we paid for." The place itself is very cute and girly. Having a friend visiting from outside of town, I was ecstatic to introduce her to the rituals of English high tea. But...not sure if it was a good introduction.

First of all, we ordered 3 types of sandwiches, which the kitchen mixed up (but they brought us extra to fix their mistake), were tasty, but nothing out of the ordinary. The dessert part of the tea service included 2 muffins with lemon and raspberry jamps, 2 teeeeeeny tiny, almost the size of a quarter fruit tarts, 2 even smaller biscotties, HALF of a strawberry, 2 slices of kiwi, and 2 blackberries. Oh, and you cannot forget the tiny square of opera cake and lemon cake. It is not even a piece of cake, but those tiny square desserts that I am pretty sure were from Trader Joe's petite cake box. I mean the tea service for 2 must have 2 of everything, but this place obviously didn't get the memo. And I mean, HALF of a strawberry, 2 berries, and 2 slices of kiwi? For the $$$$$$ that they charge, they definitely do not provide the service. Do not believe what they advertise, you will not get the le petit minis, nor the macaroons. If you have a deal, expect to get the left overs.

It was painful to have to pay 18 % tip for horrible horrible place like this.

1 star only because the decor was cute, but otherwise, you can take your $40 to the store and have a FEAST for 2 people.
author: Karina A.

description:
This 2-star review is a balancing followup to my previous 5-star review. Dartealing remains a lovely spot with excellent food and tea, but all of the new surcharges are ridiculous. The $25 Serendipity is perfect for two, why charge $8 to split? I guess you're "encouraging" us to order two of the $15 service which would be too much food and doesn't include scones. $2 to split a giant pot of tea, really?

Although a minimum of $30 for lunch is much too high, its more the principle that bothers me. I think we'll be going elsewhere from now on.
author: Will A.

description:
My tea buddy and I went on Saturday around noon.  It's best to make reservations, especially for the weekend.  This place is charming, not overly pink or cluttered.  

We got the Afternoon Serendipi-Tea for Two.  The tea names are so intriguing.  She got Her Majesty's Secret Service, a black tea with hints of bourbon vanilla.  It was definitely hints of vanilla since we could smell the vanilla but not taste it at all.  I got Casablanca After Midnight, a rooibos tea with mint and mocha, which overwhelmingly tasted like mint.

We choose three sandwiches: darjeeling curry chicken, smoked salmon and capers, and smoked ham and horse radish cheddar.  The curry chicken was the most unique tea sandwiches we encountered and we voted it our favorite.

There were also two scones, tea cookies/pastries, and petite fours.  There was a chocolate chip scone, which amazingly, we did not know existed.  We finished the tea desserts happily, feeling satisfied with the whole tea experience.
author: Rose C.

description: The place may be nice but the staff is very rude.  I had to cancel a reservation for tomorrow and the woman who answered the phone was rude and so disrespectful.  I don't see how they can have someone so vile representing this place with such a horrible attitude.
author: Terry S.

description:
I remember being a child and having tea parties with my best friend and our stuffed animals. It was always fun and I've often reminisced about being a little girl, in a pink party dress...just me and my stuffed animals...uh, wow, that came out wrong. Anyway, the amazing thing about DarTealing Lounge is that it brings back that wonderful feeling you had when you were little - tasty tea, cute tea pots and tea cups and little sandwiches with the crusts cut off.

I came here with two girlfriends and our Moms and  we really had an amazing time. The tea choices are amazing (and delicious) and the food was great. It was a relaxing and enjoyable day, thanks to the ladies at Dartealing. I'm not how sure I'd come here just to hang out on my own, but it's a great location for a baby shower, bridal shower, girlfriend get together, etc...
author: Melanie N.

description: A huge surprise by my Bloomspot certificate and i will definitely return for a second round.
