It's difficult to find a quiet tea room to have long conversation with friends so this is a nice option to spend a nice afternoon over delcious sandwiches, scones and tea. This is a 10-15min walk from union square and parking is pretty easy on 3rd.
author: Maggie C.

description:
I have been to Dartealing many times, but yesterday was the first time I went for an event.  My friend and I hosted a baby shower for 20 people on Sunday.  The party was a hit!  My mom, my friends and the guest of honor loved it.  We were the first people in there and the staff was very nice and accommodating.  The food, as always was delicious.  I imagine tea sandwiches to be plain and boring but not these!  There are a ton of menu items to choose from.  Even their scones are flavored (I think ours were lavender).  They let us bring champagne for a corkage fee and they had wonderful glassware for us to use.  The tea varieties were stellar.  We chose Royal Earl Grey, Paper Lantern, Apple A Day and Last Mango in Paris.  The sandwich flavors we chose were Curried Chicken, Brie and Chutney (crowd favorite), Bacon & Egg and Roasted Red Pepper and Hummus.  In the past I have had their Asian Chicken Salad, Chicken Pesto Brie Tartine, sausage roll and cream puffs which are all tasty.  I have not had their Croque Monsieur or Madame but I am sure they are wonderful.  In addition to the food, the decor is great...so many details, just like their nail salon, Polished Lounge which is next door.  Both these businesses are some of my favorite in SOMA.  

Lastly, a note about the wonderful owner Pauline.  I loved working with her...she was very professional, easy going and nice.  She was responsive to my emails, always answering my questions and assisting with anything that I needed.  I noticed there were some negative reviews about her not responding to emails in a timely matter, however her email signature states that all communications regarding events are done from Wednesday through Friday.  Saturdays and Sundays are dedicated to events management and that they are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays.  This may be the case for some people feeling like she was not responsive to emails.  I can vouch that this is not the case, she certainly responded to my emails within a few days and I am very happy with my experience and will definitely recommend Dartealing to others for an event, lunch, or even just a leisurely afternoon tea.
author: Lily M.

description:
There are so many things wrong with this place I don't know where I'd begin. 

It's in a slightly sketchy part of town, so beware of that.

This place is super overpriced and they don't give you a ton of food. We went at 11 and were starving a few hours later so we ended up going to dinner at 5pm because we were that starved.

The place was cutely set up, and that's kind of the only thing it going for it.

Here are my complaints:

First, the lady seemed annoyed that we even had a deal. I don't understand that, if you get so grumpy when people have deals why do you even offer them in the first place? They served us and tried to be pleasant but it was obvious that they weren't happy. 

Second, no milk or cubed sugar. I know this sounds particular but it's afternoon tea, cubed sugar is part of it. They also don't have clotted cream, it tasted like whipped cream cheese. Clotted cream is standard, generally so not sure why they cheaped out.

The portions are tiny. We were starving a few hours later and this has never happened to me at any of the other tea places I've been to and I've been to quite a few.

They're a little lazy with sandwiches because they could have cut off the crust but clearly didn't on some of the sandwiches. We had curried chicken, smoked salmon, and the ham sandwiches. They were only okay.

The scone is TINY. It's a third of the size of normal scones, and the baked goods they attach are store bought. You can definitely taste the preservatives. I had one petite four, mini cookie, tiny cream puff. Also most places give you much more bang for your buck.

Finally, THEY CHARGED A FORCED GRATUITY OF 18% FOR TWO PEOPLE. TWO PEOPLE?!!? They didn't even service us for the most part. 


So, needless to say I'm never coming back here and advising everyone else I know not to come here. It's not in the least worth the money. If you want something around the same price just go to lovejoy's in noe valley and if you want amazing tea time go to The Fairmont. This place is not worth the cost.
author: Lilly K.

description:
Adorable. Simply adorable. I went with a girlfriend for a long lunch during a dreary afternoon. It totally brightened an otherwise drab day. 

The interior is a mishmash of old English decor - none of the decorations, furniture, china, or tableware seemed to be from the same place, but still went together flawlessly. The service was stellar - the servers were quick and attentive without being invasive.  

And the tea and food we delicious. My dining-mate and I split the "Afternoon Serendipi-Tea for Two" ($43), which includes 12 tea sandwiches, salad, scones (with tasty toppings), tea cakes/sweets,
petits fours, and a bottomless pot of tea. I got the SOMA Roca - a mix of rooibos, chocolate, and a hint of caramel.  So good. 

I will be back next time I can get away for a leisurely lunch.
author: Kori M.

description: A little pricy but supper cute. The food is really tasting and the tea is divine. The location leaves something to be desired but when you walk in you forget all about it. I have been twice now and would definately recomend it.
author: Natasha K.

description:
I love afternoon tea and this was a great experience. Although the location is industrial, inside is very charming. 
Afternoon tea for two was great! The scones were warm and delicious. They had a great variety of petits fours. The savory sandwiches we tasty. I love the Caramel Carousel tea. The macarons (not included) were below average. The "lounge seating" was a bit uncomfortable and awkward. 
Overall a great experience and I will come again.
author: A A.

description:
I came here this past weekend for my birthday with my friends and I had a nice time. DarTealing feels very cute and cozy. The employees are kind and sweet. I made a reservation a few days in advance. Megan & Michelle (who I spoke to on the phone) were very helpful because it was my first time planning to go to a tea lounge. They answered all of my questions and were very helpful with the pre-ordering process.

It wasn't busy when we went at 1:30pm on Sunday. We were seated promptly at 1:30pm; which was the time of our reservation. We had a party of 12 and we enjoyed the "Taste-tea service for two" We were given menus to select teas from and shortly after we selected our teas, our food came out. 

All of my friends loved the sandwiches and the sweets. We had the smoked salmon and dill, spicy garlic shrimp, ham and horseradish cheddar, and the DarTealing curried chicken. My personal favorites were the spicy garlic shrimp and the ham and horseradish cheddar. 

As for the teas, we selected:
-Purple Gems
-Royal Earl Grey
-Jasmine & Jade
-Rice-Too-Crispy
-Breakfast Candy--Black tea
-Paper Lantern--White tea

My tea favorites were Jasmine & Jade and Purple Gems. The employees made sure that we received re-fills when our teas were running low. There were also a lot of sweets left over that we could not finish. I was afraid that we wouldn't have enough, but it was definitely more than we could eat.

I'd definitely come here again with friends. Thank you DarTealing!
author: Ann Z.

description:
There were so many choices for the tea service I could hardly choose.  The sandwiches were great - my favorite was the honey and cream.

The tea was extremely fragrant, and they had good recommendations as to pairings.

The shop itself is really cute and quaint, with mismatched tea sets and doilies.
author: Ying L.

description:
Very first tea party I've been to...and it won't be the last! Charming little place with adorable mismatched teacups, teapots, and saucers. The decor was adorable, but not over the top frilly or like-your-grandmothers-house. The restaurant was on the small side, so if you happen to come on a busy day it can get pretty loud in there. Reservations typically last about an hour and a half, but they were a bit slow in bringing out the food so we stayed a little longer. 

We picked the $25 tea service, which came with unlimited tea, 8 sandwiches, salad, scone, and petit four. Curried chicken, cucumber,and  salmon were a few of my favorite sandwiches. Yum!!! Salad was ehh, no wow factor. Scone was pretty amazing, but sadly I was so full by then I only managed to finish half. I was looking forward to the sweets at the end, but the petit four was SO sweet I only managed a nibble. 

Overall, it is a bit expensive for what it is...but you are paying for the cute girly experience. Service was not the quickest, as there was only one server. Metered parking was plentiful and the allotted hour and a half is more than enough time for a small party. Do keep in mind that if you've confirmed your headcount with them, you cannot cancel any of your guests. A bit aggravating, but completely understandable for such a small establishment. The owner Pauline was nice enough to lower the tea services to $19 each for those who did not show up to our party. Definitely a great place to celebrate something special. Can't wait to try a few more places around the city!
author: Vivian D.

description: Honestly this is the best place I know for high tea, no other compares. Breakfast Candy is a the best tea I've ever had, no joke! This place I cute and classy, the food is delicious and the service is great, however if your one of those people that needs to get babied every 5 minutes go on a Wednesday when it's slow you'll be much happier. Definitely make an appointment before you go, even if its a slow day, it's just customary to do so when I comes to high tea.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I am glad others have enjoyed this place so much.  Our experience was not special.  We came for a bridal shower.  Our server was surly and unprofessional.  The bus person was very nice. The sandwiches were adequate and tasty but small portions.  The salad was inedible.  The ambiance is very nice and it could be a wonderful place.  Maybe we just hit it on a bad day.
author: T H.

description:
To preface my review-my mom is from london, so she has had a lot of experience with tea time experiences in london and here. Coming from the perspective of having had a lot of supposedly 'authentic' tea lounge experiences, i can tell you that my mother and I loved this place. We got a bloomspot for two and got the cucumber, mediterranean, and turkey sandwiches. I loved the turkey and my mom love the cucumber, but the mediterranean wasn't that great. BUT the tea was amazing. My mother had mint lavender and i had the SoMa tea. They were both fantastic. We were both really full for dessert but the dessert was really good as well, especially the crumpets. 

In response to some of the yelpers who had negative reviews about this place, I feel that they have nothing to compare this tea lounge to. Go to any other comparable tea lounge in sf or better yet, in london, and you won't be complaining about service. Side note: service in london is notoriously horrendous so if you want an authentic tea experience, the worse the service, the more authentic :). But perhaps we weren't so picky about the service here because we have had some really really bad tea experiences 

Additionally there were a couple of ladies near us with a bloomspot as well who began harassing the wait staff about the gratuity that had to be paid. First if all u miserable chepos who feel that you can demean people because YOU didn't read the rules of the coupon....NEVER BUY A BLOOMSPOT AGAIN YOU MORONS. You ladies who spent about 10 minutes telling the staff how they were "punishing" them by asking them to pay gratuity are disgusting. I digress however, this place is great and my mother and I will be back.
author: Monisha S.

description:
This is a lovely idea to spend some ladylike hours! They have a wide selection of teas so it's really up to your tastes on what you prefer and how long you steep the leaves. The food is yum and really quite unique in that you can't really find them in many other places. 

In terms of sandwich, the favorite hands down was the egg and bacon, quite the savory delight. Curried chicken was also tasty. Goat cheese and sundried tomatoes is really strong in flavor so if you're not a fan of super strong or potent cheese, this might not be for you. 

Their scones are really good--not overly sweet and just the right amount of moistness. 

One of the highlights was their bread pudding. I've never had the savory kind so this moist and fluffy. Big fan.
author: Annie W.

description:
Came here for a birthday party/tea party with little under 30 girls. DarTealing is a great place for an afternoon brunch with a bunch of your girlfriends drinking tea! 

There is tons of parking around the area. You can opt for street parking however there are parking lots up the street that are 10 bucks. DarTealing has a great ambiance! The decor is adorable. There are long tables, short tables, sofa area and I like how each section has different types of tables and chairs. The tea sets are so cute. Everything at the table was mixed matched.The service is great. They were very attentive to fill our teapots. Trust they know the teas so feel free to ask them anything!

All the teas had a great taste. They came in the cutest teapots. Some we tried:
Earl Grey- Classic tea. Goes great when you are eating something sweet to counter balance.
Long Island Strawberry- one of my faves! Tart yet sweet!
Chamomile Lavender- had a flowery after taste. Went well with milk.

The sandwiches were even better. I like how they come out on serving trays and they CUT OUT THE CRUST! Heaven!
Curried Chicken- had a great curry taste but wasnt to heavy
Smoked Salmon- who woulda thought doing smoked salmon in a sandwhich instead of a bagel!
Pear and Blue Cheese- sweet and savory. Texture was kinda of weird but good.
Classic cucumber- very refreshing!
Brie and chutney- another sweet and savory sandwich. Brie and the sweet chutney paired well.

Next course was the SCONES!! Hot out of the oven. Lavender with white chocolate that came with a cream, strawberry perseves and lemon curd. They were crunchy yet soft in the inside. Dessert course followed afterwards with petit fours, cookies and butterscotch pudding.

Play dress up and remember pinkys up ladies!
author: Geneve V.

description: Such a sweet spot tucked away from the noise of the city - and delicious food.  I'm not much of a tea connoisseur, so the server was very sweet to go over the different varietals and I wasn't disappointed.  The Quinoa Salad was sorta to die for....
author: Ben N.

description:
Really cute place. A little more space than Lovejoys so you feel a bit less crowded. I have to admit, I still give Lovejoy's the slight edge but only because I just really love that place. 

We had a group of 7 girls and we had more than enough food. We tried a variety of teas, I think I enjoyed the Georgia on my Mind the most, but the caramel Rooibos I tried was also very tasty. 

as for sandwiches, I tried the goat cheese with sun dried tomato and the roast beef with caramelized onion. Both were good. 

As for the scones....can we talk about it? We had a white chocolate, lavender scone that had a hint of lemon. It came out warm and came with my beloved clotted cream and lemon curd. Ohhh Emmm Geezey....it was so good. Definitely my favorite thing of the meal. 

Oh! and there was also a salad which was nice and fresh as well. 

It was a reasonable price and a nice time to catch up with the ladies. (and gentlemen too, I don't want to discriminate!) We came in on a Sunday so we had the bonus of free parking, 

All in all, I had a lovely time there, and i will definitely be back again.  there's more tea and sandwiches i need to try!

(plus you can get a mani/pedi next door either before or after for an extended day of pampering fun!)
author: Lu E.

description:
Afternoon tea with a San Francisco twist.

Feels like a proper tea house inside. Fine china. Victorian ambiance. Lots and lots of floral prints.

Things evolve nicely with the food as traditional tea sandwiches are given a signature San Francisco stamp. The tofu with a soy glaze and roasted red pepper and hummus were both outstanding.

A scone with strawberry jam highlighted the selection of sweets.

Staying festive we enjoyed the above with Her Majesty's Secret Service tea. Bourbon vanilla, vanilla bean and black tea blend nicely together, and  smells even better.

For two people we did tea service for one with an extra sandwich and paid the split plate fee. A very reasonable $40. Service couldn't have been nicer, and the experience couldn't have been more enjoyable.
author: Jason B.

description:
i've never been a high tea kinda gal, but i do appreciate the idea behind it...hanging out with friends over tea and "biscuits". this place is your typical tea lounge. decked out with cute wall art and decor, it's very spacious and bright. the menu has a wide variety of teas to choose from, so even the more adventurous palettes can be satisfied. unfortunately this is where the praise ends...
first of all, our group of 9 had an 11a(which is when they open) reservation, so why when we got there at 11:05a the gate was still closed? it wasn't until 11:15 did they finally opened the door and ushered us in. not cool. second, the bill came out to be $35/person ON TOP of a $50 deposit. what was included: 3 pots of tea, 25 mini sandwich triangles, 1 small tray of pastries, and 1 tiny tray of sweets. am i the only one who feels it's a rip off?
author: Melissa Y.

description:
The tea selection is phenomenal and the food is delicate, thoughtful, and delicious. 

Definitely a lovely place.
author: MJ W.

description:
Girls Sunday out.  Came here for tea and tea sandwiches.  I love their unique tea cups and tea pots.   Cute and mismatched furniture.. My fave!! loves it! 

Fave tea:  Coconut tea

fave sando: Curried chicken.. YUM!!!!!

Other sandwiches that we had:  cucumber; turkey/sundried tomato/pesto; strawberry and cream cheese; mushroom; brie and apricot?; etc. 

Tea time also came with scones and their dessert of the day which was almond truffle chocolate.  

Perfectly priced at $25-30 per person.  I'd come back here anytime.  

Place is small, so if you have more than 4 people, make reservations.
author: Vicky T.

description:
I work right around the corner, and walk by this place all the time until today! Not too much from the outside (hope that keeps people away hehe) , but the inside is a little hidden Gem from the busy streets of SF.

I have been to Lovejoy's Tea Room many times and love it as well, tends to be very busy and sometimes you have a time limit on your reservation which I feel rushed considering all the food you are getting!  But don't get me wrong, I  still love Lovejoy's! But I am so happy I found a new tea lounge, Dartealing  was as good with their food, and I think the scones are even better! and it was a bonus, not being rushed-so relaxing! But then again, I did go at their slow period considering in was the middle of the day on a Friday .  

 I still love my Lovejoy's but now I love my Dartealing!   Both are very different in their ambiance which is nice, so you can mix it. I love Tea Rooms, so this is a must to visit!
author: Jackie H.

description:
Best kept secret until the crowds arrive. You can still get in for tea on the weekends.
Sumptuous high tea, beautiful settings, good service.  Don't go if you want to eat and run. Go for the pleasure of relaxing with a bottomless pot of tea wonderful sandwiches and scones and beautiful ambiance. It's High tea - an English tradition. Sit back and "smell the tea" and indulge.
author: Katrena M.

description:
i'm not sure honestly if i should rate it a 2 or 3, but  'meh' reflects well. we made a reservation for 8 on a saturday, expecting a fun time with tea and adorability (we've all gone to teahouses elsewhere and know generally what we like and what to expect).

i've got to say the whole thing was awkward from the beginning. when we arrived (5 minutes early) we told the person who greeted us that 2 in our group were almost here. she then asks us if our group would only be six, in a way that tried to make us feel we inconvenienced them in setting aside a table for 8. odd way to start.

immediately, the last of our 2 arrives (on time) and we eventually all decide what to order (the menu is a little confusing and theres a lot of fine print). we were told we could only have 3 tea pots at a time  but our food came with 4 or 5 (cant remember). when we asked if we could change out a tea flavor or two after the first pot they again made it seem like it was an inconvenience to them. at $9 per pot, there shouldn't be a problem since we paid for it.

food came out awkwardly with some of us getting it way before others. since we shared family style it wasnt too bad a problem.

all the portions are small, tiny in fact. from the sandwiches to the cookies to scones. ive never seen a scone that small at a teahouse before. this is also the first tea house we've ever seen without devonshire included, you have to ask for it and its an extra charge.

sandwiches were okay and sweets werent memorable except for the petit four - the filling was tasty and the cake moist. probably in my top favorite but it was the size of a chocolate square/truffle! which would be okay if everything else in our tea for two hadnt also been tiny...and pricey. we all definitely agreed tea for two was the worst deal.

i will say, the place is adorable and great attention was put into decoration. but its definitely more for older ladies quietly lunching rather than a cozy teahouse - def not targeted for our group.

the worst part, was that other than taking our orders and dropping off food/tea the service was non existent. they never came to ask us how we were doing even though it was pretty empty.

the staff spent most of the time talking to each other in front of the few customers. and when we paid our check they didnt even get up to say 'thanks for coming'. 

with how quiet the place was it was kind of hard to hide our uncomfortableness and they must have known/heard we weren't entirely happy. we all kinda laughed when one of our group added an extra $10 to the already very fair 18% for very minimal service bc she thought it would encourage them to do better...

longest review ive given but i tried to be fair enough. for that service and food, i'm not sure exactly what you (highly) pay for.
author: Sam H.

description:
Went to this place with a friend (both for a first time) and we love it instantly! The place is cute with a unique decoration, remind me a bit of my grandma's house, I don't know, maybe because of the sense of "old fashion" which I love. Sandwiches are all good, we tried smoked ham-horseradish cheddar and turkey-pesto cream, and they came with petit fours, chocolate and lavender scones (best scone ever!!). My friend had coconut and I had vanilla tea, which absolutely great. 

Will definitely go back.
author: Tia P.

description: I have been to many high teas from LoveJoys to the Empress in Victoria, and I understand different places put their own twist on tea service, but this place missed the mark. At first glance the room is very quaint and girly, yet looking closer at the  old mis-matched china and thick layer of dust in the room brought the elegance level down many notches.  The staff were all over the place running back and forth through the small room and we still had a hard time getting their attention.  Our food arrived in piecemeal and it made the whole experience feel dis-jointed.  Our scones arrived then we waited 10 minutes to get the lemon curd and jam to put on them.  There was confusion with the menu items by the staff.   The food itself was mediocre at best.  None of the food felt authentic, it felt more like a failed attempt.  The tea was nothing to write home about as it was weak and did not have that robust flavor a good pot of tea should have.  Sorry I can't recommend it.
author: Margot M.

description:
4 1/2 stars!  This is my new favorite tea lounge in SF and the peninsula.  I agree with the other positive reviews about their delightful tea sandwiches, and the desserts are thoughtfully prepared and so perfect with tea or on their own.  The sweets I enjoyed most are the mini fruit and custard puffs and pastel-icing petit four.  With my sandwich and sweets, I tried their Memories of Provence tea.  It didn't smell or taste like, you know, perfume, and it's actually a lavender rooibos, which I would find soothing on any morning or chilling late afternoon.  This place serves as many types of your regular black, green, white teas as signature blends, as well as fruit teas or lavender teas.  
Lastly, I need to give a nod to the service!  I arrived shortly before 5 and my party was the last staying after they have closed.  And even though we were the last customers and were talking and sipping tea for 45 minutes after closing time, they did not rush us, and not only that, service was excellent from beginning to finish.
author: Loraine T.

description:
typically i like the idea that swanky restaurants are tucked away in random areas of the city which you wouldn't think they'd be. the street seems unassuming of anything worthy of your time, but low and behold there's deliciousness through an unmarked door. with that said, i think that the location of DarTealing is almost too odd. it's practically right under the freeway and when i think freeway, i think it's habbiting homeless. not a great place to be for tea and crumpets. especially not great if you're going for a baby shower or bridal shower. i imagine lots of people go sort of dressed up, girly, and almost theme-like. and the location takes away from it all.

on top of the location, the service was just okay. i expect a certain friendliness to come along with a tea room of this type. the women weren't particularly friendly. in fact i'm not even sure i saw any hint of a smile. 

the selection of teas and bites was pretty good, but overall i'd rather find a different place. too bad Crown & Crumpet isn't open anymore.
author: Regina C.

description:
I visited here for the first time today and can't wait to bring all of my tea friends (one at a time) to also indulge. My friend and I had the Seredipi-Tea for Two. It comes with sandwiches, a salad, warm scones and petit fours. 
The scones arrived warm (yes!) and I very much enjoyed the texture. The salad was fresh & crispy and the sandwiches full of flavor (we had chicken curry, smoked salmon & capers & ham and cheese). 
It's so nice to have another high caliber Tea Room to go to in the City.
author: Shivaun O.

description: food was ok, not the best I've had.  I think their sandwiches had a little too much bread.  and the scone was good, but small.
author: Yin L.

description:
Meh. We went here for lunch because a girlfriend was drooling over the menu. We got here, we were the only people there. The service was horrible. There was a younger girl working the room and she was busy the entire time, on her iphone. She never came by to refill drinks, she never came by to check on us. We had to go up to interrupt her netsurfing so we could get water and the bill. 

I was originally excited because the place was decorated very spaciously. However, the food took a while to come out. For sandwiches, I wonder if they had to go make the ingredients from scratch every time a customer orders. Otherwise, why would it take so long? It's not like the stuff is cooked? The place was totally empty with one other table besides us.

I ordered coffee instead of tea because I'm not a tea drinker. Yes, I realize it's a tea place. The coffee was watery and had no taste. The scones were not very fluffy and tasted very bland.

For the price we had to pay, go to Lovejoy's. I was thoroughly disappointed here after having gone to Lovejoy's so many times. They have much faster service, much better food (and their coffee is AWESOME for coffee drinkers), friendlier staff. The staff is always whipping between tables with teapots checking on folks.  I'm STILL hungry after paying $25 for myself. Will not be back here again.
author: Elena R.

description: This is a really cute place for afternoon tea with the girls. Come for a birthday, baby shower or a low key bridal shower. Tea was awesome. The scones were great (though no jam), and actually all the food was good. But be prepared to wait, the service is incredibly slow. When we asked for things they were slow to appear and we were made to feel as though we were demanding or interfering, but in the end were in there for nearly 3 hours... Which is a long time for tea!
author: Sian S.

description:
I work nearby and have had lunch here with coworkers.

The first time, I had the Felici Tea service.  Ordered the fish and chips sandwich and mushroom herbes de provence sandwich.  They were both ok.  The fish and chips was essentially a tuna sandwich with potatoe chips in it.  I liked the rich flavors of the mushroom herbes de provence better.  The lunch came with a small green salad that was delightfully studded with dried cranberries.  I'm not a fan of scones and clotted cream, so I'm not a good judge.  For tea, I had a decent pot of assam with cream and sugar.  (Boy!  Did my productivity shoot through the roof!!)

The second time, I had the savory mushroom bread pudding with bechamel and a green salad.  I LOVED the bread pudding.  Mushroomy, moist (but not soggy) and the savory custard was silky smooth.  The portion was just right.  Paired this lovely repass with a mellow sencha.  

The decor is ecclectic and not really my style, but both times, service was friendly and fantastic.
author: Cherrie C.

description: Perfect! Took my wife for her birthday and she loved it!  Food was fantastic and the tea is sublimely delicious! Great service too! We will definitely go back.
author: Ricardo M.

description: Love this place! I went with my mom for Mother's Day and we didn't have a reservation but they were able to accommodate us. Such a charming place, great tea, and delicious small bites. I recommend it if you're looking for a comfortable spot to catch up with friends, want something cozy and relaxing, and love good tea.
author: Ann H.

description: It was a slow day as we were the only ones in there.  We ordered the Afternoon Tea Service for Two; boy was that EXPENSIVE!  The spicy garlic shrimp was DELICIOUS!  The teas were fragrant.  The tea room is CLEAN & NEW as compared to the other tea houses in the city.
author: Cherry L.

description:
I have a feeling this place is better for an afternoon tea with the girls than it is for events.  We hosted a bridal shower here, and arrived a couple minutes early to set up.  Our tables were not ready, which would be fine if we were there a regular girls day out, but we were there with a party of 16, with guests (including the guest of honor) standing around waiting for our tables to open up - on top of which, we were being charged an extra $150 for extra time.  (We had 2 hrs included with the meal, and it was an extra $75 per half hour after that. Our event was from 3pm-6pm.)  We were met with some resistance when we brought this up, but eventually they agreed to charge us for 30 min extra instead of the full hour.
The experience overall was good.  The decor turned out really nice in pictures, although when I first walked in a felt like there were a lot of unfinished corners.  The guava green tea was good, and I loved the mini fruit filled cream puffs.
author: Maggie L.

description: What a great place!  We had our friends' baby shower there and everything was just perfect.  The owner was so nice and accommodating, even when we asked her to rearrange our large table she was very pleasant and helpful.  They were able to accommodate my gluten free request with a beautiful salad.  The food was excellent!  I recommend the croque monsieur, they looked so delish that I had to go off my gluten-free diet to try one...it was worth it!!  The waitstaff was very attentive but not too overbearing, they refilled our water and teas, and cleared our dishes away at just the right times.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Cannonball Z.

description: Don't let the location discourage you.  This is a excellent business that deserves to grow and expand. One Sunday, Dartealing Lounge hosted 2 full house seatings of people in costumes.  Their menu and décor suited our event plans, but they were also very agreeable and welcoming to our large groups.  I was in the second seating.  The courteous and efficient staff gave no indication that they had already been working for hours serving the first group.  When a full house is seated all at the same time, it's much more difficult to provide smooth, efficient service, and freshly prepared food all at once.  Most restaurants serve guests at intervals.  The food was delicious, the variety of teas tasty and hot and the teapots kept full (a big job in itself).  The staff seemed to be having as much fun as we were.  It was a 5 star day and we're all planning to visit again soon.
author: Deco D.

description:
Ok, so I haven't actually been here yet, but would jump at the chance to meet some gals here for afternoon tea.  
All of the food from my bridal shower was from this place and I am still dreaming about the savory egg plant bread pudding and delicious scones.  The tea sandwiches were amazing and the tea was some of the best I've ever had.
author: Ever L.

description:
Perfect place for a baby shower! The staff was wonderful and the sandwiches, tea, and scones were delicious. Parking was easy too, just bring coins. I highly recommend this place! Thank you DarTealing Lounge for making our party a success!

We had sandwiches: bay shrimp curried, turkey pesto, cucumber with herb spread, egg salad and bacon bits. Teas: Georgia on My Mind (black tea), creme de coconut (rooibos tea), memories of Provence (rooibos tea), jasmine and jade (green tea). Cookies and cream scones and biscotti... All yummy! The teas smelled so good and tasted just as good.
author: Gigette D.

description: I did not go to Dartealing to stay, but just to pick up a small amount of tea to go.  The owner was super sweet and talked to me about different teas and what I was looking for in a tea for about ten minutes.  SHe opened up about 12 jars so I could see and smell all the different teas and she explained a little about each.  She didn't try to sell me a whole bunch of stuff I didn't need.  I really liked her, and the atmosphere, and when I am not sweaty and grungy from the gym, I will def be back to this cute little quaint place.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Five coworkers and I had a lovely lunchtime tea at DarTealing which is within walking distance of our office. We shared two "Tea for Two" services and it was more than enough for all of us. We shared two pots of tea (Assam and Rooibos) and 6 sandwiches (chicken curry, smoked salmon, cucumber and cream cheese, turkey and pesto, mushroom, and brie and chutney.) The sandwiches were served with a lightly dressed green salad which had croutons made from the bread crusts, a clever way to not be wasteful! The sandwiches were followed by scones served with jam, lemon curd and cream (not true clotted cream--I'm sure they thinned it down with something--the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars), and then a two tiered tray of bite-sized sweets. 

The decor is charming, the service was friendly and efficient, and the food was fresh and delicious. This is definitely a great addition to the Bay Area tearoom scene.
author: Lane Y.

description: My Daughter and I enjoyed an Afternoon Tea today.  Thanks in part to discovering it on Bloomspot and taking advantage of the deal.  The place was really cute, and our waitress was wonderful, answering all my questions.  We really enjoyed our food, and our tea was so yummy I bought some loose leaf  to take home.  I think though what made it great was that we only paid half price thanks to bloomspot.  Not sure I would have been as content at full price, as portions are on the small side, but your paying for the experience and it was  great experience.  Dartealing beats our local Fremont tea room hands down, for freshness and flavor.
author: Lauren H.

description:
This is a warning to anyone using a Bloomspot or other similar service: they will do their best not to honor your deal.

This place looked cute so I wanted to try it and bought a Bloomspot deal for it. I called a week before my Bloomspot deal's expiration date to book a reservation and was told that they were booked for the day I wanted to go. I let them know my availability and was told that they might have a slot available and would let me know. The girl who answered the phone - she said her name was Ashley - was extremely rude and disrespectful.

They did not call back. I eventually called again during their working hours and there was no answer. When I finally got a hold of them, the girl rudely told me that I needed to check the website and figure out when they were open, even though I had called during their operating hours.

She then told me they had me down for 4:30 on Thursday, having randomly assigned me to someone's canceled slot without bothering to confirm it with me. When I told her I would not be able to make it to such a random time on such short notice, she said, "So you want to cancel?" as though I had reserved that spot to begin with.

After that point (a little over a week after I first began trying to make my reservation) my coupon expired. Ultimately this was not my fault, as there was no mention that I had to call a month in advance to make a reservation. I tried rescheduling but was told that they could not honor my coupon as it had expired, although I had been pursuing a reservation for a week before its expiration date.

After insisting that I would complain, Ashley told me that they would provide services to me for the value that I paid for the coupon ($26) but not provide the actual service that I bought ($46 value).

I went online to see if I'd had an isolated experience, but found that almost all of the other Bloomspot users had similarly terrible experiences with this place. I don't want anyone else to fall privy to their shadiness, as I wouldn't be surprised if they did not even provide the full service to everyone who purchased a deal, doling out smaller portions along with their surliness.

If the owner of this establishment is reading this: I would advise you not to have anyone like Ashley on your staff. Even if I had been able to use my deal, her demeanor over the phone when I was trying to make a simple reservation was unpleasant, unprofessional, and a turn-off for any customer.
author: Rachel L.

description: Went here yesterday, girly time with my gf, it was sooo good, yummy tea and sandwiches and scone with dessert. I had the pinky minky tea, soo good! I like this place, so cute and so fun!
author: Pia L.

description:
If you are looking for the all around best afternoon tea room in the Bay Area, look no further! This place has it all, gorgeous decor and ambiance, great tea selection, interesting menu and great prices ($17 for a full tea). This is really a fantastic place. The decor is not too sticky sweet, just lovely, with lots of little couches and chairs, and each little table has a private feel to it. The lighting is very nice, which is an important element in creating the right atmosphere. They had some light jazz playing too, a nice touch. 

Now, on to the food-they offer both lunch options and several afternoon tea selections depending on how hungry you are. You can choose from a selection of sandwiches (the smoked salmon is delightful!!) and my tea also included a light salad, 2 scones and dessert, which was more than enough food. They have a nice selection of teas to choose from as well. 

Service is good, we got our pot refilled several times. I sat there for over 3 hours, and never once felt rushed or ignored-I received great service for the entire three hours. I have to agree with another person who says the food is tastier than crown and crumpet, and also quieter than lovejoys. It is refined without being stuffy. It's lovely, but not cutesy. All in all, I would have to say...perfect!
author: Lara W.

description: for what seems like a family operated place, this tea house is pretty nice! the decor is sophisticated and not too gaudy like other tea houses. you get a lot more than you expect and there's no way you can eat everything you're given. probably a good place to host a shower/party.
author: Tammy T.

description:
I'm sooooo glad my friend introduced me to this tea lounge because I won't have to trek all the way out to Noe Valley to go to Love Joys anymore.  In fact, I actually prefer the tea and sandwiches at DarTealing, especially the creamy dreamy earl gray, it's true, it does taste like cupcakes like my friend told me.  The sandwiches we had were super yummy, my favorite one is the shrimp with green onions.  

I deliberately skipped lunch because our reservation was at 1:00.  I am normally a big eater but I was completely stuffed by the end.  Besides tea and sandwiches, we also had scones, petit fours, cookies and bread pudding.  

I had a wonderful afternoon with great company, you're the best DarTealing Lounge :)  I'll definitely be back with my girl pals.
author: s l.

description:
this was my first venture into a truly girly-girl tea shop and the perfect getaway from the testosterone-packed super bowl sunday. i was a little worried at first after reading the yelp reviews about setting up reservations, as we were unsure of how many people were going to join us, but it worked out in the end and we had no problem adjusting down our headcount.

my two gal pals and i had the afternoon serendipi-tea for two +1 and enjoyed a scrumptious array of little finger sandwiches, sweets and our own bottomless pots of tea, including the creme de coconut for me (perfect with a little cream and sugar or by itself), caramel carousel and frolic in phuket. with three tea sets, we were allowed to order four different kinds of sandwiches, so we went for the very popular and tasty curried chicken, the ham, the smoked salmon, and the surprisingly delicious strawberry and cream.

for our sweets we totally lucked out and got the much coveted lavender and white chocolate scones... oh my goodness these were so good! they came out warm and fluffy, more like a biscuit, with this lovely fragrant herbiness from the lavendar and just the right amount of rich sweetness from the white chocolate. there were also mini eclairs and petit fours that were decorated for valentine's day--mine tasted a little like a princess cake with raspberry and marzipan... i should have asked to confirm.

the lovely decor inside completely contrasts with the urban, kind of icky surroundings outside on the street. i loved how there was a mish-mash of all kinds of teawares and jars upon jars of teas and goodies, like an old-style apothecary. the owner (pauline?) was very sweet and came by to chat and answer questions; it must have been a slow day because it was so warm and sunny outside that the staff were actually enjoying tea themselves towards the front of the room. at no point did we feel rushed, but i can imagine it'd be different if they had a big party coming through at the same time.

anyway, would definitely come again just because i'm so fond of the idea of tea with the girls and munching on all kinds of little treats... really do hope they do well and stick around for a while!
author: Andrey C.

description:
The morning started out in a promising way.  A group of us booked a table to celebrate a major milestone in our friend's life - her new baby due in just 2 weeks!  And we met up at Dartealing for tea and then next door for pedicures.  

Unfortunately, what started out as a 3 to 4 star experience ended very badly.   One of our friends booked the table.   She later called (the morning of the tea) to let them know that one of the group had an emergency and could not make it.  She also mentioned it as we were being seated.  The waitress took away the tea service and did not comment on it.  
We enjoyed the tea, sandwiches and scones, and generally it was a nice atmosphere.  The egg salad was not very good (avoid!), but the curry chicken and shrimp salad were excellent (definitely order!).  The tea was good, though it was strange that they just kept allowing it to steep and steep which ended up making some of it quite strong.  Also the water got cold quickly, but I am not sure there is any way for them to prevent that.  The scones were excellent (order!) and the key line curd was quite a good addition.  Together, they were a bit over sweet (scones are usually less sweet, I think).   The crème puffs were good but the petit fours tasted odd (avoid!).  All in all, a pretty good experience though the food was a bit hit or miss.  

I wish the meal ended then because I would be writing a 3 or 4 star review of this place.  When the check came, the waitress included the price of the meal for our friend who did not come.  My friend who set the reservations said that we had mentioned on the way in and also left a message that morning she would not arrive.  So the waitress went to get the owner, Pauline.  The owner said that her policy was that we had to notify her 48 hours in advance of cancellations.  My friend who set it up said that there was no policy in the email.  So the owner left to check.  When she came back, the owner said, "You are right.  I forgot to include the policy in the email, but we served you the food anyways.   And you ate it all so you should pay for it."  Perhaps she did not notice the two boxes of leftovers 5 or 6 sandwiches plus a scone, 3 petit fours, and most of the shortbread was leftover!   We were appalled at her attitude and tone for something which was HER mistake.  Half of the group wanted to argue, but two in the party (including the guest of honor) were concerned about the scene we would end up creating so in the end we paid and left to make our pedicure appointments next door (also owned by Pauline).  

Two comments about Dartealing:
- It was a mistake on the owner's part and *she admitted it*!  And then she proceeded to *insult us*!   If she had said, "Hey this is an honest mistake on my part, but I am a small business owner, can you please pay for the final portion?  I will not charge you gratuity for it since she was not here", we would have paid and left happy.   Instead she insulted us for her own mistake.  Was $25 + $5 gratuity worth insulting your customers including the guest of honor who is due in 2 weeks?  I think not.  
- The cream puffs were good.  They had a lavender glaze on it which was a bitdifferent.  Alas, it was too good to be true.  There was a box just outside their back door (on the way to the bathroom) for cream puffs called "Belgium Minis" - I guess they are not homemade and just added some glaze to it. :(  They should not pass it off as if it is homemade if it comes out of a box that looks like it came from Costco.  The thing was that the difference between the $19 and $25 menu was the crème puffs (good, but store bought) and petit fours (not good).  So save your money and buy some from the store instead of adding the extra $6 to your meal.  

All in all, this left a bad taste in our mouths.  None of us would recommend Dartealing given the insulting owner and complete unprofessionalism.  Next time we will try Samavor which is down the street.  The husband of someone in our group went there during our tea time and raved about it.  Since we found Dartealing on Yelp, I wanted to warn our fellow Yelpers about this bad experience.  Go to Dartealing at your own risk and hope that there is no dispute on the bill.
author: May L.

description:
dartealing lounge is a nice place to be on a stormy afternoon.  

the decor is lovely english countryside, the tea is well prepared (no burnt green tea!), the food is tasty, the service is good, and it's nowhere near as crowded as lovejoy's. 

my two main complaints are 1.) the split-food fee, which will prevent me and my friends from coming here more often and 2.) they leave the crusts on their tea sandwiches
author: Missed F.

description: It was ok. Pretty impressive operation here. I mean, nothing is really unique or super cool. The tea sandwiches read better then they tasted. Honestly, the fillings were meager whispers of what was described. I was actually surprised because when I pay $25 a person - I expect something a little better. I had a blast with the girls I dined with. You pay for the experience and the atmosphere. I loved the colors and the idea of this place. I just felt like the entire time we were there - I knew I could do a better tea party at home with better treats. Service was friendly and patient. Personally, I give credit to ANYONE who can wait on bitching women all day. That would be my nightmare of a serving job. They pull it off with ease. I would go again. But I wont be suggesting it to anyone.
author: Jena D.

description: I came here with my girls to celebrate our Christmas get together and gift exchange. They have the cutest silverware and utensils which are all one of a kind. Each person in your tea party will have different silverware and I just so happen to get the cutest set, lol jk. I can't quite remember what we had but the staff was super nice and friendly. My girls and I literally stayed here for 3 hours. It is in a unknown spot but definitely a treasured place. My girls and I decided to make it tradition that we come here every December.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Unlike somewhere like the Crown & Crumpet that might feel overly pink and girly, DarTealing Lounge's (I love the pun name, too) decor isn't over the top but it is very shabby chic in all the right ways. When my friend and I went, it wasn't crowded and we were able to chose where we wanted to sit, which was great! Two comfy armchairs became our perches for the better part of 3 hours! The AFTERNOON
SERENDIPI-TEA FOR TWO was a great value and the sandwiches were GREAT. 

We couldn't decide which to pick (you get a choice of 3) so we asked the really helpful and nice waitress what she recommended. Originally we were going to get the standard chicken curried sandwich (one of my personal faves now) and cucumber sandwiches, but for the last one I wanted something different and the fish&chips as well as the strawberries and cream sandwich were singing my name. The waitress suggested we forgo the cucumber and get the curry, fish&chips and strawberries instead and boy am I glad we did that! DELICIOUS. 

We got the royal Earl Gray and it was passable tea. The plates we cute, the waitresses refilled the hot water and never rushed us (a must for any tea room) overall, I will be back for more! The scones were good, but the petit flour and mini-cream puff weren't my favorites of the tea set. Still, that's OK because it was worth the while for the other yummy food! I can for see parking being a issue in the area, but I didn't have trouble. Quiet, calming, and relaxing all the things I look for in a tea room!
author: Meghan R.

description:
CUTE CUTE CUTE! Went for holiday tea with the girls and we had a delightful time.  the tea selection was good, in house sammies and sweets were divine.  Owner and staff were delightful and uber attentive.

I'm bummed we just moved our office from SF to Oakland b/c if I were still in SoMa, I'd be here all the time! But I'll be back for sure.
author: S S.

description: I love Dartealing- it's basically every girls dream when they played tea.   Very cute, cosy and feminine.   The food is great but it is a bit expensive.  I suggest trying the fish and chips, curry chicken and strawberries and cream sandwhiches.   The tea selection themselves are vast and eclectic.  Try the caramel tea- YUMMMMMM
author: Tiffany P.

description: If you are looking for afternoon tea, you should come here.  It has an Asian atmosphere.  The food and the portions are great with good service.  I like it here better than The Rotunda.
author: Elena L.

description: My daughter and I used a Travelzoo voucher here last month and had a lovely time.  The food was especially good and very fresh.  The scones were even warm!  Service was good but unobtrusive, and we were never hurried.  It was a lot of food but without the coupon, I would have found it a wee bit expensive.  Again, the food was excellent.
author: Erin P.

description: We stumbled in when after doing some block assessments for our Neighborhood Emergency Response Team (NERT). The assessments require that we walk block-by-block the entire neighborhood, so that when something happens and we ask someone to go to 3rd and Bryant, we will have an accurate assessment of what they can expect to find there. In doing this, we found so many interesting things happening right under our noses. DarTealing Lounge is one of these. I was trying to peek in a window on Stillman, looking for flammables, when someone was peeking back at me. I went in to explain what I was doing and fell in love with this place. It is like the last thing you would expect to find at the corner of Third and Stillman, but it is quite a find. The prices at first seem a bit daunting, but when you consider the number of items you get, it is really pretty reasonable. I can't wait to bring some unsuspecting guests along to experience this find, too.
author: Robert M.

description: Two visits and very pleased.  Whether you are going for tea, lunch or catering this place is top notch. Dartealing just catered a holiday party and the men, women & children were thrilled. The food was creative, tasty and gone in no time. That's the true test! This summer I had a brunch with 10 friends with a selection of salads, warm and cold sandwiches and desserts. Whether you are eating in or taking out you will not be disappointed. I keep going back to try the new menu items.
author: Jane H.

description: Very cute and kitsch tea room that you'd miss if you weren't looking for it.  I had the Serendipitea for Two with 3 sandwich choices (smoked salmon, brie & chutney and curried chicken - in order of preference) - all were delicious.  The tea also comes with a salad, which I've never seen before, but it was fresh and good too.  I wish there had been more pastries (we each had a scone, a small biscuit/wafer, a petit four and a mini-eclair), but what we got was delicious (and probably for the best since we were stuffed by the end). The tea choices seemed overwhelming, but we were both very satisfied with our rooibos options.  I would definitely go again!
author: B. Y.

description: I'm organizing a bridal shower. Have called this place at least 4 times and left messages. No body picks up the phone at any time. I gave up. If the communications service is this way, I just don't want to find out what the food service may be like.
author: Sylvia F.

description: Yet another hidden gem that reminds me why it's so wonderful to live in the city.  Our nice, relaxing meal was a perfect escape from the Giants mayhem everywhere else.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
this place is lovely. it worries me that both times i've been here my friend and i were the only ones in the place; please don't go out of business, Dartealing Lounge! 

the Assam is really nice, as is the lime curd. things are a little bit expensive (i'm pretty sure they don't make their own crumpets or anything), but it's such a pleasant place to sit and relax that it's absolutely worth it. the china is pretty and charmingly mis-matched, and the furniture is all comfy and attractive. 

i plan to come here every couple of weeks for afternoon tea work getaways.
author: dj pie b.

description:
Went here with my girl friend because she had a Scout Mob coupon.  All in all very chill, cute place with nice tea and decent scones and sandwiches.

The service is SUPER slow and the waitress wasn't very attentive.  We had to wait to be seated which I wouldn't mind if the place was busy, but she was just sitting in her office looking at the computer while we waited.

Also, it took about 20 minutes to bring our sandwiches out which was fine since we had our tea.  However, I would have thought it would have been a bit faster.  We had to prompt the waitress for the check because she left us alone which was nice in that we chatted, but not nice if you needed something.

All in all I'd go back again so I'm giving it 4 stars.
author: Michelle P.

description: Her Majesty's Secret Service and Chicken Pesto Tartine. I am now ready for the rest of my life! Be sure to pair with the darling nail shop next door. Perfect for a girl's day out.
author: Apple W.

description: I came here for the sandwiches, but they did disappoint. The lapsong souchong is my usual anywhere if not Assam, and that was delicious. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the seating. Not too busy, but most of their cute stuff was not for sale :(
author: Nathan V.

description:
I love this place! 
I have been there twice and had I known before, I would have loved to have my wedding party or baby shower there! If my friends weren't married already, I would throw them a party there! 

Food: Excellent! The sandwiches, salad, petit fors and cookies are all delicious! All other high teas I have gone to are mediocre but theirs was really delicious! And the scones were to die for! The texture was perfect--not dry at all. Crunchy crispy on the outside and moist and flavorful on the inside. They provide devonshire creme and jams but you really don't need to put anything on them. 

Tea: Many assortments to choose from. Almost overwhelming because there's such a wide selection but it's fun to look over and make a selection with friends. 

Service: Very friendly! The first time I went, I went with my mom and baby. I know it was risky to take a baby but I wanted to check this place out. I happened to go at the right time because there wasn't too many people there. We ended up staying for 2+ hours because my baby fell asleep half way through and that gave me and my mom time to enjoy the tea. The staff never once made us feel rushed or annoyed that we had brought a baby. They were very sincere and down to earth. Some tea houses I've been to before give off a snotty attitude but this place was not anything like that all. I had a chance to talk to the owner and she explained she did this because it was something she enjoyed and loved growing up. I truly feel her passion shows in her work. 
(On my second trip there with other Friends who also had babies), the staff was just as nice--even after one of the kids broke one of their china!!! Again, the staff were really kind and never once did they make us feel unwanted for bringing in small children. 

so in a nut shell, what I feel is noteworthy: 
Food: A+ 
Service: A+ 
Location: A/B 
Atmosphere: A+ 
Parking: Street parking 
Pricing: $$ 
Bathroom: CLEAN! 
Will I go again, YES! 
Recommend: Baby Shower, engagement party, afternoon party/meeting, girls' day out, birthday party
author: Yumi O.

description: I am updating my previous review (below) based on a recent visit to Dartealing after a long hiatus. Now giving them 4 stars for huge improvement in service and, as always, amazing food. I have not yet tried to throw another big group event there but would definitely be open to giving it another shot. Keep up the great work!! I am excited to call Dartealing one of my fave spots again :)
author: M S.

description: Fit for the Queen of England!  After a relaxing  mani-pedi next door, we discovered this darling tea lounge.  Same owners.   What a treat!  Loving the mix of modern and traditional going on in there.  Try everything, especially the coconut tea.
author: Angie N.

description: Great location if you live in SOMA; much more peaceful than Lovejoy's; tastier than Crown & Crumpet; the chef/owner really knows how to pair her teas with the food selection and she makes a badass sardine sandwich! Highly recommended.
author: Johnny O.

description: Such a cute place. Catch up on girl talk with a bottomless pot 'o tea and the absolutely amazing coconut chocolate scone.
author: Emm C.

description:
The place is very cute and cozy but I was very disappointed when they refilled my teapot without changing out the tea. I had to ask them to give me a fresh bag because it wasn't steeping well.  I wonder how many times they would have reused it. It's bottomless tea, I would think they would always steep from new leaves. Also, I didn't like that it was in a bag, I like my loose-leaf tea loose. I think the tea steeps better that way.
The tea itself was delicious. I had a Roobius Coconut Biscuit or some other cookie name on the end. I had it with soymilk. It tasted like English tea cookies. The tea selection was  great! The sandwiches on the other hand were not. The curry chicken was very good, but the other three: turkey, salmon and cucumber were not that tasty. Lovejoy's has a much better selection of tea sandwiches and are always super delicious. I also thought it was a bit pricey for what we got. My scones were delicious but tiny.   
I would definitely go back for the tea, but not the food.
author: Stacya G.

description: I love this place. They have the best ice teas. Every time I go its a wonderful surprise. They have the best tea sandwiches. FIsh and Chips are my favorite!
author: Stacy G.

description: Perfect place to quietly celebrate my mother's birthday with family and friends. We visited during the autumnal buffet. Pleasant experience all around and feel very fortunate to have this place to escape in my neighborhood. Look forward to sneaking away on these approaching winter days, warming up with a delicious tea and scone. Actually maybe I will go tomorrow afternoon. :-)
author: nicole a.

description: Definitely not the best Tea Room in the City.  Tal-Y-Tara Tea Shoppe & Lovejoy's are much better, both food & atmosphere wise.  It's also located in a sketchy part of town...my friends & I were followed by a couple creepy-looking people when we walked back to our car.  Tea selections were limited, the mini sandwiches were teensy-weensy compared to other places & the scones were dry.
author: May L.

description: darTealing lounge is so adorable! i bought the bloomspot deal and took my mom, sister, her 2 daughters & our 2 cousins out for some high tea!  we had a pot of hot chocolate along with 3 different types of teas which included a black tea called the "big keemum on campus",  a green tea called "cabana boy" and an oolong tea called "in dew time". to eat, we had the classic cucumber with fresh herbs, turkey & pesto cream, darjeeling curried chicken, smoked salmon & capers, strawberries & cream and PB&J.  of course, no high tea is complete without some cookies & biscuits!  paired with the lemon curd and the biscuits are super yummy!!! there was more than enough sandwiches and tea to go around and we have a lovely family filled afternoon! definitely a day to remember!  the service was a bit slow but all in all, we had a nice time here.
author: Vic S.

description:
I have been living in england for a few years and I know what a good "high tea" is supposed to be like. This is the best of its kind that I have found this side of the great pond.
The design is very "Laura ashley", flowery and slightly old fashioned in a charming way. The service is extraordinarily attentive and awesome.

I had the sweet tea jane, which is absolutely divine. It comes with a bottomless pot of tea (I chose strawberry rhubarb, which is delicious, just ask for it to be brewed strong!), two little homemade freshly baked scones (in this case strawberry scones) which are super delicious yet tiny (think two scones make a little under a normal sized one), a petit four (nice but not world changing), a few biscuits (ok) and a little eclair (the best!).
You get imported british clotted cream and lemon curd (a british speciality which is a mixture of sugar and lemon juice. Give it try, its yum!) as well as some jam.
A+ for the service, the eclair and the scones.
A for the overall atmosphere.
B for the quantity vs price.  You get  very little food for your 19$.
However its a great experience and its a super place to take a tea savy, sweet-toothed girlfriend for an afternoon tea and enjoy life.
Do check it out!
author: Sandra T.

description: Excellent place. For a guy who loves tea, it is very difficult to find a tea room that's not too girly. Lovejoy's in particular gives a man an estrogen overload, but this place had a perfect decor, excellent teas and delicious food. A bit pricey, but the service is good and the tea is better.
author: Slav F.

description: I love going to tea. I have been to every tea place in the city. Lovejoy's, Rotunda, Palace Hotel, Taly-Tara, Crown & Crumpet, Secret Tea Garden, etc. Somehow I find myself here very often. Can't beat the quality and value here.
author: Liz H.

description: This is one of my favorite little gems in the city. The food is flavorful and delicious and the tea selection is among the best I have ever seen. I love their coconut iced tea. It's a refreshing treat! You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches (my personal faves are the roasted red pepper with hummus and the curried chicken) and the asian chicken salad is amazing.  The service is personal and you never feel rushed. Make sure to call ahead because they are an intimate space, but you won't be disappointed. Thank you, Dartealing, for bringing a little bit of London to SOMA!
author: Maureen K.

description: This was my first tea service experience and I absolutely loved it! The vintage decor and mismatched tea sets were beautiful. The stuff was busy but very friendly and warm... We even got to speak to the owner for a bit. The tea was great and the food was delicious. Not knowing what to expect, I'd say that the Dartealing Lounge definitely set the bar high! I can't wait to bring my friends!!
author: Ashley L.

description: This place is a real treat, not just because it has an awesome tea selection and excellent-quality food, but because it really has ambiance. It transports you to another time and place, which is something that is very hard to find these days. The owner is very kind and has really spent a lot of time getting the details right. it's a great place for a wedding shower of course, but it's also a wonderful place to meet a friend for a long conversation or to have a nice lunch. Note that it's closed on Mon & Tues!
author: B C.

description:
Full disclousure! I own a Tea Salon here in San Francisco and I loved this new tea lounge!
It is so nice to go to a tea salon that some one else runs so that I can sit back and relax,  enjoy a pot of tea and some fine tasting tea fare and not have to worry about a thing! 
Dartealing is fab !
 The decor is charming, the tea selection is diverse and the tea sandwiches and scones are imaginative, fresh and delicious. Had a great chat with the lovely owners  and could have stayed for hours more! But had to get back to work and serve up some tea myself! 
Parking is pretty easy. Add Dartealing to your list of great tearooms in San Francisco!!
author: Amy D.

description: I came in for a quick brunch snack - I was headed to Whole Foods and it's always dangerous to grocery shop while hungry. The lavender scones were the BEST I've ever had - and I've had 'proper' tea in London many times. Pauline, how do you do it?! Perhpas it was more dangerous to eat here after all...I'll DEFINITELY be back! :)
author: Mona T.

description: I have tried a lot of tea houses in San Francisco, and I think this one is the best. Four of us had tea there today and it was lovely. It was very good value and we could not finish everything. At other places the price is ridiculously high and you leave hungry. Each one of us had our own bottomless tea pot. The sandwiches and salad were great and the petite fours were excellent. The scones were really good too, although I preferred the plain ones - I'm not a fan of chocolate chips.  The service was friendly and they very kind to the child in our group. I guess we were in a good mood because there is tons of parking right outside and there was no wait for a table. It is very nicely decorated and much more roomy than other places - the tables are set at comfortable distances from each other.
author: Maude G.

description:
DarTealing is by far the best tearoom in the Bay Area and you get alot for your money from the bottomless tea, tea sandwiches, salad, scones, petit fours, and tea cookies. Unlike other tearooms that leave you hungry and frankly, feeling a little ripped off, DarTealing offers the perfect full meal at a great value. 

There is so much to love about DarTealing it's hard to know where to begin so let's break it down:

The Food 
If you're a foodie like I am, this place will not disappoint. Having been here at least a half a dozen times, I can honestly say that I've tried every single sandwich and they are all fantastic. It is so easy to get carried away with these scrumptuous sandwiches that you may find yourself eating an equivalent to half a loaf of bread, as I have done on many occasions. They have an extensive selection of sandwiches but not all are offered at once which is okay because you will want to come back often. They have the traditonals (smoked salmon, cucumber, etc.) and the whimsical curveballs (fish 'n' chips).  If you do manage to pry yourself away from the tea sandwiches, you should absolutely try the croque monsieur which is perfectly cooked (not soggy or too rich) and any of their entree salads. 

The Sweets 
I do not exaggerate when I say that their scones are the best I've ever tasted in any shop or bakery. They are light and fluffy with the right amount of moistness and oh-so buttery that they practically melt in your mouth. I could eat these baked mounds of heaven every single day of my existence. My favorite is the strawberry flavor but there are other non-traditional options like apple bacon and white chocolate lavender. 

The Tea 
Equally matched to their large sandwich selection is their teas which come in many delicious flavors. If you want a bit of a jolt try their caffeinated Dreamy Earl Grey or Kyoto Cherry Rose. Personally, I could consume gallons of their decaf Coconut Custard and Creme Caramel.

The Service 
The waitstaff is friendly and eager to please. They can help guide you through the extensive menu and make very helpful suggestions on food pairings.  

The Decor 
I have been here with girlfriends and manfriends and the decor is inviting to both sexes. The cool interior colors, antique furniture,  artfully decorated walls, and hodge podge accessories create a wonderfully calm ambiance that only adds to the delightful meal. 

Finally, you can wear off the inevitable food coma by hopping next door to Polished Lounge and getting a mani-pedi to complete your total body pampering.  What's there not to love?
author: Kim N.

description:
Beautiful decor, great and varied food, pleasant service, wonderful music, a completely relaxing atmosphere... this is the TEA shop. Perfect for lunch too. I love this place. And parking is possible!
It's hard to decide which sandwich is better... curried chicken, pulled beef, gentlemen's relish and on and on.
author: Holly E.

description: total disclaimer - i am a devotee of polished for the last 6 years so i love anything keith and pauline touch.  but regardless of my bias, this is such a hidden gem in soma to get tea.  the sandwiches are delicious (my personal fav -- the fish n chips), the tea selection plentiful, and the scones and petit fours always hit the spot. esp when the scones are served with the lemon curd.  they're so toasty coming out of the oven and melt in your mouth!  i come out of here every time full of food and very happy.  great to do a bachelorette party (done that before and it was a big hit for my friend) and get togethers with friends (my friends and i have a running quarterly tea get together here).
author: Cathy L.

description: Had a wonderful afternoon tea with my girls. Cute place, lots of parking and chicken pesto sandwich was awesome. Great place for bridal and baby showers.
author: P J.

description: Great value for tea.  Very generous progression of tea sandwiches and sweets.  They will refill your tea pot as many times as you like and never rush you.  The interior is cute and lots of room.  Will come here again!
author: Elizabeth N.

description: This place is fantasic and the coconut tea is really some of the best I have ever had. Loved going with the girls. Really the best day.
author: ganceeb b.

description: Geez, it was my birthday but it felt like doomsday at DarTealing!  Arrived promptly on December 29th, before 1:30 reservation with my mom, sisters and niece.  Nobody acknowledged we were even there in addition to two other groups of ladies.  We were all exasperated by 2:00 when we were finally seated.  2:15 rolled around and nobody had said hi and no sign of tea or anything else.  We actually had to flag down one of the servers to request service.  The epitome of lousy service arrived at our table and actually said this: "I heard you ladies would like to order" No hello, no sorry for the wait, nothing!  My niece couldn't let that go and told her she was rude.  She rolled her eyes.  We finally got some tea at 2:25.  Then she scolded us for having commandeered one of their "regular" menus (it was laying on the table) instead of their special holiday menu.  Finally got our sandwiches, etc. but not anything I would describe as exceptional.  This place needs SUPERVISION, a HOSTESS, a MANAGER on duty.  Then the fine art of making things better when you screw up, like offering something extra or just saying, "sorry we ruined your birthday".
author: Carole D.

description: Very nice tearoom and lovely afternoon tea. We had the Serendipi-Tea for Two which was a great value for the amount of food and tea ($40). The finger sandwiches were delicious, especially the Shrimp Primavera. I especially liked the house-made Devonshire cream that accompanied the scones. The teas were delicious and properly brewed. My friend and I really loved everything. I'll definitely be back for more tea. This is a gem of tearoom and so much better than any other afternoon tea around the city.
author: Anh T.

description: My partner and I went here for sunday brunch -- the food was delicious and the staff was wonderful. We will definitely go back -- and recommend it to friends.
author: m j.

description: I've been to all the tea salons in SF (and elsewhere) and this one is truly the BEST!! I'm here at least once a week (sometimes twice when I can escape from work) for lunch and it's my boyfriend's new fav. brunch place. First, there's the amazing selection of tea. I've tried most of them but keep going back to a few favorites--Coconut Roobois, Tuscany Pear, Ginger green tea....actually they're all good so you can't go wrong. Next, there's the food. Oh my goodness the FOOD is incredible! Pauline (the owner) knows how to whip up an amazing Asian chicken salad and definitely the best croque monsieur ever. I don't know what she puts in those little sandwiches but I can't stop eating them (they look small but don't be deceived--they're super filling)--I've tried almost all of them and each one is better than the next. The side salad is always fresh and organic. And then when you think you can't eat anymore, they bring out a tray of strawberry scones with clotted cream (YUM!!), jam, and lemon custard---so surely you must devour these. A bit more tea please and then of course, dessert--petit fours, tea cookies, mini eclairs dusted with chocolate....Ahhh...Did I mention the adorable decor? Makes you feel like you've stepped back in time into an English tearoom from a Jane Austen novel. Then when the last drop of tea is done, it's time to head over to Polished Lounge next door and take a little snooze while getting your nails done. Actually, this is exactly what my girlfriends and I did last week and it was a divine day--we all went home feeling full, pretty, and totally relaxed. Every day should be a DarTealing day.
author: Bobbie B.
